translated: Because the intrinsic nature of the subjective aspect is seen in the manner of reality, it is like the continuity of a flowing river.

original: yang na dpe dang dpe las byung ba bdag la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dpe dang dpe las byung ba bdag la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
translated: Or, the hidden meaning is that there is no difference between the example and the one who understands the example.

original: da ni rang bzhin rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes par bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: da ni rang bzhin rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes par bya ba'i don du /
translated: Now, in order to fully understand the intrinsic nature of the intrinsic natures,🔽it is said:

original: ye shes 'jug pa'i ngo bo yis //
analyzed: ye shes 'jug pa'i ngo bo yis //
translated: By the nature of the engagement of wisdom,

original: dbye ba ji bzhin shes byas la //
analyzed: dbye ba ji bzhin shes byas la //
translated: having understood the divisions as they are,

original: rang bzhin nyid ni slar yang ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid ni slar yang ni //
translated: the intrinsic nature

original: rtag tu rnal 'byor pas mtshon bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rtag tu rnal 'byor pas mtshon bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: should always be realized by the yogi.

original: ye shes 'jug pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni shes pa rnams dang 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes 'jug pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni shes pa rnams dang 'jug pa ste /
translated: The nature of the engagement of wisdom refers to the engagement of consciousnesses.

original: rang bzhin rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo dbye ba ji bzhin te dbye ba'i rim pa shes par bya zhing rtogs par byas la thabs dang shes rab dang ma rig pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i rang bzhin de dag nyid mtshon par bya zhing bsgom par bya ba
analyzed: rang bzhin rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo dbye ba ji bzhin te dbye ba'i rim pa shes par bya zhing rtogs par byas la thabs dang shes rab dang ma rig pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i rang bzhin de dag nyid mtshon par bya zhing bsgom par bya ba
translated: The nature of the natures should be known just as they are divided, that is, the divisions should be understood and realized, and those natures, which abide as the nature of method and wisdom and ignorance, should be illustrated and meditated upon.

original: ste sbas pa'o //
analyzed: ste sbas pa'o //
translated: That is the hidden meaning.

original: de ltar rang bzhin rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba shes par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba shes par byas nas /
translated: Having thus understood the divisions of the natures,🔽in order to illustrate the nature of clear light,

original: 'od gsal ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin par yang mtshon par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin par yang mtshon par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: ji ltar sprin ni sna tshogs shing //
analyzed: ji ltar sprin ni sna tshogs shing //
translated: Just as various clouds

original: mdog dang dbyibs ni tha dad pa //
analyzed: mdog dang dbyibs ni tha dad pa //
translated: with different colors and shapes

original: nam mkha'i dbyings nas byung nas ni //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings nas byung nas ni //
translated: arise from the realm of space

original: de nyid du ni thim par 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid du ni thim par 'gyur //
translated: and dissolve back into it,

original: de bzhin rang bzhin thams cad ni //
analyzed: de bzhin rang bzhin thams cad ni //
translated: so all natures

original: snang ba gsum gyi rgyu can te //
analyzed: snang ba gsum gyi rgyu can te //
translated: have the three appearances

original: ma lus yul rnams spangs nas ni //
analyzed: ma lus yul rnams spangs nas ni //
translated: and, having abandoned all objects,

original: 'od gsal bar ni 'jug par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'od gsal bar ni 'jug par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: enter into clear light.

original: ji ltar sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i mdog dang phra ba dang rags pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi rnam pa dang ldan pa'i @95a * //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i mdog dang phra ba dang rags pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi rnam pa dang ldan pa'i @95a * //
translated: Just as clouds, which have the aspect of colors such as blue and yellow and shapes such as fine and coarse,

original: sprin te / char 'dzin pa rnams nam mkha'i dbyings nas te /
analyzed: sprin te / char 'dzin pa rnams nam mkha'i dbyings nas te /
translated: arise from the realm of space,

original: nam mkha'i dkyil nas 'byung zhing langs nas slar nam mkha' de nyid du thim zhing zhi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil nas 'byung zhing langs nas slar nam mkha' de nyid du thim zhing zhi bar 'gyur te /
translated: from the middle of the sky, and having arisen, dissolve and disappear again into that very sky.

original: de rnams gang nas 'ongs pa'am gang du song ba mi shes pa de ltar 'jig rten gyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams gang nas 'ongs pa'am gang du song ba mi shes pa de ltar 'jig rten gyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The world understands that one cannot know where they come from or where they go.

original: de bzhin du rang bzhin thams cad rnam par shes pa gsum las byung nas rang rang gi 'dod pa'i yul dpyad nas chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi de kho na nyid bzhi pa 'od gsal bar 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang bzhin thams cad rnam par shes pa gsum las byung nas rang rang gi 'dod pa'i yul dpyad nas chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi de kho na nyid bzhi pa 'od gsal bar 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, all natures arise from the three consciousnesses, and having analyzed their desired objects, they enter into the fourth, the nature of the dharmakāya, which is clear light.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni phyis de'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni phyis de'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, whatever is the nature of something, later it becomes that nature.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi 'grel pa las //🔽bu ram gyi ni mngar dang me'i //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi 'grel pa las // bu ram gyi ni mngar dang me'i //
translated: In the Commentary on the Awakening Mind, it says:🔽Just as sweetness is the nature of molasses

original: tsha ba rang bzhin yin pa ltar //
analyzed: tsha ba rang bzhin yin pa ltar //
translated: and heat is the nature of fire,

original: de bzhin kho nar chos rnams kyi //
analyzed: de bzhin kho nar chos rnams kyi //
translated: in the same way,

original: stong pa rang bzhin yin par 'dod //
analyzed: stong pa rang bzhin yin par 'dod //
translated: emptiness is the nature of all phenomena.

original: ces bya ba gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du gzhan las kyang /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du gzhan las kyang /
translated: And in another text, it says:

original: ae ma ho //
analyzed: ae ma ho //
translated: Amazing!

original: ri mo sna tshogs yang dag don gyi rnam par shes pa bzhin du yang //
analyzed: ri mo sna tshogs yang dag don gyi rnam par shes pa bzhin du yang //
translated: Just like the various patterns on a drawing,

original: mnyam dang mi mnyam mtho dman rtog pa'i blo yis 'khrul pa skyed par byed //🔽'khor ba thog ma med nas sems kyi nam mkha'i dbyings la bris pa yi //
analyzed: mnyam dang mi mnyam mtho dman rtog pa'i blo yis 'khrul pa skyed par byed // 'khor ba thog ma med nas sems kyi nam mkha'i dbyings la bris pa yi //
translated: the mind, through thoughts of equality and inequality, high and low, creates confusion.🔽Since beginningless time, the three worlds of existence have been deceived

original: brdzun ma'i kun du rtog pa dag gis srid gsum 'di ni bslus pa yin //
analyzed: brdzun ma'i kun du rtog pa dag gis srid gsum 'di ni bslus pa yin //
translated: by false conceptual thoughts drawn in the space of the mind.

original: zhes gsungs te mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te mthar thug pa'o //
translated: This is the ultimate.

original: rang gi ngo bo rnams yongs su ma shes pa'i rnam par rmongs pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rnams yongs su ma shes pa'i rnam par rmongs pa ni /
translated: The delusion of not fully understanding the nature of things is as follows.

original: de yi rang bzhin ma shes pas //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin ma shes pas //
translated: Since its nature is not understood,

original: mi shes pas //
analyzed: mi shes pas //
translated: there is ignorance.

original: mi shes mun pas khebs pa rnams //
analyzed: mi shes mun pas khebs pa rnams //
translated: Those who are covered by the darkness of ignorance

original: dge dang mi dge'i las byas nas //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge'i las byas nas //
translated: Having performed virtuous and non-virtuous actions,

original: 'gro ba lnga ni 'khor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga ni 'khor bar 'gyur //
translated: one cycles in the five migrations.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: de'i zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa dang rang bzhin gyi tshogs rnams kyi rang bzhin yongs su ma shes nas mi shes mun pa ste gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dra bas khebs shing non pa'i rmongs pa rnams sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa dang rang bzhin gyi tshogs rnams kyi rang bzhin yongs su ma shes nas mi shes mun pa ste gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dra bas khebs shing non pa'i rmongs pa rnams sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba
translated: Having not understood the nature of the consciousness and the aggregates, the ignorant ones, covered and oppressed by the net of afflictions such as ignorance, delusion, and so on, having performed virtuous actions such as generosity,

original: byas nas bde 'gro nyid thob par 'gyur zhing de bzhin mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba byas nas dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas nas bde 'gro nyid thob par 'gyur zhing de bzhin mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba byas nas dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: attain the happy migrations. Likewise, having performed non-virtuous actions such as the heinous actions, they go to the hells.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba lnga'i bdag nyid kyi srid pa'i 'khor lor 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba lnga'i bdag nyid kyi srid pa'i 'khor lor 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they cycle in the wheel of existence, which has the nature of the five migrations.

original: de nyid khyad par du /
analyzed: de nyid khyad par du /
translated: That itself is distinguished:

original: mtshams med la sogs byas nas ni //
analyzed: mtshams med la sogs byas nas ni //
translated: Having committed the heinous actions and so on,

original: dmyal la sogs pa 'tshed par 'gyur //
analyzed: dmyal la sogs pa 'tshed par 'gyur //
translated: one is boiled in the hells and so on.

original: sbyin sogs @95b dge ba byas nas ni //
analyzed: sbyin sogs @95b dge ba byas nas ni //
translated: Having performed virtuous actions such as generosity,

original: mtho ris la sogs dag tu mchod //
analyzed: mtho ris la sogs dag tu mchod //
translated: one is worshipped in the higher realms and so on.

original: skye ba dpag med stong phrag ni //
analyzed: skye ba dpag med stong phrag ni //
translated: For countless thousands of lives,

original: yang dang yang du 'thob pa nyid //
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'thob pa nyid //
translated: again and again, you will obtain

original: 'di ni sngon las rnam smin zhes /
analyzed: 'di ni sngon las rnam smin zhes /
translated: this result of former karma.

original: rmongs pa dag ni mya ngan byed //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rmongs pa dag ni mya ngan byed // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The confused grieve over it.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba byas pas bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag tu bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong nas /🔽yang de nas 'chi 'phos te skye ba stong phrag dpag tu med par yang dang yang du srid par nyin mtshams sbyor ba thob nas shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i dbang gis rmongs pa rnams 'di skad du ae ma'o 'di ni sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba byas pas bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag tu bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong nas / yang de nas 'chi 'phos te skye ba stong phrag dpag tu med par yang dang yang du srid par nyin mtshams sbyor ba thob nas shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i dbang gis rmongs pa rnams 'di skad du ae ma'o 'di ni sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i
translated: Having experienced pleasure and pain in good and bad rebirths due to the performance of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma,🔽again, after death and transmigration, you will obtain rebirth in existence for countless thousands of lives, again and again, for a long time.

original: 'gyur ba'o zhes smra bar byed do //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'o zhes smra bar byed do //
translated: Due to the power of great suffering, the confused say, “Alas! This is the result of former karma.

original: rang bzhin gyi tshogs ma gtogs par sngon gyi las zhes bya ba don dam pa rnam par dpyad na yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi tshogs ma gtogs par sngon gyi las zhes bya ba don dam pa rnam par dpyad na yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Apart from the natural collection of causes and effects, former karma does not exist in ultimate analysis.

original: rang bzhin rnams kho na 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i dngos pos srid pa gsum du 'khor bar byed la /
analyzed: rang bzhin rnams kho na 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i dngos pos srid pa gsum du 'khor bar byed la /
translated: The natures alone, by the process of going and coming, cause the three realms of existence to revolve.

original: sngon ma byung ba'i sngon gyi las ni yod pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon ma byung ba'i sngon gyi las ni yod pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: The prior karma that has not yet occurred does not exist.

original: da ni rang bzhin rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa kho na 'thad pa yin par /
analyzed: da ni rang bzhin rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa kho na 'thad pa yin par /
translated: Now, the understanding of the nature of the natures alone is tenable.

original: rang bzhin snang ba dang ldan pas //
analyzed: rang bzhin snang ba dang ldan pas //
translated: The one who has the appearance of the natures

original: gang gi skye bo nyon mongs pa //
analyzed: gang gi skye bo nyon mongs pa //
translated: whose beings are afflicted

original: de nyid shes nas ye shes can //
analyzed: de nyid shes nas ye shes can //
translated: knows reality and has wisdom.

original: srid pa'i gzeb las grol bar 'gyur //🔽zhes ba bya gsungs te /
analyzed: srid pa'i gzeb las grol bar 'gyur // zhes ba bya gsungs te /
translated: He is liberated from the cage of existence.

original: rang bzhin rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The one who has the appearance of the natures has the three natures.

original: rnam par shes pa de rnams dang ldan pas te de rnams dang 'grel bas so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de rnams dang ldan pas te de rnams dang 'grel bas so //
translated: He has the consciousnesses, because he has them and is connected with them.

original: gang gi skye bo ste so so'i skye bo rnams 'khor ba'i dgon par nyon mongs pa ni 'gro ba drug gi rab tu dbye bas 'gro ba dang 'ong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi skye bo ste so so'i skye bo rnams 'khor ba'i dgon par nyon mongs pa ni 'gro ba drug gi rab tu dbye bas 'gro ba dang 'ong bar byed pa'o //
translated: Whose beings are afflicted: the beings of the world are afflicted by going and coming in the forest of cyclic existence, by the divisions of the six kinds of transmigration.

original: de nyid shes nas te sngar bshad pa'i rim pas shes nas ye shes can gyi rnal 'byor pa srid pa'i gzeb ste 'khor ba las grol bar 'gyur zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid shes nas te sngar bshad pa'i rim pas shes nas ye shes can gyi rnal 'byor pa srid pa'i gzeb ste 'khor ba las grol bar 'gyur zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Knowing that reality, i.e., knowing it by the process explained above, the yogi/nī who has gnosis will be liberated, will be released from the cage of existence, i.e., saṃsāra.

original: 'dod chags la sogs dri bcas sems //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs dri bcas sems //
translated: The mind with the stains of attachment, etc.

original: 'khor ba yin te des dben pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba yin te des dben pa //
translated: is saṃsāra.

original: mdor na thar pa yin par ni //
analyzed: mdor na thar pa yin par ni //
translated: Liberation, in brief, is

original: rgyal ba sgrib pa spangs pas gsungs //
analyzed: rgyal ba sgrib pa spangs pas gsungs //
translated: the elimination of that, taught by the Victorious One, who is free of obscurations.

original: de bzhin du rig pa drug cu pa las kyang /🔽las rnams 'bras bcas nyid dang ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du rig pa drug cu pa las kyang / las rnams 'bras bcas nyid dang ni //
translated: Similarly, the Yuktiṣaṣṭikā says:🔽Actions and their effects and also the world

original: 'gro ba rnams kyang yang dag gsungs //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyang yang dag gsungs //
translated: are taught correctly.

original: de yi rang bzhin yongs shes phyir //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin yongs shes phyir //
translated: In order to know their nature completely,

original: skye ba med pa'ang bstan pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la @96a * //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'ang bstan pa yin // zhes bya ba la @96a * //
translated: non-arising is also taught.

original: sogs pa gang gsungs pa de mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa gang gsungs pa de mthar thug pa'o //
translated: This is the final position.

original: da ni ye shes gsum gyi rnal 'byor gyis sems rnam par dag pa la 'jug par mi nus shing /
analyzed: da ni ye shes gsum gyi rnal 'byor gyis sems rnam par dag pa la 'jug par mi nus shing /
translated: Now, those who are unable to enter the purification of the mind through the yoga of the three gnoses

original: 'on kyang de nyid zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha'i gzugs su sgyur bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni brtags pa'i rnal 'byor pa yin gyi rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha'i gzugs su sgyur bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni brtags pa'i rnal 'byor pa yin gyi rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: shes rab ngo bo 'di nyid ni //
analyzed: shes rab ngo bo 'di nyid ni //
translated: This very nature of wisdom

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dag tu brtag //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dag tu brtag //
translated: is imagined as a moon mandala.

original: sems nyid rang gis mthong 'gyur te //
analyzed: sems nyid rang gis mthong 'gyur te //
translated: The mind itself is seen

original: rang nyid zla ba'i gzugs bzhin no //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rang nyid zla ba'i gzugs bzhin no // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: just like one’s own moon form.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lor rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs yi ge aom dang ldan par byas nas de'i rten du gyur pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid du rnam par bsams nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de nyid rang bzhin gyis dag pa nyid
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lor rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs yi ge aom dang ldan par byas nas de'i rten du gyur pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid du rnam par bsams nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de nyid rang bzhin gyis dag pa nyid
translated: Having entered into the wheel of the realm of reality, one should make it endowed with the syllable oṃ. Having imagined that moon mandala as the nature of wisdom, that very moon mandala is seen as one’s own mind.

original: yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is naturally pure,

original: rang gi sems nyid du mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi sems nyid du mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: one’s own mind is seen.

original: ji skad du dpal de kho na nyid bsdus pa las rigs kyi bu khyod kyi sems la so sor rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dmigs par gyis shig ces gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du dpal de kho na nyid bsdus pa las rigs kyi bu khyod kyi sems la so sor rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dmigs par gyis shig ces gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: As the Shri-paramādya-samgraha says, “Son of a good family, you should focus on the meditative stabilization of the discernment of your own mind.”

original: de'i 'og tu ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What should one do after that?🔽Therefore, it says:

original: de'i phyir / de nas zla ba la dmigs nas //🔽rdo rje'i mtshan mar rab tu brtag / rdo rje sems 'di bskyed pa yi //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de nas zla ba la dmigs nas // rdo rje'i mtshan mar rab tu brtag / rdo rje sems 'di bskyed pa yi //
translated: Then, having focused on the moon,🔽one should imagine the vajra sign.🔽This is the method taught by the yogi

original: rnal 'byor pa yi thabs ston byed //🔽ces bya bas gsungs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yi thabs ston byed // ces bya bas gsungs te /
translated: who generates this vajra mind.

original: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor 'od gsal ba la bltas nas snang ba skyes pa'i dus su /
analyzed: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor 'od gsal ba la bltas nas snang ba skyes pa'i dus su /
translated: Then, having looked at the clear light of the moon mandala, at the time of the arising of the appearance,

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rdo rje'i steng gi tsheg drag gi gzugs dang gcig tu gyur pa'i rdo rje'i mtshan ma rab tu brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rdo rje'i steng gi tsheg drag gi gzugs dang gcig tu gyur pa'i rdo rje'i mtshan ma rab tu brtag par bya ste /
translated: one should imagine the vajra sign, which is the form of the visarga on the vajra situated on the sun mandala, as one.

original: de'i tshe ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rdo rje de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi thabs ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rdo rje de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi thabs ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: At that time, because it has the nature of the five pristine wisdoms, that vajra is the means of teaching the method for the yogis of the stage of generation.

original: lha'i rnam pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de nas ci zhig bya zhe na ;
analyzed: lha'i rnam pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de nas ci zhig bya zhe na ;
translated: Because it is the cause of the form of the deity, what is done after that?🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / zla ba rdo rje sogs sbyor ba //
analyzed: de'i phyir / zla ba rdo rje sogs sbyor ba //
translated: The union of moon, vajra, and so forth,

original: sems dang sems byung 'dus pa ste //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung 'dus pa ste //
translated: The union of mind and mental factors,

original: shes rab thabs ni 'dus pa las //
analyzed: shes rab thabs ni 'dus pa las //
translated: From the union of wisdom and means,

original: lha yi gzugs ni 'byung bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lha yi gzugs ni 'byung bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The form of the deity will arise.

original: de nas zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa bsgom pa spangs nas gang gi tshe snang ba nye bar thob @96b pa la 'jug pa de'i tshe rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa bsgom pa spangs nas gang gi tshe snang ba nye bar thob @96b pa la 'jug pa de'i tshe rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa yin no //
translated: After that, when the yogi abandons the meditation of the moon, vajra, and so forth, and at that time enters into the attainment of appearance, then he is a yogi of the stage of completion.

original: gang gi tshe 'jug par mi byed cing 'on kyang de yongs su gyur pa'i lha'i skur skad cig gis bskyed nas sgom par byed pa de'i tshe ni brtags pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'jug par mi byed cing 'on kyang de yongs su gyur pa'i lha'i skur skad cig gis bskyed nas sgom par byed pa de'i tshe ni brtags pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one does not engage in that, but rather generates the deity's body, which is a transformation of that, in an instant, and meditates on that, then at that time one is a yogi of the imagined deity.🔽That is stated:

original: de nyid gsungs pa zla ba rdo rje la sogs sbyor ba ste de dag ro gcig tu gyur pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa zla ba rdo rje la sogs sbyor ba ste de dag ro gcig tu gyur pa /
translated: The union of the moon, vajra, and so forth, which have become of one taste,🔽the wisdom of the nature of mind and mental factors, method and wisdom,

original: sems dang sems byung thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi ye shes dag 'dus pa las lha'i gzugs te rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i lha'i rnam pa 'byung zhing skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi ye shes dag 'dus pa las lha'i gzugs te rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i lha'i rnam pa 'byung zhing skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: from the gathering of those, the form of the deity, the form of the deity of Great Vajradhara and so forth, arises and is born.

original: de'i tshe ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What should one do at that time?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / phyag rgya bzhis ni rgyas btab nas //
analyzed: de'i phyir / phyag rgya bzhis ni rgyas btab nas //
translated: Having sealed with the four seals,

original: lha yi nga rgyal 'chang byed de //🔽bskyed pa'i rim dang ldan par ni //
analyzed: lha yi nga rgyal 'chang byed de // bskyed pa'i rim dang ldan par ni //
translated: one should maintain the pride of the deity.🔽The mantrin should always engage in conduct

original: sngags pa rtag tu spyod par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sngags pa rtag tu spyod par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: endowed with the creation stage.

original: de'i rjes la sku rdzogs pa na dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang bcing ba dang dbang du bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la sku rdzogs pa na dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang bcing ba dang dbang du bya ba ste /
translated: After that, when the body is complete, there is summoning, entering, binding, and controlling.🔽

original: phyag rgya bzhis ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa la sogs pa'i don du rgyas btab nas sam /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhis ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa la sogs pa'i don du rgyas btab nas sam /
translated: Then, after the body is complete, one should seal with the four seals, summoning, inducting, binding, and controlling.

original: yang na sangs rgyas spyan dang m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma ste //
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas spyan dang m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma ste //
translated: Or else, one should seal with the four seals, Buddha Locana, Māmakī, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, and Tārā,

original: phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab nas te 'khor nyid kyis bskor nas sam yang na las dang dam tshig dang chos dang phyag rgya chen po rnams kyis rgyas btab nas te byin gyis brlabs nas lha'i nga rgyal te khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'dod pa'i kha'i nga rgyal 'chang
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab nas te 'khor nyid kyis bskor nas sam yang na las dang dam tshig dang chos dang phyag rgya chen po rnams kyis rgyas btab nas te byin gyis brlabs nas lha'i nga rgyal te khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'dod pa'i kha'i nga rgyal 'chang
translated: and be surrounded by the retinue, or else one should seal with the four seals, action, pledge, doctrine, and great seal, and be consecrated, and maintain the pride of the deity, the pride of the special exalted desire realm.

original: bar byed cing 'dzin par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni de'i tshe bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'i rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bar byed cing 'dzin par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni de'i tshe bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'i rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The yogi/nī who maintains and possesses that pride at that time is said to possess the yoga of the creation stage, but not the completion stage.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi lha'i rnal 'byor ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi lha'i rnal 'byor ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The yoga of the yogins is twofold:

original: sngags kyi sku'i rnal 'byor dang // ye shes kyi sku'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: sngags kyi sku'i rnal 'byor dang // ye shes kyi sku'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: the yoga of the mantra body and the yoga of the intuition body.

original: sngags kyi sku ni bskyed pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: sngags kyi sku ni bskyed pa'i rim pas so //
translated: The mantra body is by the stage of creation.

original: ye shes kyi sku ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas yin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas yin no //
translated: The intuition body is by the stage of contemplation.

original: gang gi tshe yang snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas sam 'od gsal ba las skad cig gis lha'i rnam par 'dzin pa de'i tshe yang rdzogs pa'i rim pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas sam 'od gsal ba las skad cig gis lha'i rnam par 'dzin pa de'i tshe yang rdzogs pa'i rim pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
translated: When one grasps the form of the deity in an instant from the clear light, or by the process of attaining the radiant light, then it is the stage of completion. This is the difference.

analyzed: 'o na las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa rnams gang yin zhe na / bcom @97a * //

analyzed: ldan 'das kyis thams cad mkhyen pa 'jig byed ces bya ba rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud las /
translated: The Lord has said in the Compendium of Truth Tantra:

analyzed: de nas yang dag bshad bya ste //
translated: Then I will explain

analyzed: rnal 'byor chen pos mthong ba ni //

analyzed: dam tshig ces bya gzung bar bya // sna tshogs rdo rje snying gnas pa'i //

analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya gzung bya ste // ji ltar 'dod pa'i las rnams ni //
translated: one should hold the doctrine seal;🔽there is no doubt that the activities

analyzed: de rnams kyis ni rnal 'byor dang // sdom mchog nges par 'grub mi 'gyur //

analyzed: ji srid bsgom dang ldan gyur pa //

translated: for that long one is a beginner.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa la sogs pa rnal 'byor mchog gi rgyud dang rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud de dang der zhes bya ba le'u re rer bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs shing bstan te /
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa la sogs pa rnal 'byor mchog gi rgyud dang rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud de dang der zhes bya ba le'u re rer bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs shing bstan te /
translated: In the glorious Guhyasamāja and so forth, the tantras of supreme yoga and the tantras of great yoga, in each chapter the Bhagavān taught and explained

original: rab rgyas zhes bya ba ni rab tu spros nas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rab rgyas zhes bya ba ni rab tu spros nas gsungs pa'o //

original: ci dang ji srid du bsgom pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: ci dang ji srid du bsgom pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: “For as long as one is endowed with meditation”🔽means

original: rnal 'byor pa brtags pa'i lha'i rnam pa bsgom pa sgom par byed pa de dang de srid du ni dang po'i las can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa brtags pa'i lha'i rnam pa bsgom pa sgom par byed pa de dang de srid du ni dang po'i las can zhes bya ste /
translated: As long as the beginner meditates on the form of the deity, which is an object of imagination, he is called a beginner.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid dang slob ma nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid dang slob ma nyid yin pa'i phyir /

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba la rnam par rtog pa dag la don dam par bye brag cung zad kyang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba la rnam par rtog pa dag la don dam par bye brag cung zad kyang mi dmigs te /
translated: He does not perceive the slightest difference between virtuous and nonvirtuous conceptual thoughts in the ultimate sense,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags @97b tsam yang 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor lhung bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags @97b tsam yang 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor lhung bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even the mere latent impressions of conceptual thought cause one to fall into the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: dge ba 'am mi dge ba yang rung /
analyzed: dge ba 'am mi dge ba yang rung /
translated: Whether virtuous or nonvirtuous,

original: rnam rtog bye brag ci zhig yod //🔽me ni sreg par byed pa la //
analyzed: rnam rtog bye brag ci zhig yod // me ni sreg par byed pa la //
translated: what difference does it make conceptually?🔽Fire burns

original: rten gyi dbye bas bye brag med //
analyzed: rten gyi dbye bas bye brag med //
translated: regardless of the difference in fuel.

original: de ni tsandan las byung yang //
analyzed: de ni tsandan las byung yang //
translated: Even if it arises from sandalwood,

original: reg na sreg par byed pa nyid //
analyzed: reg na sreg par byed pa nyid //
translated: it burns when touched.

original: rnam par rtog pa chung ngu yang //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa chung ngu yang //
translated: Even the slightest conceptual thought

original: thams cad spang par bya ba nyid //
analyzed: thams cad spang par bya ba nyid //
translated: should be abandoned.

original: 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin rtogs pas ni //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin rtogs pas ni //
translated: By realizing the nature of error,

original: sems ni glod par byed pa nyid //
analyzed: sems ni glod par byed pa nyid //
translated: The mind is relaxed.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gang bshad pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gang bshad pa ste /
translated: This is what is explained by the words beginning with “the mind is relaxed.”

original: sgra ni bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ni bzhin pa'o //
translated: The word “thus” means “in that way.”

original: gal te de lta yin na'o na rdzogs pa'i rim pa bshad dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na'o na rdzogs pa'i rim pa bshad dgos so zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the completion stage must be explained.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / da ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor nyid //
analyzed: de'i phyir / da ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor nyid //
translated: Now, the very yoga of completion

original: gsal ba ru ni bshad bya ste //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gsal ba ru ni bshad bya ste // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is explained clearly.

original: da ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: da ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor te /
translated: Now, the yoga of completion,

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa gsal ba ru bshad par bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa gsal ba ru bshad par bya ba ni /
translated: the completion stage, is explained clearly.

original: bstan cing bsnyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: bstan cing bsnyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: It is said that it is to be taught and explained. The words are literal.🔽That itself is:

original: de nyid / stong pa gsum gyi rnam dag gang //
analyzed: de nyid / stong pa gsum gyi rnam dag gang //
translated: The purity of the three voids

original: 'od gsal ba ni 'dir bshad do //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni 'dir bshad do //
translated: is explained here as clear light.

original: de ni thams cad stong pa ste //
analyzed: de ni thams cad stong pa ste //
translated: That is the emptiness of everything,

original: ye shes gsum ni rnam dag pa //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ye shes gsum ni rnam dag pa //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the purity of the three intuitions.

original: stong pa gsum te nyin mo dang mtshan mo dang mtshams kyi rang bzhin gyi stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang stong pa chen po ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa gsum te nyin mo dang mtshan mo dang mtshams kyi rang bzhin gyi stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang stong pa chen po ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang /
translated: The three empty states, which are the empty, the very empty, and the great empty, which are the nature of the daytime, nighttime, and the juncture, are the engaging consciousness, the afflicted mind consciousness,🔽and the ālaya consciousness.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / snang ba dang snang ba gsal ba dang snang ba nye bar thob pa rnams dang / de rnams kyi rang bzhin dang shes rab dang thabs dang ma rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo rnam pa gsum zla ba dang nyi ma dang mtshams kyi rab tu gsal ba dang mtshungs pa'i snang ba rnams kyi sa bon dang bcas pa dang sa bon med par
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / snang ba dang snang ba gsal ba dang snang ba nye bar thob pa rnams dang / de rnams kyi rang bzhin dang shes rab dang thabs dang ma rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo rnam pa gsum zla ba dang nyi ma dang mtshams kyi rab tu gsal ba dang mtshungs pa'i snang ba rnams kyi sa bon dang bcas pa dang sa bon med par
translated: The three aspects of the nature of the appearances, the clear appearances, and the attained appearances, which are the nature of wisdom, method, and ignorance, are the seeds of the appearances that are similar to the very clear moon, sun, and juncture, and are without seeds.

original: bsgom pa'i rim pas rnam par dag par byed pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rim pas rnam par dag par byed pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that they are purified by the stage of meditation.

original: stong pa gsum po de yang gang gi tshe ye shes la dbang ba tsam thob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa gsum po de yang gang gi tshe ye shes la dbang ba tsam thob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: When those three emptinesses are attained just by the mastery of gnosis,

original: sangs rgyas kyis thob par byed pa ma yin pa de'i tshe sa bcu gnyis pa thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis thob par byed pa ma yin pa de'i tshe sa bcu gnyis pa thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: at that time, in order to attain the twelfth stage,

original: de yang spangs nas bzhi pa thams cad stong pa 'od gsal ba'i gnas goms par byed do //
analyzed: de yang spangs nas bzhi pa thams cad stong pa 'od gsal ba'i gnas goms par byed do //
translated: having abandoned that, one should cultivate the fourth, the abode of the clear light of all emptiness.

original: de yang sngags kyi rim pas sngar @98a * //
analyzed: de yang sngags kyi rim pas sngar @98a * //
translated: That is also by the process of mantra, as previously explained.

original: bshad pa'i snang ba gsum dang bral ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo yang nub par gyur nas nam mkha' sprin med pa dang mtshungs par rtag tu rab tu gsal ba'i snang ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad pa'i snang ba gsum dang bral ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo yang nub par gyur nas nam mkha' sprin med pa dang mtshungs par rtag tu rab tu gsal ba'i snang ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of being free from the three appearances, the wheel of the dharmadhātu also sets, and one always experiences the appearance of clarity, like a cloudless sky.

original: gang du mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa dang nyin mo dang mtshams kyi rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba der bsam gtan gyi zas 'ba' zhig dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas gnas te 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed cing gnas par byed do zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang du mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa dang nyin mo dang mtshams kyi rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba der bsam gtan gyi zas 'ba' zhig dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas gnas te 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed cing gnas par byed do zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not the intended meaning.

original: de nyid kyi khyad par ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyad par ni /
translated: The distinction of that is stated:🔽That is the abode of pure pristine consciousness,

original: ye shes dag gnas de nyid dang // thams cad mkhyen pa bla med pa //
analyzed: ye shes dag gnas de nyid dang // thams cad mkhyen pa bla med pa //
translated: the unsurpassed omniscience,

original: 'gyur ba med cing snang ba med //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med cing snang ba med //
translated: imperturbable and non-apparent.

original: gnyis med mchog tu zhi ba ste //
analyzed: gnyis med mchog tu zhi ba ste //
translated: It is nondual, supreme peace.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: 'od gsal ba de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that clear light?

original: snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes rnams kyi dag pa'i gnas ni dag pa'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes rnams kyi dag pa'i gnas ni dag pa'i gzhi'o //
translated: The abode of pure pristine consciousnesses such as appearance is the pure basis.

original: de nyid ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: That itself is the nature of ultimate truth.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ni rdo rje 'chang nyid de sa bcu gnyis pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni rdo rje 'chang nyid de sa bcu gnyis pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: Omniscience is Vajradhara himself, the nature of the vajra-like samadhi of the twelfth stage.

original: gang las gong na med pas bla na med pa ste bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: gang las gong na med pas bla na med pa ste bzhi pa'o //
translated: Since there is nothing higher than that, it is unsurpassed, the fourth.

original: 'gyur ba ni dga' ba la sogs pa'i gsum ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni dga' ba la sogs pa'i gsum ste /
translated: Change is the three joys, etc.

original: de dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: Since it is free from that, it is unchanging.

original: snang ba ni shes pa dang ye shes dang rnam par shes pa dang rang bzhin rnams te de dag spangs pa'i phyir snang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba ni shes pa dang ye shes dang rnam par shes pa dang rang bzhin rnams te de dag spangs pa'i phyir snang ba med pa'o //
translated: Appearance is the consciousnesses, the wisdoms, the cognitions, and the natures. Since they are abandoned, it is non-appearance.

original: gnyis pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag ste /
translated: The two are the conceptions of conventional and ultimate truths.

original: de dag med pa'i phyir gnyis med do //
analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir gnyis med do //
translated: Since they do not exist, it is non-dual.

original: mchog ni rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob pa'i phyir dam pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob pa'i phyir dam pa'o //
translated: Supreme is the highest, because it attains the state of Vajradhara.

original: zhi ba ni rnam par rtog pa spros pa dang bcas pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni rnam par rtog pa spros pa dang bcas pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: Peace is free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: de lta bu thams cad stong pa'i gnas ni 'od gsal ba zhes bya bar brjod de sbas pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu thams cad stong pa'i gnas ni 'od gsal ba zhes bya bar brjod de sbas pa'o //
translated: That place of emptiness of all that is called “clear light,” which is hidden.

original: 'od gsal ba kho na las thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'byung gi gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽yod ces pa dang med ces par //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba kho na las thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'byung gi gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro // yod ces pa dang med ces par //
translated: It is taught that only from the clear light does the state of omniscience arise, not from anything else.🔽It is not expressed by the words

original: de ni tshig gis brjod mi rung //
analyzed: de ni tshig gis brjod mi rung //
translated: “exists” or “does not exist.”

original: de phyir 'od gsal dag pa las //
analyzed: de phyir 'od gsal dag pa las //
translated: Therefore, from the pure clear light

original: ye shes gsum ni yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: ye shes gsum ni yang dag 'byung //
translated: the three intuitions truly arise.

original: sum @98b cu rtsa gnyis mtshan 'chang zhing //
analyzed: sum @98b cu rtsa gnyis mtshan 'chang zhing //
translated: Bearing the thirty-two marks

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cur ldan //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cur ldan //
translated: and endowed with the eighty minor marks,

original: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i //
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i //
translated: endowed with the most sublime of all aspects,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa de nas 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa de nas 'byung // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: omniscience arises from that.

original: 'od gsal ba de ni yod do zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pas bstan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba de ni yod do zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pas bstan pa ma yin te /
translated: That clear light is not taught by the concept “it exists.”

original: kun rdzob kyi rang gi ngo bo'i rnam par shes pa rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi rang gi ngo bo'i rnam par shes pa rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the consciousnesses of the nature of the relative do not exist.

original: med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not nonexistent.

original: rab tu gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyi tshad mas nyams su myong bar bya ba nyid du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyi tshad mas nyams su myong bar bya ba nyid du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists as an object of experience by the valid cognition of yogic direct perception, which has a nature of utter clarity.

original: de ni ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ni ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: tshig gis brjod par mi rung ste //
analyzed: tshig gis brjod par mi rung ste //
translated: It is not suitable to be expressed by words.

original: rang gis rig par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhon nu ma'i rab tu dga' ba dang lkugs pas rmi lam mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gis rig par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhon nu ma'i rab tu dga' ba dang lkugs pas rmi lam mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: Because it is to be known by oneself, like the bliss of a young woman and the dream of a mute.

original: kun rdzob tu brtags nas bstan par mi rung gi / rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas ma yin te lha dang dmyal ba'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba ston pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu brtags nas bstan par mi rung gi / rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas ma yin te lha dang dmyal ba'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba ston pa bzhin no //
translated: It is not suitable to be taught by designating it conventionally, not by way of its own nature, like teaching the experience of the bliss and suffering of gods and hell beings.

original: de'i phyir tshig gi spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig gi spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not an object of words.

original: de'i phyir 'od gsal rtag tu gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyi de kho na nyid dag cing rnyog pa med pa de las ye shes gsum 'byung bar 'gyur zhing de nyid du thim par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'od gsal rtag tu gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyi de kho na nyid dag cing rnyog pa med pa de las ye shes gsum 'byung bar 'gyur zhing de nyid du thim par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, from that suchness, which is the nature of always clear luminosity, pure and stainless, the three wisdoms arise and dissolve into it.

original: de skad du sngar bstan pa 'di kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skad du sngar bstan pa 'di kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: It is just for this reason that it was taught previously.

original: 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
translated: Not only that,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ste rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bar du yang de las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ste rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bar du yang de las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: up to omniscience, that is, Great Vajradhara, will arise from that.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang ldan zhing 'brel pa rnam pa kun gyi mchog ste stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang gzungs dang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa dang thugs rje chen po la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan de rnams dang ldan par 'gyur zhing 'grub par 'gyur ro
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang ldan zhing 'brel pa rnam pa kun gyi mchog ste stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang gzungs dang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa dang thugs rje chen po la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan de rnams dang ldan par 'gyur zhing 'grub par 'gyur ro
translated: Endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great being and the eighty minor marks, the supreme of all aspects, that is, endowed with the ten powers, the four types of fearlessness, the six superknowledges, the dhāraṇīs, the levels, the perfections, the factors of enlightenment, the unshared qualities, and so on, and endowed with great compassion, one will become endowed with and accomplish those qualities of a buddha.

original: // 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: // 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching:

analyzed: 'od gsal ba yang dag par rtogs nas bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa de las cig car 'ja' ston lta bu'i sku la bsten te /
translated: Having realized the clear light, from that stage of self-consecration, instantaneously, one attains the body which is like a rainbow.

original: dkyil 'khor ma lus pas yongs su bskor bar 'gyur bar 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du sems can gyi don byed par nus pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen por 'gyur ro zhes @99a * //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ma lus pas yongs su bskor bar 'gyur bar 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du sems can gyi don byed par nus pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen por 'gyur ro zhes @99a * //
translated: Surrounded by the entire mandala, one becomes the Great Vajradhara, who is able to perform the welfare of sentient beings for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: bya ba'i don te sbas pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i don te sbas pa'o //
translated: This is the hidden meaning.

original: de nyid lung gi tshad mas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid lung gi tshad mas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very [point] by means of the valid cognition of scripture,

original: 'di skad rgya cher rol pa'i theg pa chen po'i mdo sde las /
analyzed: 'di skad rgya cher rol pa'i theg pa chen po'i mdo sde las /
translated: it is said in the Laṅkāvatāra Mahāyāna Sūtra:

original: sh'akya seng ge de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: sh'akya seng ge de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The Tathāgata, the Lion of the Śākyas,

original: mngon par byang chub bzhed pa ste //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub bzhed pa ste //
translated: wishing to attain manifest enlightenment,🔽thought, “I will attain

original: stong pa chen po sangs rgyas nyid //🔽thob par bya zhes mngon par dgongs //
analyzed: stong pa chen po sangs rgyas nyid // thob par bya zhes mngon par dgongs //
translated: the buddhahood of great emptiness.”

original: nee ranydza na'i chu 'gram du //
analyzed: nee ranydza na'i chu 'gram du //
translated: Residing on the bank of the Nairañjanā,

original: bzhugs nas mi g-yo ba la bzhugs //
analyzed: bzhugs nas mi g-yo ba la bzhugs //
translated: he sat in the unwavering [posture].

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gang las 'khrungs pa dang byang chub pa dang chos kyi 'khor lo dang khab nas byung ba dang rab tu gshegs pa dang dga' ba spyod pa dang / lha rnams kyi nang du gshegs pa dang bdud bcom pa dang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i gtam rgyud bstan pa'i rgya cher rol pa zhes bya ba'i theg pa chen po'i mdo las gsungs so //
analyzed: gang las 'khrungs pa dang byang chub pa dang chos kyi 'khor lo dang khab nas byung ba dang rab tu gshegs pa dang dga' ba spyod pa dang / lha rnams kyi nang du gshegs pa dang bdud bcom pa dang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i gtam rgyud bstan pa'i rgya cher rol pa zhes bya ba'i theg pa chen po'i mdo las gsungs so //
translated: The great extensive sutra of the Mahayana called the Sutra of the Play in Which the Transcendent Lord Sakyamuni Manifests His Attainment of Enlightenment, which was taught by the Transcendent Lord Sakyamuni, contains the following:

original: sh'akya seng ge ni sh'akya'i rigs kyi rab mchog go //
analyzed: sh'akya seng ge ni sh'akya'i rigs kyi rab mchog go //
translated: The Lion of the Shakyas is the best of the Shakyas.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba las gyur pa bzhin du nye bar brtags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba las gyur pa bzhin du nye bar brtags pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he is designated as one who will appear,🔽he is a Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ste de bzhin nyid rtogs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ste de bzhin nyid rtogs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: Because he has realized suchness, he is a Tathagata.🔽The fourth is the desire for manifest enlightenment, the suchness of clear light.

original: bzhi pa 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid mngon par byang chub pa de bzhed cing thob par bzhed pas na /
analyzed: bzhi pa 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid mngon par byang chub pa de bzhed cing thob par bzhed pas na /
translated: Because he desires and wishes to attain it,

original: mngon par byang chub pa bzhed pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa bzhed pa ste /
translated: he is one who desires manifest enlightenment.

original: de kho na nyid bzhi pa mngon du bya bar bzhed pa ni 'di snyam du dgongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bzhi pa mngon du bya bar bzhed pa ni 'di snyam du dgongs par 'gyur te /
translated: The fourth reality is to be actualized.

original: de kho na nyid bzhi gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bzhi gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the fourth reality?

original: stong pa chen po zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: stong pa chen po zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: It is called the great emptiness.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni stong pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas stong pa chen po ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni stong pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas stong pa chen po ste /
translated: It is the great emptiness because it is emptiness and it is great.

original: de las pha rol na stong pa med do //
analyzed: de las pha rol na stong pa med do //
translated: There is no emptiness beyond it.🔽Therefore, since it is to be adopted, I will attain and obtain buddhahood through that concentration.

original: de'i phyir de nyid blang bar bya ba yin pas bdag gis ting nge 'dzin de nyid kyi sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya zhing rnyed par bya'o zhes mngon par dgongs pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid blang bar bya ba yin pas bdag gis ting nge 'dzin de nyid kyi sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya zhing rnyed par bya'o zhes mngon par dgongs pa la brten nas /
translated: Based on such a resolve,

original: skye bo'i tshogs dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas dben pa tshol bar 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas dben pa tshol bar 'gyur ba na /
translated: he sought a solitary place for concentration free of crowds.

original: mtha' mar nee ranydza na zhes bya ba'i chu bo'i rgyun rab tu zhi bar 'bab pa sems rtse gcig pa'i rgyur gyur pa gzigs nas de'i 'gram ste ngogs su byon zhing /
analyzed: mtha' mar nee ranydza na zhes bya ba'i chu bo'i rgyun rab tu zhi bar 'bab pa sems rtse gcig pa'i rgyur gyur pa gzigs nas de'i 'gram ste ngogs su byon zhing /
translated: He saw the river Nairañjanā flowing peacefully and becoming a cause for one pointed mind. He went to its bank.

original: der bzhugs nas te shing aa shvartha'i shing drung gi rtsar nye bar bzhugs nas sems rnam par dag pa'i rim gyis gnas gyur @99b pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid gsum pa stong pa chen po zhes bya ba'i mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs shing
analyzed: der bzhugs nas te shing aa shvartha'i shing drung gi rtsar nye bar bzhugs nas sems rnam par dag pa'i rim gyis gnas gyur @99b pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid gsum pa stong pa chen po zhes bya ba'i mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs shing
translated: Having dwelt there, having approached the foot of an aśvattha tree, he dwelt in the meditative concentration called immovable, which is the third reality called great emptiness, characterized by the transformation of the mind through the stages of purification.

original: snyoms par bzhugs so //
analyzed: snyoms par bzhugs so //
translated: He entered into meditative equipoise.

original: kun nas mi g-yo zhing sa bon thams cad dang 'brel pa'i bag chags spyod par byed pas na mi g-yo ba ste stong pa chen po zhes brjod par bya'o ;
analyzed: kun nas mi g-yo zhing sa bon thams cad dang 'brel pa'i bag chags spyod par byed pas na mi g-yo ba ste stong pa chen po zhes brjod par bya'o ;
translated: It is immovable because it does not move at all and it is associated with all the seeds and it is the activity of the latent impressions, and it should be called great emptiness.

original: / sh'akya seng ge ni de tsam kho nas yongs su mnyes par gyur to zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don ste sbas pa'o //
analyzed: / sh'akya seng ge ni de tsam kho nas yongs su mnyes par gyur to zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don ste sbas pa'o //
translated: The Lion of the Śākyas was pleased with just that much. This is the hidden meaning of the verse.

original: de'i rjes la 'di ni de kho na nyid ma yin no zhes de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis nye bar bstan pa ni /🔽de tshe til gang bzhin gang ba'i //
analyzed: de'i rjes la 'di ni de kho na nyid ma yin no zhes de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis nye bar bstan pa ni / de tshe til gang bzhin gang ba'i //
translated: After that, the tathāgatas taught him that this was not reality.🔽The realm of space is filled

original: mkha' dbyings gnas pa'i rgyal ba yis //
analyzed: mkha' dbyings gnas pa'i rgyal ba yis //
translated: with victors like sesame seeds.

original: rgyal ba yi ni sras de la //
analyzed: rgyal ba yi ni sras de la //
translated: The Victorious One, with a single, guileless statement,

original: g-yo med gsung gcig gis gsungs pa //
analyzed: g-yo med gsung gcig gis gsungs pa //
translated: addressed the sons.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la gzigs nas thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob cing sems can gyi don bya ba lhur len pa mngon par shes pa drug dang
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la gzigs nas thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob cing sems can gyi don bya ba lhur len pa mngon par shes pa drug dang
translated: This is what was said.

original: ldan zhing sangs rgyas kyi sa thob par gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das sngon grub pa gang yin pa de rnams nam mkha'i dbyings til gyi gang bu bzhin gcig la gcig ma 'dres par khyab par bzhugs te /
analyzed: ldan zhing sangs rgyas kyi sa thob par gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das sngon grub pa gang yin pa de rnams nam mkha'i dbyings til gyi gang bu bzhin gcig la gcig ma 'dres par khyab par bzhugs te /
translated: Having seen Lord Śākyamuni, who was absorbed in the immovable samādhi, the lords who had attained complete enlightenment through the stages of hearing and so forth, who were intent on benefiting sentient beings, who were endowed with the six superknowledges, and who had attained the stage of buddhahood, all of them pervaded the realm of space like sesame seeds in a sesame pod, without one being mixed up with another.

original: de'i rjes su bzung ba'i don du nyid kyi sku rnams las 'od zer gyi 'khor lo rnam par spros nas des de la dbang bskur te snod du rung ba nyid du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i rjes su bzung ba'i don du nyid kyi sku rnams las 'od zer gyi 'khor lo rnam par spros nas des de la dbang bskur te snod du rung ba nyid du byas nas /
translated: In order to take care of them, he emanated a circle of light rays from his own body, and with that he conferred empowerment on them, making them suitable as recipients.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum pa spangs pa'i phyir man ngag bzhi ba bstan pa'i sgo nas mngon par byang chub pa mngon sum du bya ba'i don du bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid chos kyi rgyal por gyur nas 'gro ba 'dul bar byed par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum pa spangs pa'i phyir man ngag bzhi ba bstan pa'i sgo nas mngon par byang chub pa mngon sum du bya ba'i don du bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid chos kyi rgyal por gyur nas 'gro ba 'dul bar byed par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs
translated: In order to manifest manifest enlightenment by means of the fourth intimate instruction, which is the abandonment of the third meditative concentration, he thinks, “I will become a Dharma king in this very Fortunate Eon and will tame migrating beings.”

original: nas / rgyal ba rnams kyi de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas shing stong pa chen po'i gnas goms par byas pa las sangs rgyas kyi sa ma thob pa'i rgyal ba'i sras de la g-yo med pa ste sgyu spangs pa'i sems rab tu dang ba'i blo dang dbyangs
analyzed: nas / rgyal ba rnams kyi de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas shing stong pa chen po'i gnas goms par byas pa las sangs rgyas kyi sa ma thob pa'i rgyal ba'i sras de la g-yo med pa ste sgyu spangs pa'i sems rab tu dang ba'i blo dang dbyangs
translated: At that time, the Victorious Ones, who abide on the bodhisattva levels and have become accustomed to the state of great emptiness, but have not yet attained the level of buddhahood, speak to the Victorious Prince with a mind of utter clarity, that is, with a mind free of deceit or pretense, and with a voice

original: gcig ste / tshig gcig gis 'di skad du gsungs shing bstan te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ste / tshig gcig gis 'di skad du gsungs shing bstan te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: and a single word. They speak and teach in this way, just as the words are.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs pa de nyid ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs pa de nyid ni /
translated: The Tathāgatas say:

original: bsam gtan de ni rnam dag min //
analyzed: bsam gtan de ni rnam dag min //
translated: “This meditative concentration is not pure.

original: 'di ni mthar thug sangs rgyas min //
analyzed: 'di ni mthar thug sangs rgyas min //
translated: This is not the ultimate buddhahood.

original: nam mkha'i @100a * //
analyzed: nam mkha'i @100a * //
translated: Like the surface of the sky,

original: ngos ltar mchog gyur pa //
analyzed: ngos ltar mchog gyur pa //
translated: it is supreme.

original: 'od gsal ba ni de dmigs bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni de dmigs bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The clear light is to be focused on.

original: kye byang chub sems dpa' sh'akya seng ge khyod kyis sems rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir du stong pa chen po'i mtshan nyid kyi bsam gtan la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par dag pa ma yin te /🔽thams cad stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid thob par bya ba ma yin pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams rnam par dag tu zin kyang rab tu gsal zhing dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyi de kho na nyid lhan cig skyes pa thob par byed pa
analyzed: kye byang chub sems dpa' sh'akya seng ge khyod kyis sems rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir du stong pa chen po'i mtshan nyid kyi bsam gtan la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par dag pa ma yin te / thams cad stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid thob par bya ba ma yin pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams rnam par dag tu zin kyang rab tu gsal zhing dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyi de kho na nyid lhan cig skyes pa thob par byed pa
translated: O Bodhisattva Shakya Lion, that object of meditation which has the characteristic of the great emptiness for the sake of purifying the mind is not pure.

original: ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not cause the attainment of the reality of the emptiness of everything, and although attachment and so forth are purified, it does not cause the attainment of the reality of the innate nature which is very clear and delightful.

original: de bas na bsam gtan 'di ni mthar thug thob byed min te rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bsam gtan 'di ni mthar thug thob byed min te rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this meditation is not the cause of attaining the ultimate, it does not cause the perfection of the completion stage.

original: de'i phyir ni dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ni dor bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be abandoned.

original: 'on kyang 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags bar ma rim gyis spangs pa'i thams cad stong pa 'od gsal de nyid la khyod kyis dmigs par bya ba ste blang bar bya zhing bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags bar ma rim gyis spangs pa'i thams cad stong pa 'od gsal de nyid la khyod kyis dmigs par bya ba ste blang bar bya zhing bsten par bya'o //
translated: However, you should focus on, i.e., take up and rely on, that very luminosity of the emptiness of everything, in which attachment, nonattachment, and middling attachment are gradually abandoned.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And what is that like?

original: nam mkha'i ngos ltar te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i ngos ltar te /
translated: Like the surface of the sky.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings bzhin du glo bur ba'i dri ma rnams kyis ma gos shing khyab par byed pa 'di ni 'di na'o che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings bzhin du glo bur ba'i dri ma rnams kyis ma gos shing khyab par byed pa 'di ni 'di na'o che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Like the realm of space, it is not sullied by adventitious stains and it pervades everything. It cannot be indicated by saying, “It is here” or “It is there,” and it is unobstructed.

original: mchog ni stong pa nyid thams cad kyi gong na gnas pa nyid yod pa'i phyir mchog ste de nyid kho na yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mchog ni stong pa nyid thams cad kyi gong na gnas pa nyid yod pa'i phyir mchog ste de nyid kho na yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: It is supreme because it is the highest of all emptinesses. It should be understood that it is that very thing.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams kyi de lta bu man ngag nye bar bstan pa 'dis sh'akya seng ge rab tu bskul par 'gyur te mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams kyi de lta bu man ngag nye bar bstan pa 'dis sh'akya seng ge rab tu bskul par 'gyur te mthar thug pa'o //
translated: By this instruction that is taught in that way, the Lion of the Shakyas is fully inspired by those tathagatas, and it is final.

original: de nyid kyi 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'bras bu ni /
translated: The result of that is:

original: 'od gsal ba yi gnas thob nas //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba yi gnas thob nas //
translated: having attained the state of clear light,

original: rang dga'i gzugs su skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rang dga'i gzugs su skye bar 'gyur //
translated: one is born in a form of one's choice.

original: kun gyi dbang phyug thob 'gyur te //
analyzed: kun gyi dbang phyug thob 'gyur te //
translated: One attains lordship over all,

original: rdo rje'i skus ni dga' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje'i skus ni dga' bar 'gyur //
translated: and is delighted by the vajra body.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te gang gi tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i rim gyis snang ba la sogs pa gsum mthong ba'i sgo nas 'od gsal ba'i gnas te bzhi pa thams cad stong pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te gang gi tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i rim gyis snang ba la sogs pa gsum mthong ba'i sgo nas 'od gsal ba'i gnas te bzhi pa thams cad stong pa /
translated: When, by the process of purifying passion and so forth, one sees the three appearances and so forth, one attains the state of clear light, the fourth, the emptiness of everything.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po thob pa de'i tshe thob pa na rang dga'i gzugs te rang dbang can gyi gzugs 'ja' tshon dang mtshungs pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi skur skye bar 'gyur ba ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas ye shes
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po thob pa de'i tshe thob pa na rang dga'i gzugs te rang dbang can gyi gzugs 'ja' tshon dang mtshungs pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi skur skye bar 'gyur ba ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas ye shes
translated: Having attained the state of innate great bliss, one is born in a form of one's choice, a form of one's own power, a body of reflected image like a rainbow, by the process of self-consecration.

original: kyi skur @100b gyur nas /
analyzed: kyi skur @100b gyur nas /
translated: Having become the body of wisdom,

original: sems can thams cad kyi don byed par nus par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don byed par nus par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one is able to work for the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: de'i rjes la kun gyi dbang phyug ste khyab 'jug dang drag po dang tshangs pa la sogs pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi nang nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thob pa ni dbang phyug ste de thob
analyzed: de'i rjes la kun gyi dbang phyug ste khyab 'jug dang drag po dang tshangs pa la sogs pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi nang nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thob pa ni dbang phyug ste de thob
translated: After that, the lord of all, Vishnu, Shiva, Brahma and so on, the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas and all bodhisattvas, the attainment of supramundane gnosis is the lord, and that is attained.🔽🔽

original: par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, one becomes the lord of all, that is, one obtains the state of the lord of all, such as Vishnu, Shiva, Brahma, and so on, and of all sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas, having obtained supramundane gnosis.

original: yang na / lus dang ngag gi dbang phyug dang // de bzhin sems kyi dbang phyug ste //
analyzed: yang na / lus dang ngag gi dbang phyug dang // de bzhin sems kyi dbang phyug ste //
translated: Or else, one becomes the lord of body, speech, and mind,

original: rdzu 'phrul yon tan kun dbang phyug //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul yon tan kun dbang phyug //
translated: the lord of all the qualities of miracles,

original: smar byed byed po yon tan brgyad //
analyzed: smar byed byed po yon tan brgyad //
translated: the lord of the eight qualities of the swift one.

original: ces bya ba'i dbang phyug de dag thams yod thob pa na rdo rje sku ste 'jigs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi skur gyur nas dga' bar 'gyur ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar dub skal
analyzed: ces bya ba'i dbang phyug de dag thams yod thob pa na rdo rje sku ste 'jigs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi skur gyur nas dga' bar 'gyur ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar dub skal
translated: When one obtains all those lordships, one becomes the vajra body, the body of fearless gnosis, and one delights in going from buddha realm to buddha realm for as long as samsara exists.

original: pa bzang po la khyad par du sems can gyi don byas te dga' zhing mgu bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i don de sbas pa'o //
analyzed: pa bzang po la khyad par du sems can gyi don byas te dga' zhing mgu bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i don de sbas pa'o //
translated: and especially for the good, he has done the work of sentient beings, and he has become joyful and pleased.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung thos ma thag tu sh'akya seng ge'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung thos ma thag tu sh'akya seng ge'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the Lion of the Shakyas, immediately upon hearing the speech of the Tathagatas, entered into the samadhi,

original: de ltar sgra de gsan nas ni //
analyzed: de ltar sgra de gsan nas ni //
translated: having heard that sound,

original: de nas mi g-yo btang byas na //
analyzed: de nas mi g-yo btang byas na //
translated: then, having given up immobility,

original: mtshan phyed kyi ni dus dag tu //
analyzed: mtshan phyed kyi ni dus dag tu //
translated: at the time of midnight,

original: rgyal ba'i sras kyis de nyid dmigs //🔽sku ni drang po nyid min zhing //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras kyis de nyid dmigs // sku ni drang po nyid min zhing //
translated: the Son of the Victor focused on reality.🔽The body is not straight

original: mi drang ba nyid ma yin la //
analyzed: mi drang ba nyid ma yin la //
translated: and is not crooked.

original: dbugs gtong ba dang rngub pa min //
analyzed: dbugs gtong ba dang rngub pa min //
translated: It is not exhaling and inhaling,

original: gsung ba nyid min mi gsung min //🔽nyid kyis spyan phye ma yin zhing //
analyzed: gsung ba nyid min mi gsung min // nyid kyis spyan phye ma yin zhing //
translated: not speaking and not not speaking.🔽It is not opening one's eyes

original: spyan btsums pa yang ma yin pas //
analyzed: spyan btsums pa yang ma yin pas //
translated: and is not closing one's eyes.

original: dang zhing gsal ba'i ye shes che //
analyzed: dang zhing gsal ba'i ye shes che //
translated: The great, clear, and pure wisdom

original: thams cad stong pa rmad po che //
analyzed: thams cad stong pa rmad po che //
translated: is the marvelous emptiness of everything.

original: bla ma'i zhal snga'i drin gyis ni //
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal snga'i drin gyis ni //
translated: By the kindness of the guru's face,

original: de nas de ni gsal mthong 'gyur //
analyzed: de nas de ni gsal mthong 'gyur //
translated: Then he will see it clearly.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de kho na nyid nye bar ston pa'i tshig de lta bu'i rnam pa can de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gnas nas /

translated: thinking that this is not the place of the purity of reality, he let go of the unshakable samadhi of great emptiness, and abandoned it. At midnight, at the time of the middle of the night, the Victor's son, the Bodhisattva Shakyamuni,

analyzed: de nas ye shes kyi phyag rgya spros nas de ni gnas su btang ste /

analyzed: de dag lhan cig snyoms par zhugs pas mtshams dang mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i rim gyis lhan cig skyes pa'i de kho na nyid mngon du byas nas mi g-yo ba spangs te /

original: shes rab kyi dbang bskur pa gsang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mtshan phyed mtshan phyed na de kho na nyid bzhi pa dmigs par 'gyur zhing thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang bskur pa gsang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mtshan phyed mtshan phyed na de kho na nyid bzhi pa dmigs par 'gyur zhing thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de kho na nyid ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: kha cig ni 'dug nas padma'i 'dug stangs la sogs pa lus drang po ma yin pas bsgom pa la dmigs par byed do //

analyzed: kha cig ni mig phye bas ras ris la sogs pa'i gzugs la bltas nas bsam gtan byed do //

original: kha cig ni dang po'i sbyor ba la sogs pa rnams kyis mig btsums nas bsam gtan byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni dang po'i sbyor ba la sogs pa rnams kyis mig btsums nas bsam gtan byed do //
translated: Some, with eyes closed, meditate, by means of the preliminary application, etc.

original: sh'akya'i seng ge ni de rnams gang yang mi mdzad de /
analyzed: sh'akya'i seng ge ni de rnams gang yang mi mdzad de /

analyzed: de kho na nyid khyab par byed pa thob pas lus g-yo ba la sogs pa'i spyod lam gzhan rnams mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, having attained the pervasion of reality, there is no need for other activities such as moving the body.

original: phyi rol gyi lus kyi sdom pa la sogs pa rnams dang phyag rgyal sogs pa rnams ni de kho na nyid thob par bya ba dang / sems dbang du bya ba'i phyir bsten par bya'o zhes grag na gal te bla ma'i sku drin gyis de thob par 'gyur ba de'i tshe lus dang ngag dang sems sdug bsngal bar byed pa dang ting nge 'dzin rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i log pa'i spros pa rnams

translated: The external vows of body, etc., and the seals, etc., are to be relied upon in order to attain reality and to control the mind.

original: kyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: kyis ci zhig bya /
translated: If one attains that through the kindness of the guru, then what is the use of the false elaborations that torment body, speech, and mind and distract one from meditative concentration?

original: 'di skad du sngar /
analyzed: 'di skad du sngar /
translated: It is said:

analyzed: glang po mod la rnyed gyur na //

analyzed: glang po'i rjes ni tshol lam ci //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs gsungs pa nyid de dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs gsungs pa nyid de dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //

original: ji lta bu zhe na dang ba ste 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nyes pa rnams spangs pa @101b nyid yin pa'i phyir nor bu chu dangs kyis dri ma med par byas pa'i chu bzhin du dag cing dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na dang ba ste 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nyes pa rnams spangs pa @101b nyid yin pa'i phyir nor bu chu dangs kyis dri ma med par byas pa'i chu bzhin du dag cing dri ma med pa'o //
translated: What is it like? It is clear, pure, and stainless, like water purified by a diamond. It is pure and stainless because it is free from the faults of discursive thought, such as desire.
