analyzed: gsal ba ni rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyi chad mas yang dag par khong du chud par bya ba ste rnam par rtog pa med pa dang gsal bar snang ba'o //
translated: It is clear, because it is to be understood by the direct perception of yoga. It is non-discursive and appears clearly.🔽All that is discursive does not appear clearly, because discursive thought has the nature of darkness.

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma rnams ni mun pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa thams cad ni gsal bar snang ba ma yin te /

analyzed: 'jig tshogs dus bzhin bsgom stobs kyis // gsal ba nyid du snang 'gyur zhing //

original: shes pa slu ba med gang yin //
analyzed: shes pa slu ba med gang yin //

analyzed: de ni mi rtog mngon sum yin // rnam rtog rjes su 'brel pa las //

analyzed: 'od gsal snang ba ma yin te //

original: rmi lam na yang dran mod kyi //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang dran mod kyi //

original: dran 'byung de bzhin don ldan min //
analyzed: dran 'byung de bzhin don ldan min //

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //

analyzed: ye shes chen po ni snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes rnams kyi nang nas mchog nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mchog nyid ni blang bar bya ba nyid yin pa dang / de las gzhan pa rnams ni spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: stong pa gsum rnam par dag par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad stong pa'o //

analyzed: rang bzhin brgya drug cu 'gog par byed pa nyid yin pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rmad chen no //
translated: It is marvelous because it stops the one hundred and sixty natures, and fulfills all the wishes of all sentient beings dwelling in all world systems.

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dang sang yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyi las tha dad du ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'o //

original: 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni /

original: zhes bya bas gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas gsungs te /

analyzed: sh'akya'i seng ge des 'od gsal ba ni rnam par dag pas te de kho na nyid kyi man ngag mngon du byas pa'i stobs kyis @102a * //

analyzed: bdud la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin te gzhung mdzad pas /

original: to // yang na byang chub kyi shing drung se ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i chos 'byung du bzhugs shing brten nas lhan cig skye ba nyams su myong ba'i bsam gtan rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi 'dod chags dang 'dod chags bral ba dang 'dod chags par ma sems
analyzed: to // yang na byang chub kyi shing drung se ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i chos 'byung du bzhugs shing brten nas lhan cig skye ba nyams su myong ba'i bsam gtan rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi 'dod chags dang 'dod chags bral ba dang 'dod chags par ma sems
translated: Or else, in the Dharma source of the seal of wisdom, in the vicinity of the Bodhi tree, he abides, and having done so, he conquers and turns back the demons who would distract him from the vajra-like samadhi, the contemplation of the experience of the innate.

original: g-yeng bar byed pa'i bdud rnams bcom zhing zlog par mdzad do //
analyzed: g-yeng bar byed pa'i bdud rnams bcom zhing zlog par mdzad do //
translated: He conquers and turns back the demons of desire, of freedom from desire, and of the thought of desire.

original: dus nam zhe na /
analyzed: dus nam zhe na /
translated: When?

original: skya rengs zhes bya ba rtsa'i 'khor lo stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems de 'char ba ni 'byung ba ste rdo rje'i rtse mor 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: skya rengs zhes bya ba rtsa'i 'khor lo stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems de 'char ba ni 'byung ba ste rdo rje'i rtse mor 'dzin pa'o //
translated: When the dawn breaks, when the bodhicitta arises from the seventy-two thousand channel-wheels, and when it is held at the tip of the vajra.

original: de'i dus su ste lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i dus dang 'od gsal ba'i dus dang / nyin mo dang mtshan mo dang mtshams bdag dang bral ba'i skad cig la zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i dus su ste lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i dus dang 'od gsal ba'i dus dang / nyin mo dang mtshan mo dang mtshams bdag dang bral ba'i skad cig la zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: At that time, at the time of the innate joy, at the time of clear light, at the time of the moment free from the self of day and night and the self of the juncture, is what is meant.

original: chu zla la sogs pa'i sgyu ma'i dpe rnams ni smig rgyu lta bu la sogs pa'i rtags rnam pa lnga nye bar mtshon par byed pa'i don can yin te /
analyzed: chu zla la sogs pa'i sgyu ma'i dpe rnams ni smig rgyu lta bu la sogs pa'i rtags rnam pa lnga nye bar mtshon par byed pa'i don can yin te /
translated: The examples of illusion such as the reflection of the moon on water illustrate the five signs such as mirage.

original: de'i rjes thogs kho nar de kho na nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes thogs kho nar de kho na nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one attains reality immediately after that.

original: nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to //
translated: The definitive meaning.

original: da ni de kho na nyid grub par gyur pa'i rang gi don gyi rjes thogs su gzhan gyi don sh'akya'i mgon pos yang dag pa'i /
analyzed: da ni de kho na nyid grub par gyur pa'i rang gi don gyi rjes thogs su gzhan gyi don sh'akya'i mgon pos yang dag pa'i /
translated: Now, immediately after the attainment of his own goal, the Lord of the Śākyas, for the sake of benefiting the three worlds,

original: ye shes bla med legs brnyes nas //🔽'gro ba gsum la phan bya'i phyir //
analyzed: ye shes bla med legs brnyes nas // 'gro ba gsum la phan bya'i phyir //
translated: having attained the unsurpassed, perfect pristine wisdom,

original: de nyid 'dir ni bstan pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid 'dir ni bstan pa yin // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: taught reality here.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya mgon po ste de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod par bya ba yin te des gsal zhing rtog pa med pa la ma 'khrul pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi de kho na nyid bzhi ba bla na med pa'i phyir
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya mgon po ste de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod par bya ba yin te des gsal zhing rtog pa med pa la ma 'khrul pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi de kho na nyid bzhi ba bla na med pa'i phyir
translated: The Lord of the Śākyas is the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, who is indicated by the term “he.” Because he attained the unsurpassed, perfect pristine wisdom of reality, which is clear, nonconceptual, and nonerroneous,

original: mchog tu gyur pa legs par brnyes shing mngon du mdzad nas /🔽de'i tshe sngon gyi smon lam gyi bag chags kyis bskul ba des 'gro ba gsum la phan pa'i phyir de gnas te thob par bya ba'i phyir rgyud la sogs pa'i rigs pa rnam pa bzhi'i rim gyis bskal pa ji lta bu bzhin du rnal 'byor mchog gi rgyud
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa legs par brnyes shing mngon du mdzad nas / de'i tshe sngon gyi smon lam gyi bag chags kyis bskul ba des 'gro ba gsum la phan pa'i phyir de gnas te thob par bya ba'i phyir rgyud la sogs pa'i rigs pa rnam pa bzhi'i rim gyis bskal pa ji lta bu bzhin du rnal 'byor mchog gi rgyud
translated: Having attained and realized the supreme,

original: rnams su bstan zhing gsal bar mdzad pa yin no zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi don phun @103a * //
analyzed: rnams su bstan zhing gsal bar mdzad pa yin no zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi don phun @103a * //
translated: at that time, by the impetus of the latent propensities of his former prayers, he remained in order to benefit the three worlds, in order to attain them, and by the fourfold process of reasoning such as lineage, he taught and clarified the tantras of the supreme yoga in accordance with the eons.

original: sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the perfection of his altruistic activity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das la skyob pa zhes bya ba yin te 'di ltar rang gis mthong ba'i lam ston par byed pa ni skyob pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das la skyob pa zhes bya ba yin te 'di ltar rang gis mthong ba'i lam ston par byed pa ni skyob pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For this very reason, the Bhagavān is called the Protector, because he teaches the path of seeing that one has not seen.

original: rang gis mthong pa'i don gzhan rnams la ston par byed pa gang yin pa de ni skyob pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gis mthong pa'i don gzhan rnams la ston par byed pa gang yin pa de ni skyob pa yin no //
translated: He is the protector who teaches others the meaning of what he has seen.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not the intended meaning.

original: mjug bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba ni /
translated: The summary is:

original: mngon par byang chub gzigs pa ni //🔽de nyid ye shes zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub gzigs pa ni // de nyid ye shes zhes bshad do //
translated: The vision of manifest enlightenment

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is explained as the gnosis of reality.

original: mngon par byad chub pa ste bla na med pa'i mngon par byang chub ste /
analyzed: mngon par byad chub pa ste bla na med pa'i mngon par byang chub ste /
translated: The vision of manifest enlightenment, of unsurpassed manifest enlightenment,

original: de gzigs pa ni mngon du mdzad pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de gzigs pa ni mngon du mdzad pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is the actualization of that, is the meaning.

original: de nyid ye shes 'di ni bzhi pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid kyang yin la ye shes rnam par dag par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ye shes kyang yin pas de nyid ye shes te thams cad stong pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid ye shes 'di ni bzhi pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid kyang yin la ye shes rnam par dag par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ye shes kyang yin pas de nyid ye shes te thams cad stong pa yin par bshad do //
translated: That is gnosis, because it is the fourth, and it is gnosis because it is the agent of purifying gnosis. Therefore, that is gnosis, which is explained as the emptiness of everything.

original: mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'o //
translated: It is the ultimate.🔽Now, in order to demonstrate that even those with negative karma attain power through the kindness of the guru,

original: da ni bla ma'i sku drin gyis sdig pa can rnams kyis kyang dngos grub thob po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bla ma'i sku drin gyis sdig pa can rnams kyis kyang dngos grub thob po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:🔽Even those with the karma of the five heinous acts,

original: mtshams med lnga yi las can dang / mi gang bsod nams dman pas kyang /
analyzed: mtshams med lnga yi las can dang / mi gang bsod nams dman pas kyang /
translated: and those with little merit,

original: yid bzhin nor dang 'dra ba gzhan //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor dang 'dra ba gzhan //
translated: attain the wish-fulfilling gem

original: bla ma'i drin gyis 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: bla ma'i drin gyis 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: through the kindness of the guru.

original: spyod pa ci dgar spyod byed cing //
analyzed: spyod pa ci dgar spyod byed cing //
translated: One can engage in any conduct whatsoever.

original: 'di ni ma 'ongs rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: 'di ni ma 'ongs rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: This is the future perfect buddha.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: mtshams med lnga'i las te ma gsod pa la sogs pa rnams dang / de bzhin du mtshams med pa dang nye ba ste /
analyzed: mtshams med lnga'i las te ma gsod pa la sogs pa rnams dang / de bzhin du mtshams med pa dang nye ba ste /
translated: The five heinous actions are killing one's mother, father, or an arhat, causing a schism in the community, and maliciously drawing blood from a tathagata.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i mtshan med pa lnga'i las can yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i mtshan med pa lnga'i las can yin no //
translated: Similarly, the five actions without interval are like the actions of bodhisattvas, which are conceptual thoughts.

original: de bzhin du bsod nams dman pa zhes bya ba ni gang la tshe rabs snga mar bsags pa'i dge ba med pa 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsod nams dman pa zhes bya ba ni gang la tshe rabs snga mar bsags pa'i dge ba med pa 'am /
translated: Similarly, inferior merit refers to those who do not have virtue accumulated in previous lives.

original: rigs chad pa ste /
analyzed: rigs chad pa ste /
translated: Or it refers to those who are severed from the lineage.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das byams pas /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das byams pas /
translated: As Bhagavan Maitreya said:

original: kha cig gcig tu nyes par spyod pa yod //🔽kha cig dge ba'i chos rnams spangs pa yod //
analyzed: kha cig gcig tu nyes par spyod pa yod // kha cig dge ba'i chos rnams spangs pa yod //
translated: Some have only negative conduct.🔽Some abandon virtuous dharmas.

original: kha cig thar min cha mthun dge ba yod //
analyzed: kha cig thar min cha mthun dge ba yod //
translated: Some have virtue that is not conducive to liberation.

original: dge ba dman zhing rgyud man pa yang yod //
analyzed: dge ba dman zhing rgyud man pa yang yod //
translated: Some have inferior virtue and a weak continuum.

original: ces gsungs pa de lta bu la sogs pa rnams ni bsod nams dman pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa de lta bu la sogs pa rnams ni bsod nams dman pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are like that are called “those of inferior merit.”

original: de rnams kyis kyang bla ma'i drin te rdo rje slob dpon gyis kyang yang dag pa'i man ngag thob nas yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang mtshungs par mngon par 'dod pa ster bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba des ni 'di skad du re zhig rang gi
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang bla ma'i drin te rdo rje slob dpon gyis kyang yang dag pa'i man ngag thob nas yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang mtshungs par mngon par 'dod pa ster bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba des ni 'di skad du re zhig rang gi
translated: Even they, having obtained the true esoteric instructions from the guru, the vajra master, will become like wish-fulfilling gems, granting what is desired.

original: don lta zhog de rnams ni @103b gzhan gyi don yang grub par byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don lta zhog de rnams ni @103b gzhan gyi don yang grub par byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that, to say nothing of their own goal, they will accomplish the goals of others.

original: de nyid kyi ci dga' ste ji ltar 'dod par 'gyur ba ste de kho na bzhin du gal te 'greng ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba spyod pa byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de nyid kyi ci dga' ste ji ltar 'dod par 'gyur ba ste de kho na bzhin du gal te 'greng ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba spyod pa byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: That very [guru] is as one wishes, as desired. If one engages in the conduct characterized by standing, sitting, and lying down, just as one wishes,

original: de ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: then one should be called a perfect buddha.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: ma 'ongs zhes bya ba ma 'ongs pa'i sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs zhes bya ba ma 'ongs pa'i sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The future is the future sentient beings, because it is the very benefit of those sentient beings.

original: de yang gang du /
analyzed: de yang gang du /
translated: And that is also where

original: 'ga' zhig ri bo rtse las lhung gyur na //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ri bo rtse las lhung gyur na //
translated: if someone were to fall from the peak of a mountain,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa kho na yin no //
translated: and so on, it is explained.

original: de'i phyir bla ma'i zhal snga nas mnyes par bya ba la 'bad pa dang ldan pa'i bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bla ma'i zhal snga nas mnyes par bya ba la 'bad pa dang ldan pa'i bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the summary is one should strive to please the guru's face, and it is literal.

original: da ni man ngag bzhi'i rgyud sna tshogs kyi mtshan ma /
analyzed: da ni man ngag bzhi'i rgyud sna tshogs kyi mtshan ma /
translated: Now, the name of the tantra of the four intimate instructions is

original: chags min chags dang bral ba min //
analyzed: chags min chags dang bral ba min //
translated: neither attached nor detached,

original: dbu mar yang ni mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dbu mar yang ni mi dmigs so //
translated: nor is it apprehended in the middle.

original: stong pa ma yin mi stong min //
analyzed: stong pa ma yin mi stong min //
translated: It is neither empty nor not empty,

original: dbu mar yang ni mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dbu mar yang ni mi dmigs so //
translated: nor is it apprehended in the middle.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam sbyor las //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam sbyor las //
translated: In the Union with All Buddhas,

original: ye shes gsum bral de nyid gang //
analyzed: ye shes gsum bral de nyid gang //
translated: that reality free from the three exalted wisdoms

original: de ni dgongs pas gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: de ni dgongs pas gsungs pa yin //
translated: is explained with an intention.

original: zhes bya bas gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas gsungs te /
translated: It is said:

original: dpal sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po'i rtog pa dang po las bcom ldan 'das kyis de kho na nyid bzhi pa 'gal ba'i tshig gi sbyor bas de kho na nyid ston pa'i dgongs pas bshad pa des gsungs shing bstan to //
analyzed: dpal sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po'i rtog pa dang po las bcom ldan 'das kyis de kho na nyid bzhi pa 'gal ba'i tshig gi sbyor bas de kho na nyid ston pa'i dgongs pas bshad pa des gsungs shing bstan to //
translated: In the first chapter of the glorious Tantra of the King of Yoga, Union with All Buddhas, the Bhagavān taught and explained the four realities with words that contradict the intended meaning of the teaching of reality.

original: ji lta zhen /🔽chags pa ste snang ba'i ye shes min pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta zhen / chags pa ste snang ba'i ye shes min pa'o //
translated: How is that?🔽It is not attachment, the wisdom of appearance.

original: chags bral te snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes min pa'o //
analyzed: chags bral te snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes min pa'o //
translated: It is not detachment, the wisdom of the attainment of appearance.

original: dbu ma ste snang ba gsal ba'i ye shes min pa'o //
analyzed: dbu ma ste snang ba gsal ba'i ye shes min pa'o //
translated: It is not the middle, the wisdom of clear appearance.

original: de bzhin du stong pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa ste /
translated: Similarly, it is not empty.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gnyen por gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gnyen por gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not the antidote to the consciousness of engagement.

original: mi stong pa ste nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnyen por gyur pa shin tu stong pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi stong pa ste nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnyen por gyur pa shin tu stong pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not very empty, not the antidote to the afflicted mind consciousness.

original: dbu mar yang ni mi dmigs pa ste kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i stong pa chen po gang du mi dmigs pa de ni ye shes gsum dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid bzhi ba yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa kho na'o
analyzed: dbu mar yang ni mi dmigs pa ste kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i stong pa chen po gang du mi dmigs pa de ni ye shes gsum dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid bzhi ba yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa kho na'o
translated: In the middle, it is also not observed, that is, the great emptiness that is the antidote to the all-base consciousness, where it is not observed, is the fourth reality that is free from the three exalted wisdoms, as only the Bhagavat has taught.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste spas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste spas pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the above verse.

original: de bzhin du dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i tshad ma /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i tshad ma /
translated: Similarly, the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra states:

original: dpal ldan gsang ba 'dus pa yi //
analyzed: dpal ldan gsang ba 'dus pa yi //
translated: In the glorious Guhyasamaja,🔽in the chapter on bodhicitta,

original: byang chub sems kyi le'u las kyang /🔽dngos med la sogs tshig bshad kyi //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi le'u las kyang / dngos med la sogs tshig bshad kyi //
translated: it also says:

original: mngon par byang chub mtshan nyid @104a * //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub mtshan nyid @104a * //
translated: The characteristics of manifest enlightenment

original: gsungs // zhes bya bas gsungs te /
analyzed: gsungs // zhes bya bas gsungs te /
translated: are explained by words such as “non-entity.”

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi le'u ste gnyis pa las kyang /🔽dngos po med pas sgom pa med //
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi le'u ste gnyis pa las kyang / dngos po med pas sgom pa med //
translated: In the second chapter on bodhicitta of the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra, it also says:🔽Since there are no entities, there is no meditation.

original: bsgom par bya ba bsgom pa min //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba bsgom pa min //
translated: The meditation is not the object of meditation.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lngas gang gi tshe skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid bstan pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lngas gang gi tshe skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid bstan pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Thus, by these five verses, the reality characterized by non-production, which is taught,

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis mngon par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'od gsal ba'i bzhi pa kho na yin par bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha chig ste mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis mngon par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'od gsal ba'i bzhi pa kho na yin par bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha chig ste mthar thug pa'o //
translated: is explained as being just the fourth, the clearlight which is characterized by manifest enlightenment, by the Transcendent Destroyer and Possessor, Vajradhara.

original: dpal mchog dang po'i rgyud kyi tshad ma /
analyzed: dpal mchog dang po'i rgyud kyi tshad ma /
translated: The measure of the Shriparamåddiytma Tantra

original: dpal mchog las ni gsungs pa yis //
analyzed: dpal mchog las ni gsungs pa yis //
translated: The Shriparamd teaches

original: 'dod chags la sogs rnam dag gang //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs rnam dag gang //
translated: that the purities of passion and so forth

original: de yang thams cad stong pa la //
analyzed: de yang thams cad stong pa la //
translated: are all based on emptiness,

original: brten nas de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs //🔽zhes bya bas gsungs te /
analyzed: brten nas de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs //🔽zhes bya bas gsungs te /
translated: and are taught by the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin du dpal mchog dang po'i rgyud las 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam par dag pa bstan pa gang yin pa de yang thams cad stong pa de kho na nyid la dmigs shing bstan nas de bzhin gshegs pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal mchog dang po'i rgyud las 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam par dag pa bstan pa gang yin pa de yang thams cad stong pa de kho na nyid la dmigs shing bstan nas de bzhin gshegs pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad
translated: Similarly, the Tantra of the Supreme Original Buddha teaches that desire and so forth are pure, and this is taught by focusing on and observing the emptiness of everything, thatness.🔽

original: kyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs shing bshad de /
analyzed: kyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs shing bshad de /
translated: Likewise, the Tantra of the Supreme Original Buddha teaches that desire and so forth are pure, and that is taught by observing and focusing on the reality of emptiness of everything, and is taught by the Tathagata, that is, by Great Vajradhara, the nature of all Tathagatas.

original: ji skad du dpal mchog dang po las /
analyzed: ji skad du dpal mchog dang po las /
translated: As the Supreme Original Buddha says:

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ste //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ste //
translated: Desire, hatred, and ignorance,

original: gsum po 'di rnams dug chen yin //
analyzed: gsum po 'di rnams dug chen yin //
translated: these three are great poisons.

original: dug nyid kyis ni rten byas na //
analyzed: dug nyid kyis ni rten byas na //
translated: If you rely on poison itself,

original: dug tu nye bar 'gro ba nyid //
analyzed: dug tu nye bar 'gro ba nyid //
translated: you will go to the state of poison.

original: bdud rtsi nyid du rten byas na //
analyzed: bdud rtsi nyid du rten byas na //
translated: If you rely on nectar itself,

original: bdud rtsi nyid kyi 'gro bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdud rtsi nyid kyi 'gro bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: you will go to the state of nectar.

original: 'dir ni don 'di yin te 'dod chags ni dga' ba'i rnam grangs dang ldan pa'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni don 'di yin te 'dod chags ni dga' ba'i rnam grangs dang ldan pa'i snang ba'o //
translated: Here is the meaning: desire is appearance endowed with the synonyms of joy.

original: zhe sdang ni bral ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i snang ba nye bar thob pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang ni bral ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i snang ba nye bar thob pa'o //
translated: Hatred is the appearance that is attained with the aspect of separation.

original: gti mug ni snang ba gsal ba'i rnam grangs dang ldan pa'i mchog ste /
analyzed: gti mug ni snang ba gsal ba'i rnam grangs dang ldan pa'i mchog ste /
translated: Ignorance is the supreme one that has the synonyms of clear appearance.

original: de rnams ni 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bzhi pa mthong ba 'jig rten gyi dug dang mtshungs pa'i dug yin te /
analyzed: de rnams ni 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bzhi pa mthong ba 'jig rten gyi dug dang mtshungs pa'i dug yin te /
translated: Those are the four poisons that are similar to the worldly poisons of the reality of clear light.

original: dug bzhin du gsod par byed cing 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor lhung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dug bzhin du gsod par byed cing 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor lhung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Like poison, they kill and cause one to fall into the ocean of samsara.

original: dus nam zhen gang gi tshe de rnams dug nyid kyis te rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis bsten zhing nyams su myong bar byas pa de'i tshe dug nyid du nye bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus nam zhen gang gi tshe de rnams dug nyid kyis te rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis bsten zhing nyams su myong bar byas pa de'i tshe dug nyid du nye bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When, by what, and at what time are they poisons? When they are relied upon and experienced by the poison of conceptuality, at that time they become poisons.

original: yang gang gi tshe bdud rtsi nyid kyis te de kho na nyid bzhi ba'i skad cig tu shes pas rten cing ro gcig par byas pa de'i tshe dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i bdud @104b rtsi nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe bdud rtsi nyid kyis te de kho na nyid bzhi ba'i skad cig tu shes pas rten cing ro gcig par byas pa de'i tshe dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i bdud @104b rtsi nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i
translated: Moreover, when one is aware of the nectar itself, that is, of the moment of the fourth reality, and makes it of one taste with the support, at that time, the nectar itself becomes the cause of attaining the state of glorious Vajradhara.

original: don te sbas pa'o //
analyzed: don te sbas pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the hidden.

original: lung thams cad kyi tshad ma ni /
analyzed: lung thams cad kyi tshad ma ni /
translated: The valid cognition of all scriptures is as follows.

original: sna tshogs mdo dang rgyud dag las //
analyzed: sna tshogs mdo dang rgyud dag las //
translated: From the various sutras and tantras,

original: de nyid nye bar bstan pa gang //
analyzed: de nyid nye bar bstan pa gang //
translated: whatever teaches thatness

original: de ni thams cad stong pa'i gnas //
analyzed: de ni thams cad stong pa'i gnas //
translated: is the abode of the emptiness of everything;

original: der ni gzhan dag ma gsungs so //🔽zhes bya bas gsungs te /
analyzed: der ni gzhan dag ma gsungs so //🔽zhes bya bas gsungs te /
translated: there, others are not taught.

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde bcom ldan 'das ma stong phrag brgyab la sogs pa'i mdo sna tshogs dang / de bzhin du bya ba dang spyod pa dang rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor mchog gi rgyud sna tshogs de rnams las rang bzhin med pa dang de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang stong pa nyid dang btags pa tsam nyid la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis bstan
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde bcom ldan 'das ma stong phrag brgyab la sogs pa'i mdo sna tshogs dang / de bzhin du bya ba dang spyod pa dang rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor mchog gi rgyud sna tshogs de rnams las rang bzhin med pa dang de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang stong pa nyid dang btags pa tsam nyid la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis bstan
translated: The various sūtras of the Mahāyāna, such as the one hundred thousand sections of the Bhagavatī Prajñāpāramitā, and likewise the various tantras of Kriyā, Caryā, Yoga, and Anuyoga, teach the suchness that is the reality expressed by the words “absence of nature,” “suchness,” “perfect limit,” “emptiness,” and “mere designation,”

original: pa'i de kho na nyid gang yin pa de ni man ngag bzhi pa'i 'od gsal ba thams cad stong pa'i gnas kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: pa'i de kho na nyid gang yin pa de ni man ngag bzhi pa'i 'od gsal ba thams cad stong pa'i gnas kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: from the perspective of the fourth instruction, luminosity, the abode of the emptiness of everything.

original: mdo dang rgyud kyi rgyal po de rnams su de kho na nyid las ma gtogs pa gzhan ma gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo dang rgyud kyi rgyal po de rnams su de kho na nyid las ma gtogs pa gzhan ma gsungs so //
translated: In those sūtras and kings of tantras, nothing is taught other than that suchness.

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde kha cig las ni de kho na nyid rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pa dang / kha cig las ni de kho na nyid rnam pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pa dang / kha cig las ni de kho na nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa spangs pa'i rang bzhin med pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde kha cig las ni de kho na nyid rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pa dang / kha cig las ni de kho na nyid rnam pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pa dang / kha cig las ni de kho na nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa spangs pa'i rang bzhin med pa yin par bstan to //
translated: In some Mahayana sutras, reality is taught to be a consciousness with aspects, in some it is taught to be a consciousness without aspects, and in some it is taught to be reality free from the nature of subject and object.

original: bya ba'i rgyud rnams las ni de kho na nyid lha'i rnam pa bsgom pa nyid yin pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud rnams las ni de kho na nyid rdo rje phra mo'i bsgom pa nyid yin pa dang / rnal 'byor mchog las ni de kho na nyid rim pa gnyis kyis bstan par bya ba'i kun du brtag pa dang yongs su grub pa'i rnal 'byor yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: bya ba'i rgyud rnams las ni de kho na nyid lha'i rnam pa bsgom pa nyid yin pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud rnams las ni de kho na nyid rdo rje phra mo'i bsgom pa nyid yin pa dang / rnal 'byor mchog las ni de kho na nyid rim pa gnyis kyis bstan par bya ba'i kun du brtag pa dang yongs su grub pa'i rnal 'byor yin par gsungs so //
translated: In the Action Tantras, reality is taught to be the meditation on the form of the deity, in the Yoga Tantras, reality is taught to be the meditation on the subtle vajra, and in the Supreme Yoga Tantra, reality is taught to be the yoga of thorough construction and complete accomplishment, which is to be taught by the two stages.

original: de las kyang kha cig tu ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyi de kho na nyid dang / kha cig tu ni thig le'i rnal 'byor gyi de kho na nyid dang yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyi de kho na nyid dang / rtsa ba'i de kho na nyid dang /
analyzed: de las kyang kha cig tu ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyi de kho na nyid dang / kha cig tu ni thig le'i rnal 'byor gyi de kho na nyid dang yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyi de kho na nyid dang / rtsa ba'i de kho na nyid dang /
translated: Moreover, in some places, it is not taught that there is a division of reality such as the reality of the yoga of subtle [vajra recitation], the reality of the yoga of the bindu, the reality of the yoga of the six limbs, the reality of the root,

original: phyag rgya'i de kho na nyid dang / rlung dang sngags kyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa de kho na nyid kyi dbye ba bstan pa ma yin nam //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i de kho na nyid dang / rlung dang sngags kyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa de kho na nyid kyi dbye ba bstan pa ma yin nam //
translated: the reality of the consort, and the reality of the wind and mantra?

original: de'i phyir thams cad stong pa'i gnas gcig pu kho na yin no zhes ji ltar brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad stong pa'i gnas gcig pu kho na yin no zhes ji ltar brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that there is only one reality of emptiness?

original: de skad du smra bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de skad du smra bar mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be said in that way.

original: de kho na nyid ces bya ba la tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ces bya ba la tha dad pa med do //
translated: There is no difference in what is called reality.

original: de dang ldan pa nyid yin pa de ni kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de bas na de kho na nyid ma yin pa @105a * //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa nyid yin pa de ni kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de bas na de kho na nyid ma yin pa @105a * //
translated: Since it is the nature of the relative, it is conceptual. Therefore, it is not reality.

original: kho na'o // dbye bas bstan pa gang yin pa de rnams ni thabs kyi dbye ba bstan pa yin zhing thabs kyi dbye ba yang rnal 'byor pa'i dbye ba la brten nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: kho na'o // dbye bas bstan pa gang yin pa de rnams ni thabs kyi dbye ba bstan pa yin zhing thabs kyi dbye ba yang rnal 'byor pa'i dbye ba la brten nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: Those that are taught by way of division are taught by way of the division of methods, and the division of methods is taught by the Bhagavat in dependence on the division of yogis.

original: de bzhin du yang khams dang bag chags dang bag la nyal gyi bye brag la brten nas sman pa bzhin du de dang de dag dang mthun pa'i bstan pa mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang khams dang bag chags dang bag la nyal gyi bye brag la brten nas sman pa bzhin du de dang de dag dang mthun pa'i bstan pa mdzad de /
translated: Similarly, in dependence on the distinctions of element, latent tendencies, and predispositions, he acts as a doctor, teaching in accordance with those and those.

original: de rnams kyi thabs la brten nas de kho na nyid gcig 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi thabs la brten nas de kho na nyid gcig 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In dependence on their methods, they will attain the one reality.

original: bstan bcos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid ni gcig kho na yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid ni gcig kho na yin te /
translated: The reality of all treatises is only one.

original: rten gyi dbye bas tha dad pa yin gyi chu bzhin du rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten gyi dbye bas tha dad pa yin gyi chu bzhin du rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: It is different by way of the division of the basis, but not by way of its own nature, like water.

original: de bzhin du yang dbyar gyi dus su chu'i char pa 'bab pa ni bu ram gyi shing gi zhing la sogs par bdud rtsi'i dngos por 'gyur zhing sbrul la sogs par de nyid dug nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dbyar gyi dus su chu'i char pa 'bab pa ni bu ram gyi shing gi zhing la sogs par bdud rtsi'i dngos por 'gyur zhing sbrul la sogs par de nyid dug nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the rain of water that falls in the rainy season becomes the essence of nectar in sugarcane fields, etc., and in the same place it becomes poison for snakes, etc.

original: de bzhin du thams cad stong pa'i gnas gcig kho na nyan thos kyi rigs can rnams ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rang gi ngo bor 'dzin to //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad stong pa'i gnas gcig kho na nyan thos kyi rigs can rnams ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rang gi ngo bor 'dzin to //
translated: In the same way, the very same place of the emptiness of everything is apprehended by those of the Śrāvaka type as the nature of the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: mdo sde pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams ni rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam gyi sgo nas 'dzin to //
analyzed: mdo sde pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams ni rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam gyi sgo nas 'dzin to //
translated: The Sautrāntikas and Yogācāras apprehend it as mere cognition with and without aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin med pa'i de kho na nyid kyi sgo nas 'dzin to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin med pa'i de kho na nyid kyi sgo nas 'dzin to //
translated: Bodhisattvas apprehend it as the reality free from the nature of subject and object.

original: bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung la brten pa rnams ni lha la sogs pa'i sgom pa'i sgom pa'i sgo nas 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir de kho na nyid ni gcig yin par grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung la brten pa rnams ni lha la sogs pa'i sgom pa'i sgom pa'i sgo nas 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir de kho na nyid ni gcig yin par grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Those who rely on the scriptures of action and so on apprehend reality by way of meditation on the deity and so on. Thus it is established that reality is one.

original: gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyi 'khor los bskul ba'am sngon nye bar bsags pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs shin tu bstan pa'i bag chags kyi stobs gzung ba'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyi 'khor los bskul ba'am sngon nye bar bsags pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs shin tu bstan pa'i bag chags kyi stobs gzung ba'am /
translated: When one is urged by the circle of light rays of the Tathagata, or when the power of the latent impressions of the accumulation of merit and wisdom previously gathered is revealed,

original: dge ba'i shes gnyen dang phrad pa'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i shes gnyen dang phrad pa'am /
translated: or when one meets a spiritual friend,

original: bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyi sku drin thob par gyur pa de'i tshe de rnam pa thams cad 'od gsal ba yang mngon du byed par 'gyur pa kho na yin pas ha cang thal ches pas chog ste mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyi sku drin thob par gyur pa de'i tshe de rnam pa thams cad 'od gsal ba yang mngon du byed par 'gyur pa kho na yin pas ha cang thal ches pas chog ste mthar thug pa'o //
translated: or when one obtains the kindness of the guru, then one will manifest the clear light of all aspects. Thus it is enough to stop at this point, since it is the ultimate.

original: mjug bsdu ba ni /🔽thub pa chen po'i chos phung po //
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba ni / thub pa chen po'i chos phung po //
translated: The summary🔽From the eighty-four thousand

original: brgyad khri bzhi stong dag las ni //
analyzed: brgyad khri bzhi stong dag las ni //
translated: aggregates of Dharma of the Great Sage,

original: mngon par byang chub mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristic of manifest enlightenment

original: snying po las ni snying por gsungs //
analyzed: snying po las ni snying por gsungs //
translated: is said to be the essence of the essence.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: thub pa chen po'i chos kyi phung po ni dam pa'i chos kyi tshogs brgyad khri bzhi stong gi tshad bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: thub pa chen po'i chos kyi phung po ni dam pa'i chos kyi tshogs brgyad khri bzhi stong gi tshad bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The Dharma aggregate of the Great Sage is the collection of the sublime Dharma, which is said to be of the measure of 84,000.

original: de las snying po @105b ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin las kyang snying po mchog ste blang bar bya ba nyid du gyur pa'i mngon par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid ni thams cad stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du gsungs so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de las snying po @105b ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin las kyang snying po mchog ste blang bar bya ba nyid du gyur pa'i mngon par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid ni thams cad stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du gsungs so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: From that, the essence, the essence of the essence, the supreme, is said to be the characteristic of manifest enlightenment, which is the characteristic of the emptiness of everything.

original: de ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: This is an illustration.

original: nyan thos kyi sde snod ni brgyad khri bzhi stong yod do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sde snod ni brgyad khri bzhi stong yod do //
translated: The śrāvaka canon is said to be 84,000.

original: theg pa chen po'i sde snod ni stong phrag dgu bcu yod do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i sde snod ni stong phrag dgu bcu yod do //
translated: The Mahāyāna canon is said to be 90,000.

original: theg pa chen po gsang sngags kyi sde snod stong phrag brgyad yod de /
analyzed: theg pa chen po gsang sngags kyi sde snod stong phrag brgyad yod de /
translated: The canon of the Mahāyāna secret mantra is said to be 8,000.

original: 'o na chos kyi phung po'i tshad ci tsam yin zhe na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na chos kyi phung po'i tshad ci tsam yin zhe na brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, what is the measure of the aggregates of Dharma?

original: lha'i gos lta bu'i gro ga'am t'a la la sogs pa rkyang pa rnams la skra'i rtse mo'i tshad tsam gyi yi ge bris pa'i glegs bam ci tsam gyi glang po che dar ma smyon pa'i rgyab khal longs pa de ni chos kyi phung po gcig ste /
analyzed: lha'i gos lta bu'i gro ga'am t'a la la sogs pa rkyang pa rnams la skra'i rtse mo'i tshad tsam gyi yi ge bris pa'i glegs bam ci tsam gyi glang po che dar ma smyon pa'i rgyab khal longs pa de ni chos kyi phung po gcig ste /
translated: It is said that one aggregate of Dharma is the amount of material that can be carried by a strong, mad elephant, written in letters the size of a tip of a hair on the surface of birch bark or palm leaf, etc., which is like divine cloth.

original: de stong phrag gcig tu bgrang ba de lta bu stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi dang stong phrag dgu bcu dang stong phrag brgya yod do zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: de stong phrag gcig tu bgrang ba de lta bu stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi dang stong phrag dgu bcu dang stong phrag brgya yod do zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The ultimate measure is that there are 84,000 aggregates of Dharma, 90,000 aggregates of Dharma, and 100,000 aggregates of Dharma.

original: brtul zhugs kyi bye brag gis de kho na nyid don du gnyer ba /🔽ral pa gcer bu mgo reg gam //
analyzed: brtul zhugs kyi bye brag gis de kho na nyid don du gnyer ba / ral pa gcer bu mgo reg gam //
translated: Those who seek reality through the different kinds of spiritual deportment🔽are shaven-headed, naked, or with matted hair,

original: cod pan 'dus pa spong 'jug ste //
analyzed: cod pan 'dus pa spong 'jug ste //
translated: wear topknots, or are renunciant,

original: sna tshogs rtags can de dang des //
analyzed: sna tshogs rtags can de dang des //
translated: with various signs.

original: mngon par byang chub 'dod pa rnams //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub 'dod pa rnams //
translated: Those who desire manifest enlightenment

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: are of various kinds.

original: ral pa can zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pas lha dang mtshungs pa'i rnam par byas nas shing la sogs las byas pa'i bcos ma'i gdong dang lag pa dang ral ba'i tshogs btags shing yul nas yul gzhan du spyod pa byed cing 'khyams pa gang dag yin
analyzed: ral pa can zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pas lha dang mtshungs pa'i rnam par byas nas shing la sogs las byas pa'i bcos ma'i gdong dang lag pa dang ral ba'i tshogs btags shing yul nas yul gzhan du spyod pa byed cing 'khyams pa gang dag yin
translated: The matted hair are those who, having made themselves resemble a deity by means of the creation stage, wander about from place to place, wearing a mask, hands, and a mass of matted hair made of wood, etc., and engaging in conduct.

original: pa'o // gcer bu ni ma chags pa'i brtul zhugs blangs nas smyon pa'i cha byad kyis nam mkha'i gos gyon zhing spyod pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // gcer bu ni ma chags pa'i brtul zhugs blangs nas smyon pa'i cha byad kyis nam mkha'i gos gyon zhing spyod pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: The naked are those who, having taken up the vow of non-attachment, wear the garment of the sky and engage in conduct in the guise of a madman.

original: mgo reg ces bya ba ni mgo spu bregs nas dge slong dge tshul la sogs pa'i brtul zhugs dang ldan pa dag gtsug lag khang la sogs par slob pa'i gnas srung bar byed pa gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: mgo reg ces bya ba ni mgo spu bregs nas dge slong dge tshul la sogs pa'i brtul zhugs dang ldan pa dag gtsug lag khang la sogs par slob pa'i gnas srung bar byed pa gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: The shaven-headed are those who, having shaved their heads, take up the vow of a fully ordained monk or novice monk, etc., and guard the place of training in a monastery, etc.

original: dgon par gnas pa'i skra dang kha spu ni //
analyzed: dgon par gnas pa'i skra dang kha spu ni //
translated: The hair and beard of those dwelling in the forest

translated: The one who is intent on alms is the one who, having gone from house to house, having begged from the group of people, eats the alms that he has obtained and that are suitable.

original: zer zhing skye bo'i tshogs su nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: zer zhing skye bo'i tshogs su nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: He does not go to the group of people thinking, “I will obtain from this person fine food and drink and the like.”

original: de la bsod snyoms la dbye ba ma byas na ni bcu gnyis su 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de la bsod snyoms la dbye ba ma byas na ni bcu gnyis su 'gyur zhing //
translated: If one does not distinguish the alms, there are twelve.

original: dbye ba la brten na ni bcu gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbye ba la brten na ni bcu gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one distinguishes the alms, there are thirteen.

original: de la stan gcig pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la stan gcig pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the quality of eating in one part of the day?

original: stan gcig la 'dug nas ji srid tshim pa de srid du za zhing stan de las langs nas yang mi za ba de ni stan gcig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stan gcig la 'dug nas ji srid tshim pa de srid du za zhing stan de las langs nas yang mi za ba de ni stan gcig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having sat down on one seat, one eats as much as one needs, and one does not rise from that seat to eat again. This is called “eating in one part of the day.”

original: zas phyis mi len pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: zas phyis mi len pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the quality of not taking food at improper times?

original: 'dug nas ji srid za ba thams cad ma blangs pa de srid zas mi za zhing /
analyzed: 'dug nas ji srid za ba thams cad ma blangs pa de srid zas mi za zhing /
translated: Having sat down, he does not eat until he has taken all the food.

original: ji tsam gyi tshim par nus par shes shing 'di ltar bdag la 'di las lhag pa'i bza' bas bya ba med do snyam du shes par bya ste ;
analyzed: ji tsam gyi tshim par nus par shes shing 'di ltar bdag la 'di las lhag pa'i bza' bas bya ba med do snyam du shes par bya ste ;
translated: He should know how much he can eat and think, “I have no need for more food than this.”

original: de nas thams cad blangs nas za bar rtsom pa de lta bu ni zas phyis mi len pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas thams cad blangs nas za bar rtsom pa de lta bu ni zas phyis mi len pa yin no //
translated: Then, having taken all the food, he begins to eat. This is how he does not take food later.

original: ji ltar chos gos gsum pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos gos gsum pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he have three robes?

original: chos gos gsum g-yon pa ste snam sbyar dang bla gos dang / mthang gas dang chos gos gsum las ma gtogs pa 'og tu chos gos ma g-yon pa de lta bu ni chos gos @106b gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: chos gos gsum g-yon pa ste snam sbyar dang bla gos dang / mthang gas dang chos gos gsum las ma gtogs pa 'og tu chos gos ma g-yon pa de lta bu ni chos gos @106b gsum pa yin no //
translated: He has three robes: the upper robe, the lower robe, and the sarong. He does not have any other robes except these three. This is how he has three robes.

original: ji ltar na phying pa pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na phying pa pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he have a mat made of rags?

original: chos gos gsum ma ma chos gos gsum las lhag pa'i gos 'chang ba gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad bal las byas pa 'chang gi gzhan ni ma yin pa de lta bu ni phying pa pa yin no //

translated: The refuse rag wearer is one who wears refuse rags.🔽The tree-root dweller is one who dwells at the foot of a tree.🔽The open-air dweller is one who dwells in the open air.🔽The charnel ground dweller is one who dwells in a charnel ground.🔽The any-bed user is one who uses any bed.🔽The three-robe wearer is one who wears the three robes.

original: ji ltar na phyag dar khrod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na phyag dar khrod pa yin zhe na /
translated: The woolen cloth wearer is one who wears woolen cloth.🔽The refuse rag wearer is one who wears refuse rags.🔽The tree-root dweller is one who dwells at the foot of a tree.

original: gzhan gyis byin pa 'am por ba'am lam po che'am bzhi mdo 'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byin pa 'am por ba'am lam po che'am bzhi mdo 'am /
translated: The open-air dweller is one who dwells in the open air.🔽The charnel ground dweller is one who dwells in a charnel ground.🔽The any-bed user is one who uses any bed.🔽The three-robe wearer is one who wears the three robes.🔽The woolen cloth wearer is one who wears woolen cloth.🔽The refuse rag wearer is one who wears refuse rags.🔽The tree-root dweller is one who dwells at the foot of a tree.

translated: The open-air dweller is one who dwells in the open air.🔽The charnel ground dweller is one who dwells in a charnel ground.🔽The any-bed user is one who uses any bed.🔽The three-robe wearer is one who wears the three robes.🔽The woolen cloth wearer is one who wears woolen cloth.

original: btsems nas kha dog bskyur te 'chang ba de lta bu ni phyag dar khrod pa yin no //
analyzed: btsems nas kha dog bskyur te 'chang ba de lta bu ni phyag dar khrod pa yin no //
translated: The refuse rag wearer is one who wears refuse rags.🔽The tree-root dweller is one who dwells at the foot of a tree.🔽The open-air dweller is one who dwells in the open air.🔽The charnel ground dweller is one who dwells in a charnel ground.

original: ji ltar na dgon pa pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dgon pa pa yin zhe na /
translated: The any-bed user is one who uses any bed.🔽The

original: nags dgon pa'i gnas kyi tha ma'i gnas mal grong dang grong khyer dang grong rdal rnams las thag ring po gyur pa gang yin par lhag par gnas par byed pa de lta bu ni dgon pa pa yin no //
analyzed: nags dgon pa'i gnas kyi tha ma'i gnas mal grong dang grong khyer dang grong rdal rnams las thag ring po gyur pa gang yin par lhag par gnas par byed pa de lta bu ni dgon pa pa yin no //
translated: He who dwells in the forest, in a secluded place, far from the village, is a forest dweller.

original: ji ltar na shing drung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na shing drung ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is a tree-root dweller?

original: shing drung la brten nas shing gi rtsa bar gnas par byed pa de lta bu ni shing drung ba yin no //
analyzed: shing drung la brten nas shing gi rtsa bar gnas par byed pa de lta bu ni shing drung ba yin no //
translated: He who dwells at the foot of a tree, in the open air, is a tree-root dweller.

original: ji ltar na bla gab med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bla gab med pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is an open-air dweller?

original: thog ma g-yogs shing ma bkab pa bla gab med par byed ba de lta bu ni bla gab med pa yin no //
analyzed: thog ma g-yogs shing ma bkab pa bla gab med par byed ba de lta bu ni bla gab med pa yin no //
translated: He who dwells in the open air, without a roof, is an open-air dweller.

original: ji ltar na dur khrod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dur khrod pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is a charnel ground dweller?

original: gang du skye bo'i tshogs shi ba'i ro bsreg pa'i dur khrod du gnas par byed pa de lta bu ni dur khrod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang du skye bo'i tshogs shi ba'i ro bsreg pa'i dur khrod du gnas par byed pa de lta bu ni dur khrod pa yin no //
translated: He who dwells in a charnel ground, where the bodies of dead people are thrown, is a charnel ground dweller.

original: ji ltar na cog bu pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na cog bu pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is a whatever-is-found dweller?

original: khri'am steg bu'am rtsva'i steng la tsog pur 'dug ste dus ji srid kyi bar du 'da' bar byed cing khri 'am rtsig pa'am shing ngam rtsva'i stan la brten nas rgyab bam glos 'bebs par mi byed pa de lta bu na cog pu pa yin /
analyzed: khri'am steg bu'am rtsva'i steng la tsog pur 'dug ste dus ji srid kyi bar du 'da' bar byed cing khri 'am rtsig pa'am shing ngam rtsva'i stan la brten nas rgyab bam glos 'bebs par mi byed pa de lta bu na cog pu pa yin /
translated: He sits cross-legged on a seat of grass or on a wooden platform, and he does not lean on a wall, tree, or anything else for as long as he lives.

original: ji ltar na gzhi ji bzhin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzhi ji bzhin pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he like the earth?

original: rtsva'i stan nam lo ma'i gang la nyal ba'i rtsa stan nam lo ma'i stan ji ltar lan cig legs par bting ba'i de kho na bzhin du nyal bar byed cing /
analyzed: rtsva'i stan nam lo ma'i gang la nyal ba'i rtsa stan nam lo ma'i stan ji ltar lan cig legs par bting ba'i de kho na bzhin du nyal bar byed cing /
translated: He sleeps on a bed of grass or leaves just as it was spread out.

original: yang dang yang spo ba dang bcos par mi byed pa de lta bu ni gzhi ji bzhin pa yin no//
analyzed: yang dang yang spo ba dang bcos par mi byed pa de lta bu ni gzhi ji bzhin pa yin no//
translated: He does not rearrange it again and again.

original: ci'i phyir de rnams sbyangs pa'i yon tan zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de rnams sbyangs pa'i yon tan zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called the ascetic practices?

original: dper na bal la ma ras pa la gang gi tshe /
analyzed: dper na bal la ma ras pa la gang gi tshe /
translated: For example, when wool is not yet spun into thread,

original: ma rmel bar gyur ba de'i tshe 'jam pa dang yang ba dang las su rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ma rmel bar gyur ba de'i tshe 'jam pa dang yang ba dang las su rung ba ma yin te /
translated: it is not soft, light, and useful.

original: dper na snal mar bkal pa'am be'u phrug tu btags pa'o //
analyzed: dper na snal mar bkal pa'am be'u phrug tu btags pa'o //
translated: For example, it is like wool that is being woven or a calf that is being tethered.

original: gang gi tshe rmel ba dang brdabs pa dang sprug pa rdzogs par gyur @107a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rmel ba dang brdabs pa dang sprug pa rdzogs par gyur @107a * //
translated: When the processes of combing, beating, and fluffing are completed,

original: pa de'i tshe 'jam pa dang yang ba dang las su rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa de'i tshe 'jam pa dang yang ba dang las su rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: it becomes soft, light, and workable.

original: dper na snal mar bkal pa'am be'u brug tu btag tu rung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na snal mar bkal pa'am be'u brug tu btag tu rung ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like wool that is being woven or a calf that is being tethered.

original: de bzhin du kha cig bsod snyoms la chags pas bsod snyoms la sems chags shing kun du chags par 'gyur pa dang / gos la chags pas gos dang gnas mal la chags pas gnas mal sems shing kun du chags par 'gyur ba de /
analyzed: de bzhin du kha cig bsod snyoms la chags pas bsod snyoms la sems chags shing kun du chags par 'gyur pa dang / gos la chags pas gos dang gnas mal la chags pas gnas mal sems shing kun du chags par 'gyur ba de /
translated: In the same way, some people, due to attachment to alms, have a mind attached and fully attached to alms. Due to attachment to robes, they have a mind attached and fully attached to robes. Due to attachment to bedding, they have a mind attached and fully attached to bedding.

original: 'di lta ste tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yon tan 'di rnams kyis sbyong bar byed cing drang por byed pa ste las su rung ba dang zag pa med pa dang dag par byed pa yin pa de'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yon tan
analyzed: 'di lta ste tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yon tan 'di rnams kyis sbyong bar byed cing drang por byed pa ste las su rung ba dang zag pa med pa dang dag par byed pa yin pa de'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yon tan
translated: Thus, they are called austerities because they purify, make straight, and make serviceable, since they purify, make straight, and make serviceable the body for the sake of abiding in pure conduct.

original: zhes bya'o // de la bsod snyoms la zas gya nom pa la chags pa dang / zas mang po la chags pa ni bar chad byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de la bsod snyoms la zas gya nom pa la chags pa dang / zas mang po la chags pa ni bar chad byed pa yin pas /
translated: Since attachment to fine and abundant food is an obstacle,

original: de'i phyir zas gya nom pa la chags pa spang ba'i phyir ni bsod snyoms pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zas gya nom pa la chags pa spang ba'i phyir ni bsod snyoms pa yin no //
translated: they are alms-beggars in order to abandon attachment to fine food.

original: zas mang po la chags pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir stan gcig pa dang zas phyis mi len pa yin no //
analyzed: zas mang po la chags pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir stan gcig pa dang zas phyis mi len pa yin no //
translated: They are single-sitting and not-after-meal-eaters in order to abandon attachment to abundant food.

original: de la gos la chags pa'i bar chad byed pa ni rnam pa gsum te /
analyzed: de la gos la chags pa'i bar chad byed pa ni rnam pa gsum te /
translated: Attachment to clothing is an obstacle in three ways:

original: gos mang po la chags pa dang / reg bya 'jam po la chags pa dang / gya nom pa la chags pa'o //
analyzed: gos mang po la chags pa dang / reg bya 'jam po la chags pa dang / gya nom pa la chags pa'o //
translated: attachment to abundant clothing, attachment to soft textures, and attachment to fine clothing.

original: de la gos mang po la chags pa spang ba'i phyir chos gos gsum pa yin no //🔽gos kyi reg bya 'jam po la chags pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir na phying pa pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gos mang po la chags pa spang ba'i phyir chos gos gsum pa yin no // gos kyi reg bya 'jam po la chags pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir na phying pa pa yin no //
translated: He is a wearer of three robes in order to abandon attachment to many clothes.🔽He is a wearer of coarse robes in order to abandon attachment to the softness of clothes.

original: gos gya nom pa la chags pa spang par bya ba'i phyir na phyag dar khrod pa yin no //
analyzed: gos gya nom pa la chags pa spang par bya ba'i phyir na phyag dar khrod pa yin no //
translated: He is a wearer of rag-robes in order to abandon attachment to fine clothes.

original: gnas mal la chags pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnas mal la chags pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are four attachments to bedding:

original: 'du 'dzi la chags pa dang / gnas la chags pa dang / mnyes pa dang nyal ba'i bde ba la chags pa dang / bsdu ba dang rkyong ba dang sprugs pa la chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi la chags pa dang / gnas la chags pa dang / mnyes pa dang nyal ba'i bde ba la chags pa dang / bsdu ba dang rkyong ba dang sprugs pa la chags pa'o //
translated: attachment to society, attachment to location, attachment to the pleasure of stretching out one’s limbs and lying down, and attachment to collecting, spreading, and fluffing the bedding.

original: de la 'du 'dzi la chags pa spang ba'i phyir ni dgon pa pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'du 'dzi la chags pa spang ba'i phyir ni dgon pa pa yin no //
translated: He is a forest-dweller in order to abandon attachment to society.

original: gnas la chags pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir ni shing drung ba dang bla gab med pa dang dur khrod pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas la chags pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir ni shing drung ba dang bla gab med pa dang dur khrod pa yin te /
translated: He is a tree-root-dweller, an open-air-dweller, and a charnel-ground-dweller in order to abandon attachment to location.

original: gzhan yang 'khrig pa la chags pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dur khrod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'khrig pa la chags pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dur khrod pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, he is a charnel-ground-dweller in order to abandon attachment to sex.

original: mnyes pa'i bde ba dang nyal ba'i bde ba la chags pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir ni cog pu pa yin no //
analyzed: mnyes pa'i bde ba dang nyal ba'i bde ba la chags pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir ni cog pu pa yin no //
translated: The cross-legged posture is for the purpose of abandoning attachment to the pleasure of lying down and the pleasure of delighting.

original: bsdu ba dang rkyong ba dang sprugs pa la chags pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir ni gzhi ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba dang rkyong ba dang sprugs pa la chags pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir ni gzhi ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: The posture in accordance with the basis is for the purpose of abandoning attachment to contraction, expansion, and shaking.

original: de ltar na sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par gyur pa de rnams ni 'dus pa spong ba la 'jug pa ste nyan thos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par gyur pa de rnams ni 'dus pa spong ba la 'jug pa ste nyan thos zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, those who possess the ascetic qualities are said to be śrāvakas, engaged in abandoning the assembly.

original: de @107b dang de rnams dang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rdo rje'i brdul zhugs la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi khur khyer ba gang yin pa de rnams ni smyon pa ma yin zhing 'on kyang de kho na nyid don du gnyer ba
analyzed: de @107b dang de rnams dang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rdo rje'i brdul zhugs la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi khur khyer ba gang yin pa de rnams ni smyon pa ma yin zhing 'on kyang de kho na nyid don du gnyer ba
translated: Those who take up the other and other sufferings spoken by the Blessed One, such as the vajra-like suffering, are not insane, but are

original: dang brtul zhugs len par byed do //
analyzed: dang brtul zhugs len par byed do //
translated: those who take up the practice, striving for the meaning of reality.

original: sems ni de kho na nyid kyang sngar bshad pa'i rig pas dpyad nas mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: sems ni de kho na nyid kyang sngar bshad pa'i rig pas dpyad nas mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa kho na yin no //
translated: The mind is reality, and that is the stage of manifest enlightenment, as explained above by the analysis with awareness.

original: de'i phyir mngon par byang chub pa'i 'dod pa de rnams btul zhugs tha dad pa'i tshogs la brten pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon par byang chub pa'i 'dod pa de rnams btul zhugs tha dad pa'i tshogs la brten pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, those who desire manifest enlightenment are based on the assembly of different kinds of yogis.

original: mi shes pa ni spang ba la /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni spang ba la /
translated: In order to abandon ignorance,

original: kun kyang blo gros mtshungs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: kun kyang blo gros mtshungs pa'i phyir //
translated: all of them have the same intelligence.

original: sems ni kun tu 'jug pa la //
analyzed: sems ni kun tu 'jug pa la //
translated: The mind is completely engaged

original: dpyad pa 'jug pa ma yin no /
analyzed: dpyad pa 'jug pa ma yin no /
translated: in the analysis, but not in the engagement.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not the intended meaning.🔽Now, in order to teach that if reality does not exist, those are fruitless,

original: da ni de kho na nyid med na de rnams 'bras bu med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: da ni de kho na nyid med na de rnams 'bras bu med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: it is said:

original: de nyid dman pa de rnams kyis //
analyzed: de nyid dman pa de rnams kyis //
translated: Those of inferior reality

original: brtul zhugs spyod pa la sogs rim //
analyzed: brtul zhugs spyod pa la sogs rim //
translated: have the stages of yogic conduct, and so on.

original: de nyid ye shes dman pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid ye shes dman pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of inferior wisdom of reality,

original: des ni grol bar rnyed mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya bas gsungs te /
analyzed: des ni grol bar rnyed mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya bas gsungs te /
translated: they will not find liberation through that.

original: de nyid dman pa ste de kho na nyid dang bral ba'i brtul zhugs can de rnams kyis brtul zhugs la sogs pa dang spyod pa la sogs pa'i rim pa'i lam gang yin pa des ni grol ba mi 'thob cing thar ba thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid dman pa ste de kho na nyid dang bral ba'i brtul zhugs can de rnams kyis brtul zhugs la sogs pa dang spyod pa la sogs pa'i rim pa'i lam gang yin pa des ni grol ba mi 'thob cing thar ba thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are inferior, i.e., who are devoid of reality, do not attain liberation by that path which is a sequence of observances, etc. and conduct, etc.

original: de nyid ye shes te bzhi pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid ye shes te bzhi pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: That is reality and intuition, because it is the fourth.

original: de kho na nyid kyang yin la ye shes rnam par dag par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ye shes kyang yin pas de nyid la ye shes so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyang yin la ye shes rnam par dag par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ye shes kyang yin pas de nyid la ye shes so //
translated: It is reality because it is the cause of the purification of intuition. It is intuition because it is the cause of the purification of reality. Thus, it is reality and intuition.

original: de dman zhing de dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dman zhing de dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is inferior because it is devoid of that.

original: re zhig de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa ni thar ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin zhing /
analyzed: re zhig de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa ni thar ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin zhing /
translated: The thorough knowledge of reality is the principal cause of liberation.

original: brtul zhugs ni mos pa'i bye brag gis yan lag gi gtso bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brtul zhugs ni mos pa'i bye brag gis yan lag gi gtso bo ni ma yin no //
translated: Observance is not the principal limb by reason of the variety of convictions.

original: brtul zhugs med par yang de kho na nyid shes pa rnams kyi thar pa thob pa'i phyir de kho na nyid med na brtul zhugs kyis thar pa mi thob bo snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: brtul zhugs med par yang de kho na nyid shes pa rnams kyi thar pa thob pa'i phyir de kho na nyid med na brtul zhugs kyis thar pa mi thob bo snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he thinks that if reality does not exist, one does not attain liberation through observances.

original: 'di ltar 'dra ba las 'bras bu 'dra ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dra ba las 'bras bu 'dra ba 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, an effect similar to a cause arises.

original: thar ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i nyes ba thams cad spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: thar ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i nyes ba thams cad spangs pa yin la /
translated: Liberation is the abandonment of all faults of discursive thought.

original: de kho na nyid kyang spros pa med pa'i ye shes yin pa de'i phyir thar pa'i rgyu de kho na yin par rigs so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyang spros pa med pa'i ye shes yin pa de'i phyir thar pa'i rgyu de kho na yin par rigs so //
translated: And reality is the wisdom free from conceptual proliferation. Therefore, it is reasonable that reality is the cause of liberation.

original: brtul zhugs ni ma yin te /
analyzed: brtul zhugs ni ma yin te /
translated: But observances are not,

original: de ni spros pa mang po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni spros pa mang po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are associated with much conceptual proliferation.

original: rab tu byed pa mdzad pas kyang //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa mdzad pas kyang //
translated: The author of the treatise also says:

original: gzhan las shes min zhi ba dang // spros @108a * //
analyzed: gzhan las shes min zhi ba dang // spros @108a * //
translated: Not known from elsewhere, peaceful,

original: pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
analyzed: pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
translated: not proliferated by proliferations,

original: rnam rtog med don tha dad min //
analyzed: rnam rtog med don tha dad min //
translated: nonconceptual, not a different object

original: de nyid kho na mtshan nyid do /
analyzed: de nyid kho na mtshan nyid do /
translated: that alone is the characteristic of reality.

original: zhes gsungs te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not the intended meaning.

original: da ni sa'i dbye ba /
analyzed: da ni sa'i dbye ba /
translated: Now, the divisions of the stages.

original: dang po'i las kyi rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: dang po'i las kyi rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: The yoga of the beginner

original: sa brgyad pa ni 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa ni 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: attains the eighth stage.

original: snang ba gsum po mthong bas ni //
analyzed: snang ba gsum po mthong bas ni //
translated: By seeing the three appearances,

original: sa bcu la ni rab tu gnas //
analyzed: sa bcu la ni rab tu gnas //
translated: one is well-positioned on the ten stages.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: dang po'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum gyi rim gyis stong pa chen po'i gnas 'thob pa des ni sa brgyad pa mi g-yo bar 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum gyi rim gyis stong pa chen po'i gnas 'thob pa des ni sa brgyad pa mi g-yo bar 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The so-called yoga of the beginner is the samadhi of the stage of generation. By the process of the three wisdoms of appearance, etc., one attains the abode of the great emptiness. By that, one attains the eighth stage, the Immovable.

original: 'di ltar bskyed pa'i rim pas lha'i rnam par bskyed nas phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang thob pa dang dbang bskur lnga'i ni rig pa'i dbang nyid yin pa'i phyir kun gzhi la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa log par gyur bar mi g-yo ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bskyed pa'i rim pas lha'i rnam par bskyed nas phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang thob pa dang dbang bskur lnga'i ni rig pa'i dbang nyid yin pa'i phyir kun gzhi la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa log par gyur bar mi g-yo ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, by the stage of generation, having generated the form of the deity, one attains the irreversible initiation, and the five initiations are the initiation of wisdom itself. Therefore, by the attainment of the Immovable, the alaya consciousness, etc., are reversed.

original: de bzhin du snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum gyi rim gyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gyur pa thob pa ni mi g-yo ba thob pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum gyi rim gyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gyur pa thob pa ni mi g-yo ba thob pa kho na yin te /
translated: Likewise, the attainment of the transformation of the foundation consciousness through the stages of the three exalted wisdoms of appearance and so on is the attainment of the immovable.🔽Thus it is said:

original: 'di ltar / bag chags med par gyur nas ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bag chags med par gyur nas ni //
translated: Having become free of latent tendencies,

original: sa brgyad pa ni nye bar 'gro //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa ni nye bar 'gro // zhes gsungs so //
translated: one approaches the eighth ground.

original: de'i rjes la snang ba gsum po mthong ba ste 'od gsal ba rang bzhin dang rnam par shes pa 'gog pa'i phyir man ngag thob pa de ni sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin la rab tu gnas par gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la snang ba gsum po mthong ba ste 'od gsal ba rang bzhin dang rnam par shes pa 'gog pa'i phyir man ngag thob pa de ni sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin la rab tu gnas par gyur te /
translated: After that, having seen the three appearances and attained the esoteric instructions for the sake of stopping the natural luminosity and consciousness, one becomes fully stabilized on the tenth ground Cloud of Dharma.

original: der ni ye shes la dbang thob pa'i phyir sa bcu pa yang de'i rang bzhin nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: der ni ye shes la dbang thob pa'i phyir sa bcu pa yang de'i rang bzhin nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because one attains mastery of exalted wisdom, the tenth ground is also the nature of that.

original: de'i rjes thogs la dpe las byung ba'i de kho na nyid brtan par gyur pa na rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis kun du 'od thob ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes thogs la dpe las byung ba'i de kho na nyid brtan par gyur pa na rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis kun du 'od thob ste /
translated: After that, when the reality that arises from the example is stabilized, one attains the all-illuminating through the vajra-like samadhi.

original: de yang mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa las 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa las 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained in the chapter on the stages of manifest enlightenment.

original: de nyid sa bcu gcig pa yin zhing mos pa spyod pa'i sa la ltos nas bcu gnyis pa sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba yin te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid sa bcu gcig pa yin zhing mos pa spyod pa'i sa la ltos nas bcu gnyis pa sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba yin te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is the eleventh stage, and in relation to the stage of devoted engagement, it is the twelfth stage, the buddha stage.

original: da ni sngar bshad pa'i sh'akya seng ge'i gtam rgyud gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: da ni sngar bshad pa'i sh'akya seng ge'i gtam rgyud gsal bar byed de /
translated: Now, the story of Shakyamuni, previously explained, is clarified.

original: mngon par byang chub legs thob nas //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub legs thob nas //
translated: Having attained manifest enlightenment,

original: gtsang ma'i gnas su nye bar 'gro //
analyzed: gtsang ma'i gnas su nye bar 'gro //
translated: he went to the pure abodes.

original: sangs rgyas zhing las mi ldog cing //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing las mi ldog cing //
translated: Not turning back from the buddha stage,

original: tshe 'di nyid la thams cad mkhyen //🔽bcom ldan 'das des mngon par byang chub pa thob nas te man ngag bzhi pa mngon du byas nas sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la thams cad mkhyen // bcom ldan 'das des mngon par byang chub pa thob nas te man ngag bzhi pa mngon du byas nas sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir /
translated: he became omniscient in this very lifetime.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gnas gtsang @108b mar song bar gyur to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gnas gtsang @108b mar song bar gyur to //
translated: Having attained manifest enlightenment, having actualized the fourth intimate instruction, the transcendent conqueror went to the pure abodes, one part of the form realm, in order to benefit sentient beings.

original: de nas rin po che sna bdun mchog tu 'bar ba'i rang bzhin can bsam gtan gyi zas dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su bzhugs nas mi ldog pa ste /
analyzed: de nas rin po che sna bdun mchog tu 'bar ba'i rang bzhin can bsam gtan gyi zas dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su bzhugs nas mi ldog pa ste /
translated: Then, abiding in the buddhafields endowed with the food of concentration, which have the nature of the seven supreme precious substances, they are irreversible.
