original: byang chub kyi de kho na nyid las slar mi nyams pa'i chos can dang mthong ba'i chos kyi tshe 'di nyid la nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa rtsa nas bton cing sems can gyi khams ma lus pa'i sems kyi spyod pa'i mngon par shes pa thams
analyzed: byang chub kyi de kho na nyid las slar mi nyams pa'i chos can dang mthong ba'i chos kyi tshe 'di nyid la nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa rtsa nas bton cing sems can gyi khams ma lus pa'i sems kyi spyod pa'i mngon par shes pa thams
translated: They are irreversible from the reality of enlightenment, and they are not subject to regression. They have extracted the afflictions along with their traces, and they have the higher perceptions of the activities of the minds of all sentient beings in their entirety.

original: cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: They become omniscient.

original: yang na rnal 'byor pa gang yang rung ba cig gis ye shes kyi rim pas mngon par byang chub pa thob pa da yang gnas gtsang mar 'dug ste /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor pa gang yang rung ba cig gis ye shes kyi rim pas mngon par byang chub pa thob pa da yang gnas gtsang mar 'dug ste /
translated: Or else, any yogin or yogini who has attained manifest enlightenment through the stages of wisdom will also abide in the pure abodes.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du song nas chos bstan pas sems can rnams 'dul bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du song nas chos bstan pas sems can rnams 'dul bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Like the Omniscient One, they go from buddhafield to buddhafield and tame sentient beings by teaching the Dharma. This is the literal meaning, not the implied meaning.

original: re zhig sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas sems rnam par dag pa la goms par byed pa gang yin pa de rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: re zhig sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas sems rnam par dag pa la goms par byed pa gang yin pa de rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The stages of mantra and mudra, by which one becomes familiar with the purification of the mind, have been explained.

original: spyod pa rnam pa gsum spyod pa gang yin pa de rnams kyis kyang mngon par byang chub pa go rims bzhin du goms par bya'o //
analyzed: spyod pa rnam pa gsum spyod pa gang yin pa de rnams kyis kyang mngon par byang chub pa go rims bzhin du goms par bya'o //
translated: Those who practice the three types of conduct should also become familiar with the manifest enlightenment in the proper order.

original: de'i phyir thabs kyi bye brag gis mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa gsum thob par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir thabs kyi bye brag gis mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa gsum thob par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, in order to show that the three types of manifest enlightenment are attained by the different methods, it is said:

original: chags sogs rol mo rgya chen po //
analyzed: chags sogs rol mo rgya chen po //
translated: The great music of passion and so forth,

original: chos 'byung mngon par byang chub pa'i //
analyzed: chos 'byung mngon par byang chub pa'i //
translated: The manifest enlightenment of the dharma source,

original: ji ltar spyod pa'i spyod pa ni //
analyzed: ji ltar spyod pa'i spyod pa ni //
translated: The conduct of practice,

original: chos dbyings mngon par byang chub pa'i //
analyzed: chos dbyings mngon par byang chub pa'i //
translated: The manifest enlightenment of the dharmadhatu,

original: bla med mngon par byang chub pa //
analyzed: bla med mngon par byang chub pa //
translated: The highest manifest enlightenment.

original: mngon par byang chub rnal 'byor gyis //🔽spros bcas la sogs spyod pa yis //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub rnal 'byor gyis // spros bcas la sogs spyod pa yis //
translated: By the yoga of manifest enlightenment,🔽The yogi/nī should practice here

original: rnal 'byor pas ni 'dir goms bya //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ni 'dir goms bya //
translated: with the conduct of elaboration and so forth.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: mngon par byang chub pa ni chos 'byang gi mngon par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi mngon par byang chub pa dang / bla na med pa'i mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa ni chos 'byang gi mngon par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi mngon par byang chub pa dang / bla na med pa'i mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Manifest enlightenment is threefold: manifest enlightenment of the source of phenomena, manifest enlightenment of the realm of phenomena, and highest manifest enlightenment.

original: de la chos 'byung gi mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar longs spyod pa'i lam 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rol mo rgya chen po rnams kyis thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la chos 'byung gi mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar longs spyod pa'i lam 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rol mo rgya chen po rnams kyis thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Among them, “manifest enlightenment of the source of phenomena” is attained by means of the great display of desire and so forth, enjoying the five sense objects.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa ji ltar rnyed pas lus gnas par bya ste bsgrub par bya'o //🔽bla na med pa'i mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes @109a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa ji ltar rnyed pas lus gnas par bya ste bsgrub par bya'o // bla na med pa'i mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes @109a * //
translated: Likewise, the so-called “manifest enlightenment of the realm of phenomena” is to be accomplished by maintaining the body with whatever food and drink one finds.

original: kyi phyag rgya dang lhan cig sngags kyi rim pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbye bas yongs su shes pa'i mngon par byang chub pa'i rnal 'byor gyis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: kyi phyag rgya dang lhan cig sngags kyi rim pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbye bas yongs su shes pa'i mngon par byang chub pa'i rnal 'byor gyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The so-called “unsurpassed manifest enlightenment” is to be accomplished by the yoga of manifest enlightenment through thorough knowledge by means of the divisions of desire and so on, by means of the mantra process together with the gnosis consort.

original: de rnams nyid spyod pa rnam pa gsum yin te /
analyzed: de rnams nyid spyod pa rnam pa gsum yin te /
translated: Those are the three types of conduct.

original: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa dang / spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lung bstan pa'i phyag rgya dang / lha'i bu mo la sogs pa dgug pa dang lhan cig tu bya'o //
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa dang / spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lung bstan pa'i phyag rgya dang / lha'i bu mo la sogs pa dgug pa dang lhan cig tu bya'o //
translated: The conduct with elaboration is to be performed together with a pledge seal, a seal prophesied by the Blessed One, or a celestial maiden summoned and so on.

original: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang lhan cig tu bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang lhan cig tu bya'o //
translated: The extremely unelaborate conduct is to be performed together with the gnosis consort.

original: zas ni 'dod pa lnga la nye bar longs spyod pa dang / ji ltar rnyed pa'i zas dang bsam gtan gyi zas so //
analyzed: zas ni 'dod pa lnga la nye bar longs spyod pa dang / ji ltar rnyed pa'i zas dang bsam gtan gyi zas so //
translated: The food is to enjoy the five sense objects, the food of whatever is found, and the food of meditative concentration.

original: spros pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa rnam pa gsum po 'di rnams kyi rnal 'byor pas goms par bya zhing mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa rnam pa gsum po 'di rnams kyi rnal 'byor pas goms par bya zhing mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: The yogi/nī should practice these three types of conduct, elaborate and so forth, and meditate on the stage of manifest enlightenment. This is the literal reading.

original: 'di ltar bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The summarized meaning is as follows.

original: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni bsam gtan gyi khang pa sum brtsegs su bza' ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa 'og khang du bzhag ste /
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni bsam gtan gyi khang pa sum brtsegs su bza' ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa 'og khang du bzhag ste /
translated: The yogi/nī who practices the elaborate mode of conduct should place food, drink, and so forth in the lower story of the three-storied meditative stability house.

original: rol cha'i bye brag brdung ba rnam par khang du bzhag nas yang thog tu khri steng du dbus kyi gtso bor gyur pas nye bar 'dug ste /🔽sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo'i rang bzhin dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams dang / mtshams la sogs pa rnams kyi ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi lha mo rgyan dang ldan pa lngas yongs su bskor bas de thams cad lha'i skur bsgom pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis rigs lnga dang bsre ba byas nas /
analyzed: rol cha'i bye brag brdung ba rnam par khang du bzhag nas yang thog tu khri steng du dbus kyi gtso bor gyur pas nye bar 'dug ste / sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo'i rang bzhin dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams dang / mtshams la sogs pa rnams kyi ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi lha mo rgyan dang ldan pa lngas yongs su bskor bas de thams cad lha'i skur bsgom pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis rigs lnga dang bsre ba byas nas /
translated: Having placed the various musical instruments in the house, he should sit on a throne on the roof, in the center, surrounded by the goddesses of the five families, such as Buddhalocanā, and so on, who are the nature of the pledge seals, and by the goddesses of the directions, such as Rūpavajrā, who are the nature of the commitment seals.🔽Having mixed all of them with the five families, the yogī should enter into union with the host of various activities, having first meditated on all of them as divine bodies.

original: rdo rje'i glu snyan pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa len pa de rnams kyis dga' bar byas shing 'dod pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i longs spyod kyis tshim par byas pa'i rnal 'byor pas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bya ba'i tshogs kyis snyoms par 'jug par bya zhing
analyzed: rdo rje'i glu snyan pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa len pa de rnams kyis dga' bar byas shing 'dod pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i longs spyod kyis tshim par byas pa'i rnal 'byor pas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bya ba'i tshogs kyis snyoms par 'jug par bya zhing
translated: The yogī should please them with the singing of various beautiful vajra songs and satisfy them with the enjoyment of various pleasures.

original: / ji srid bde ba chen po'i de kho na nyid nyams su myong ba de srid du gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa dang chos 'byung gi mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: / ji srid bde ba chen po'i de kho na nyid nyams su myong ba de srid du gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa dang chos 'byung gi mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: This is the manifest enlightenment of the conduct with elaboration and the source of phenomena.🔽The practitioner who has the conduct without elaboration should take the consort who has been prophesied by the tathagatas seen in the dream signs, thinking, “You should practice with such and such a consort.”

original: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas rmi lam gyi mtshan mar mthong ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi phyag rgya che ge mo zhig bzung la spyod pa gyis shig ces lung bstan pa de la yid ches par byas nas @109b legs par
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas rmi lam gyi mtshan mar mthong ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi phyag rgya che ge mo zhig bzung la spyod pa gyis shig ces lung bstan pa de la yid ches par byas nas @109b legs par
translated: Having gained confidence in that prophecy,

original: bslabs shing rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyag rgya blangs te /
analyzed: bslabs shing rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyag rgya blangs te /
translated: one should take a consort who is well trained and suitable for one’s family.

original: 'dod pa'i lha dang rjes su mthun par shing la sogs pa las byas pa'i bcos ma'i ral pa la sogs pa byas nas ji ltar rnyed pa'i zas kyis chog shes pa dang bdag dang bdag med pas yul nas yul gzhan 'gro zhing //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lha dang rjes su mthun par shing la sogs pa las byas pa'i bcos ma'i ral pa la sogs pa byas nas ji ltar rnyed pa'i zas kyis chog shes pa dang bdag dang bdag med pas yul nas yul gzhan 'gro zhing //
translated: Having made a substitute hair lock, etc., from wood, etc., in accordance with the desired deity, one should be satisfied with whatever food one obtains, and one should go from one’s country to another country, without self and without other.

original: sus kyang shes par mi 'gyur ba de ltar ji srid du mngon par byang chub pa gsal bar 'gyur gyi bar du de dang lhan cig bsgom pa'i lam la goms par bya ste /
analyzed: sus kyang shes par mi 'gyur ba de ltar ji srid du mngon par byang chub pa gsal bar 'gyur gyi bar du de dang lhan cig bsgom pa'i lam la goms par bya ste /
translated: Thus, until the manifest enlightenment is clear, one should practice the path of cultivation together with her.

original: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang chos kyi dbyings kyi mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang chos kyi dbyings kyi mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: This is the conduct free of conceptual elaboration and the manifest enlightenment of the realm of phenomena.

original: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni phyi rol gyi brtags pa'i yul spangs nas ye shes kyi phyag rgya blangs te /
analyzed: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni phyi rol gyi brtags pa'i yul spangs nas ye shes kyi phyag rgya blangs te /
translated: The yogi/nī who possesses the conduct free of conceptual elaboration, having abandoned external imagined objects, takes up the wisdom consort.🔽Whether with or without observances, he/she should remain without grasping, and the world will laugh at him/her, saying, “He/she is a madman!”

original: brtul zhugs dang bcas pa'am brtul zhugs med pas gang yang rung bar 'dug cing yongs su 'dzin pa med pa 'di ni smyon pa'o zhes 'jig rten pa rnams kyis bzhad gad du byed pa sdong bu rtsa ba dang 'bras bu'i zas dang bsam gtan gyi zas dang ldan
analyzed: brtul zhugs dang bcas pa'am brtul zhugs med pas gang yang rung bar 'dug cing yongs su 'dzin pa med pa 'di ni smyon pa'o zhes 'jig rten pa rnams kyis bzhad gad du byed pa sdong bu rtsa ba dang 'bras bu'i zas dang bsam gtan gyi zas dang ldan
translated: He/she should eat the food of roots, stalks, and fruits, and the food of concentration.

original: pas ji srid mngon par byang chub thob pas 'grub par 'gyur ba de srid du de dang snyoms par 'jug pas bsam gtan la sogs par bya ste /
analyzed: pas ji srid mngon par byang chub thob pas 'grub par 'gyur ba de srid du de dang snyoms par 'jug pas bsam gtan la sogs par bya ste /
translated: As long as one does not attain manifest enlightenment, one should practice concentration and so forth by entering into union with the consort.

original: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang bla na med pa'i mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang bla na med pa'i mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: The phrase extremely unelaborate conduct and unsurpassed manifest enlightenment is literal.

original: da ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i de kho na nyid la brten nas goms par byas pas ci zhig bya snyam du sems pa gang yin pa de rnams kyi phyogs snga ma'i sgo nas tshigs su bcad pa /🔽gzod nas grub pa'i rang bzhin can //
analyzed: da ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i de kho na nyid la brten nas goms par byas pas ci zhig bya snyam du sems pa gang yin pa de rnams kyi phyogs snga ma'i sgo nas tshigs su bcad pa / gzod nas grub pa'i rang bzhin can //
translated: Now, for those who think, What is the point of familiarizing oneself with the natural expression of reality?, the following verse responds from the standpoint of the opponent.🔽It is primordially existent by nature.

original: de ni rang bzhin gyis grub cing //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyis grub cing //
translated: It is naturally existent.

original: rtog las de nyid mi skye na //
analyzed: rtog las de nyid mi skye na //
translated: Since reality does not arise from conceptualization,

original: bslab pa'i sbyor bas ci zhig bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
analyzed: bslab pa'i sbyor bas ci zhig bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
translated: what is the point of applying oneself to training?

original: 'di skad du rnam par shes pa'i rim pa rnam par dag pa'am /
analyzed: 'di skad du rnam par shes pa'i rim pa rnam par dag pa'am /
translated: This is saying that some think, What is the point of familiarizing oneself with the natural expression of reality?

original: spyod pa'i rim gyis de kho na nyid thob par bya'o zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyod pa'i rim gyis de kho na nyid thob par bya'o zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that one should attain reality by the stages of conduct.

original: 'di ltar de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: Thus, what is called “reality” is the essence of suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid de yang thams cad kyi na dang gnas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chos nyid dang rtag pa dang rang bzhin gyis grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de yang thams cad kyi na dang gnas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chos nyid dang rtag pa dang rang bzhin gyis grub pa yin no //
translated: And that suchness is the intrinsic nature of all things, and is permanent and established by intrinsic nature.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin te ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa yin zhing rtog pa las mi skye ste ye shes dang rnam par shes pa dag pa'i rim pa'i rnam par rtog pa las mi skye zhing 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin te ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa yin zhing rtog pa las mi skye ste ye shes dang rnam par shes pa dag pa'i rim pa'i rnam par rtog pa las mi skye zhing 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is established by intrinsic nature, and does not arise from conceptual thought, does not arise from the conceptual thought of the stages of pure wisdom and consciousness.

original: de lta yin na de ni mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /🔽rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo yin @110a * //🔽pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de lta yin na de ni mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te / rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo yin @110a * // pa'i phyir la /
translated: If that were so, it would be impermanent,🔽because it would have the nature of conceptual thought.

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the effect must accord with its cause.

original: de bas na gzod ma nas grub pa'i de bzhin nyid la slob pa'i sbyor ba ste rim par bsgom pas ci zhig bya zhing rnam pa thams cad du goms par bya bar mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzod ma nas grub pa'i de bzhin nyid la slob pa'i sbyor ba ste rim par bsgom pas ci zhig bya zhing rnam pa thams cad du goms par bya bar mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, what is the use of training in, that is, meditating on, the stages of the primordial reality? It is not reasonable to cultivate it in any way. This is the meaning of the words, which are to be taken literally.

original: lan du / ye shes rim pa spangs nas ni //
analyzed: lan du / ye shes rim pa spangs nas ni //
translated: In response, it is said:

original: gang zhig de ltar 'dir rtog pa //
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar 'dir rtog pa //
translated: Those who think this way here,

original: de yi dbye ba mi shes pa //
analyzed: de yi dbye ba mi shes pa //
translated: ignorant of its divisions,

original: de rnams slar yang slob par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya bas gsungs te /
analyzed: de rnams slar yang slob par 'gyur // zhes bya bas gsungs te /
translated: will have to train again.

original: rgol ba gang zhig rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i phyogs la brten nas ye shes rim pa ste rnam par shes pa dang ye shes kyi rim pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi shes pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rim pa'i dbye ba spangs shing bor nas goms
analyzed: rgol ba gang zhig rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i phyogs la brten nas ye shes rim pa ste rnam par shes pa dang ye shes kyi rim pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi shes pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rim pa'i dbye ba spangs shing bor nas goms
translated: Those who argue in this way, relying on a position of inherent existence, are ignorant of the stages of wakefulness, that is, the stages of consciousness and wakefulness as cause and effect, and they have abandoned, discarded, the divisions of the stages of the antidotes.

original: par bya ba mi rigs so zhes de ltar rtog par byed cing smra bar byed pa ste de rnams kyis ni ye shes la sogs pa rnams kyi dbye ba mi shes shing ye shes gang gis rang bzhin ji lta bu dang gang las rang bzhin gang zhig 'byung
analyzed: par bya ba mi rigs so zhes de ltar rtog par byed cing smra bar byed pa ste de rnams kyis ni ye shes la sogs pa rnams kyi dbye ba mi shes shing ye shes gang gis rang bzhin ji lta bu dang gang las rang bzhin gang zhig 'byung
translated: They do not know the divisions of wisdom and so on, and they do not know by what wisdom, what nature, and from what, what nature arises.

original: ba dang / de rnams kyang ji ltar spang bar bya ba yin pa mi shes te de la goms par ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba dang / de rnams kyang ji ltar spang bar bya ba yin pa mi shes te de la goms par ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not know how to abandon those, because they have not become familiar with them.

original: de bas na dbye ba mi shes shing bla ma rmongs pa gang yang rung ba zhig gis dbang bskur ba te /
analyzed: de bas na dbye ba mi shes shing bla ma rmongs pa gang yang rung ba zhig gis dbang bskur ba te /
translated: Therefore, they do not know the divisions, and they do not trust that they have attained reality when they are initiated by any confused guru.

original: khyod kyis de kho na nyid thob bo zhes yid ches par ma byas pa de rnams kyis de kho na nyid ma thong pa'i phyir slar yang slob par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyis de kho na nyid thob bo zhes yid ches par ma byas pa de rnams kyis de kho na nyid ma thong pa'i phyir slar yang slob par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Because they have not attained reality, they will have to train again.

original: slar yang thob par bya ba'i don du de'i thabs la de rnams kyis gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: slar yang thob par bya ba'i don du de'i thabs la de rnams kyis gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is only necessary for them to practice the means to attain it again.

original: gang gi re zhig de bzhin nyid ni grub pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang glo bur ba'i dri mas bsgribs pa mi gsal ba de'i phyir rnal 'byor goms par byas pas dri ma rnams spangs nas /
analyzed: gang gi re zhig de bzhin nyid ni grub pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang glo bur ba'i dri mas bsgribs pa mi gsal ba de'i phyir rnal 'byor goms par byas pas dri ma rnams spangs nas /
translated: Now, although suchness is indeed established, still, it is obscured by adventitious defilements and is not clear. Therefore, by practicing yoga, the defilements are abandoned,

original: de ni rang nyid kyis bsal bar gyur to //
analyzed: de ni rang nyid kyis bsal bar gyur to //
translated: and it becomes clear by itself.

original: de tsam gyis de mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis de mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But it does not become impermanent by that much,

original: dri ma bsal ba ni de'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma bsal ba ni de'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the removal of defilements is its very cause.

original: dri ma bsal ba ni gsal bar byed pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mar me bzhin no ;
analyzed: dri ma bsal ba ni gsal bar byed pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mar me bzhin no ;
translated: The removal of defilements has the nature of merely making it clear, like a lamp.

original: / de bas na goms par bya ba kho na rigs pa yin te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: / de bas na goms par bya ba kho na rigs pa yin te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is only reasonable to practice, as it is literally taught.

original: de nyid la goms par bya ba'i rim pa ni //
analyzed: de nyid la goms par bya ba'i rim pa ni //
translated: The stages of practicing that are🔽knowing the division of the appearance of the nature

original: rang bzhin snang ba'i dbye shes shing //
analyzed: rang bzhin snang ba'i dbye shes shing //
translated: and

original: de nyid bzhi pa la brten pa //
analyzed: de nyid bzhi pa la brten pa //
translated: That, based on the fourth reality,

original: gang zhig rnam gsum slob byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig rnam gsum slob byed pa //
translated: he who trains in the three aspects,

original: des ni 'bras bu myur thob 'gyur //
analyzed: des ni 'bras bu myur thob 'gyur //
translated: quickly attains the result.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: rnal @110b 'byor gang zhig gis sngar bshad pa'i rim pas rang bzhin rnams dang ye shes kyi snang ba rnams kyi dbye ba shes shing /
analyzed: rnal @110b 'byor gang zhig gis sngar bshad pa'i rim pas rang bzhin rnams dang ye shes kyi snang ba rnams kyi dbye ba shes shing /
translated: The yogi who, by the process previously explained, knows the divisions of the natures and the appearances of intuition,

original: de shes nas de kho na nyid bzhi pa thams cad stong pa la brten zhing len par byed do //
analyzed: de shes nas de kho na nyid bzhi pa thams cad stong pa la brten zhing len par byed do //
translated: and, knowing that, relies on and takes up the fourth reality, the emptiness of everything,

original: sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rang bzhin dang shes pa'i tshogs la rnam gsum sta /
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rang bzhin dang shes pa'i tshogs la rnam gsum sta /
translated: by the process of mantra and seal, trains in the three aspects of the assembly of natures and consciousnesses.

original: rnam pa ste gsum po de rnams kyis slob par byed pa gang yin pa des ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'od gsal ba 'bras bu myur du ste /
analyzed: rnam pa ste gsum po de rnams kyis slob par byed pa gang yin pa des ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'od gsal ba 'bras bu myur du ste /
translated: He who trains in those three aspects quickly attains the clear light characterized by the state of Great Vajradhara, the result.

original: de rnams 'gags pa dang dus mnyam pa kho na thob cing rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste sbas pa dang mthar thug pa dag gis bshad pa dag go //
analyzed: de rnams 'gags pa dang dus mnyam pa kho na thob cing rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste sbas pa dang mthar thug pa dag gis bshad pa dag go //
translated: The meaning is that they are attained and acquired precisely at the time they are stopped.

original: da ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa yin yang //
analyzed: da ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa yin yang //
translated: Now, although it is naturally present,

original: goms pa med na 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: goms pa med na 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it is not attained without cultivation.🔽In order to teach the example of this,

original: zhes bya ba'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: ji ltar shing la me gnas pa //
analyzed: ji ltar shing la me gnas pa //
translated: Just as fire, which is present in wood,

original: ma gtsubs par ni 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ma gtsubs par ni 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: does not appear without friction.

original: de bzhin goms med byang chub ni //
analyzed: de bzhin goms med byang chub ni //
translated: So too, enlightenment, without cultivation,

original: tshe 'di nyid la 'byung mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya bas gsungs te /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la 'byung mi 'gyur // zhes bya bas gsungs te /
translated: will not appear in this very life.

original: de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i kho na yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i kho na yin mod kyi /
translated: Although suchness is naturally present,

original: 'on kyang goms par bya ba gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang goms par bya ba gtso bo yin te /
translated: nevertheless, cultivation is primary.

original: ji ltar shing gi nang na gnas pa'i me ji srid gtsub shing dang gtsub sten gyi sbyor bas gtsubs pa ma byas pa de srid du yod du zin kyang de ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar shing gi nang na gnas pa'i me ji srid gtsub shing dang gtsub sten gyi sbyor bas gtsubs pa ma byas pa de srid du yod du zin kyang de ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as fire, which is present in wood, although it exists, does not appear as long as it is not rubbed by the application of the friction board and the rubbing stick.

original: de bzhin du goms pa med par byang chub mi 'byung na ;
analyzed: de bzhin du goms pa med par byang chub mi 'byung na ;
translated: Likewise, if enlightenment does not occur without cultivation,🔽then what need is there to mention this life?

original: khyad par du tshe 'dir lta ci smos / pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rim gyis goms par byed du zin kyang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub thob bo //
analyzed: khyad par du tshe 'dir lta ci smos / pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rim gyis goms par byed du zin kyang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub thob bo //
translated: Even though the yogi/nī of the perfections cultivates by means of the stages of the paths of seeing and cultivation, enlightenment is attained in three incalculable aeons.

original: sngags kyi gzhung la gnas par goms par byed na tshe 'di nyid la thob po zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi gzhung la gnas par goms par byed na tshe 'di nyid la thob po zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: But if one cultivates abiding in the texts of mantra, it is attained in this very life. This is the difference, which is literal.

original: da ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'i man ngag gis chos sbyin par bya ba'i slob ma rnams kyi snod dang snod ma yin pa brtag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: da ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'i man ngag gis chos sbyin par bya ba'i slob ma rnams kyi snod dang snod ma yin pa brtag pa'i phyir //
translated: Now, in order to examine the disciples who are vessels or non-vessels for the gift of Dharma by means of the esoteric instructions of the stage of pure mind,🔽it is said:

original: gang zhig g-yo blo le lo dang ldan bla ma smod //
analyzed: gang zhig g-yo blo le lo dang ldan bla ma smod //
translated: He who has a fickle mind, is lazy, and disparages the guru,

original: dbang bskur thob ces rlom pa'i sems dang ldan gyur pa //
analyzed: dbang bskur thob ces rlom pa'i sems dang ldan gyur pa //
translated: and has a mind that is arrogant, thinking, “I have received empowerment,”

original: kun mkhyan  rnyed par dka' snyam zhum pa'i sems ldan zhing //
analyzed: kun mkhyan  rnyed par dka' snyam zhum pa'i sems ldan zhing //
translated: and has a mind that is discouraged, thinking, “It is difficult to attain omniscience,”

original: bla ma'i skyon rnams mthong byed yon tan mi 'dod pa //
analyzed: bla ma'i skyon rnams mthong byed yon tan mi 'dod pa //
translated: He sees the faults of the guru, and does not want his good qualities.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'dir nyan pa po gang zag lnga yod do //
analyzed: 'dir nyan pa po gang zag lnga yod do //
translated: Here there are five kinds of listeners.

original: de las 'di ni tsandan lta bu'i gang zag go //
analyzed: de las 'di ni tsandan lta bu'i gang zag go //
translated: Among them, this one is the person who is like sandalwood.

original: g-yo'i blo dang ldan pa ni yon la sogs pa la sgyu byed pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo'i blo dang ldan pa ni yon la sogs pa la sgyu byed pa'o //
translated: He is crafty, because he is deceitful about gifts and so on.

original: le lo dang ldan pa ni thos pa le lo @111a * //
analyzed: le lo dang ldan pa ni thos pa le lo @111a * //
translated: He is lazy, because he is lazy about listening.

original: byed pa'o // gang la thos pa dang ldan par gyur pa'i bla ma de la smod pa ni /
analyzed: byed pa'o // gang la thos pa dang ldan par gyur pa'i bla ma de la smod pa ni /
translated: He disparages the guru from whom he has received teachings,

original: bdag la des ni cung zad kyang bstan pa med kyi /
analyzed: bdag la des ni cung zad kyang bstan pa med kyi /
translated: saying, “He has not taught me anything at all.

original: bdag nyid rang gi ngang gis shes rab kyis ldan pa kho na'o zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid rang gi ngang gis shes rab kyis ldan pa kho na'o zhes zer ba'o //
translated: I am just naturally endowed with wisdom.”

original: bdag gis dbang bskur ba thob po snyam nas nga rgyal dang bcas pa dang / de nas gal te mkhas pa 'ga' zhig gis lam la goms par gyis shig ces bskul ba de'i tshe thams cad mkhyen pa ni rnyed par sla ba ma yin no snyam pa'i zhum pa'i sems ldan zhing mos pa chung ba dang /
analyzed: bdag gis dbang bskur ba thob po snyam nas nga rgyal dang bcas pa dang / de nas gal te mkhas pa 'ga' zhig gis lam la goms par gyis shig ces bskul ba de'i tshe thams cad mkhyen pa ni rnyed par sla ba ma yin no snyam pa'i zhum pa'i sems ldan zhing mos pa chung ba dang /
translated: Then, if some wise person urges them to train on the path, they think, “It is not easy to attain omniscience,” and they become discouraged and have little interest.🔽In the same way, they see the faults of their guru, but they do not see their good qualities.

original: de bzhin du bla ma ste slob dpon gyi skyon rnams mthong bar byed kyi yon tan rnams ni mthong bar mi byed pa de ni tsandan lta bu'i gang zag kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bla ma ste slob dpon gyi skyon rnams mthong bar byed kyi yon tan rnams ni mthong bar mi byed pa de ni tsandan lta bu'i gang zag kho na yin no //
translated: This is the only kind of person who is like sandalwood.

original: de nyid slar yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid slar yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: This is what they are like.

original: gus nyan med par de nyid thob 'dod cing //
analyzed: gus nyan med par de nyid thob 'dod cing //
translated: They want to attain suchness without listening respectfully.

original: tshig rnams 'jam pos min zhes smra nas khro bcas 'gro //
analyzed: tshig rnams 'jam pos min zhes smra nas khro bcas 'gro //
translated: They say, “It’s not with sweet words,” and they leave in a huff.

original: tshogs nang bla ma mthong na de la rgyab kyis phyogs //
analyzed: tshogs nang bla ma mthong na de la rgyab kyis phyogs //
translated: When they see their guru in the midst of the assembly, they turn their backs on them.

original: de la dben par song na de phyag byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: de la dben par song na de phyag byed par 'gyur //
translated: When they go somewhere private, they make a show of paying them respect.

original: gus par nyan par 'dod pa dang de'i don du bsnyen bkur byed pa yang gus par nyan pa yin no //
analyzed: gus par nyan par 'dod pa dang de'i don du bsnyen bkur byed pa yang gus par nyan pa yin no //
translated: He is a devoted listener who wishes to hear and who serves for that purpose.🔽He is a devoted listener who wishes to hear and who serves for that purpose.

original: de spangs shing med par myur du ste thabs bde bas the tshom gyi sgo nas thabs kyi de kho na nyid 'dod cing //🔽gal te bla mas 'di ni g-yo can no //
analyzed: de spangs shing med par myur du ste thabs bde bas the tshom gyi sgo nas thabs kyi de kho na nyid 'dod cing // gal te bla mas 'di ni g-yo can no //
translated: He is a devoted listener who wishes to hear and who serves for that purpose.🔽If the guru knows that he is deceitful, he will clear up his doubts with gentle words, saying, “It is not so.”

original: zhes shes nas de'i the tshom bsal bar tshig 'jam pos de ltar ma yin no zhes brjod cing sas pa na khro bcas te khros par gyur nas 'gro ba ni bros pa'o //
analyzed: zhes shes nas de'i the tshom bsal bar tshig 'jam pos de ltar ma yin no zhes brjod cing sas pa na khro bcas te khros par gyur nas 'gro ba ni bros pa'o //
translated: If he is angry, he will leave.

original: rang gi bla ma tshogs nang mthong na te skye bo'i tshogs kyi dbus su mthong na rgyab kyis phyogs par byed pa ni mgo bkab nas yib par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi bla ma tshogs nang mthong na te skye bo'i tshogs kyi dbus su mthong na rgyab kyis phyogs par byed pa ni mgo bkab nas yib par byed pa'o //
translated: If he sees his guru in the midst of an assembly, in the middle of a group of people, he will turn his back on him, covering his head and hiding.

original: gal te dben par song zhing lkog na gcig po gnas par mthong na de la phyag byed cing 'dud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dben par song zhing lkog na gcig po gnas par mthong na de la phyag byed cing 'dud par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he goes to a solitary place and sees him alone, he will bow down to him and pay homage.

original: de la drin mi sbyin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la drin mi sbyin pa'i phyir //
translated: He does not repay his kindness.

original: de ltar rang bzhin ngan gyur slob ma dman pa ni //
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin ngan gyur slob ma dman pa ni //
translated: Thus, a disciple who is of bad character,

original: rang la skyes pa'i bu dang 'phags pa'i gzung ba yi //
analyzed: rang la skyes pa'i bu dang 'phags pa'i gzung ba yi //
translated: whether born of oneself or of a noble one,

original: rgyal rigs rje rigs mchog las skyes pa'ang rung //
analyzed: rgyal rigs rje rigs mchog las skyes pa'ang rung //
translated: whether born of a royal or a wealthy family,

original: brtan par nam yang drung du gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: brtan par nam yang drung du gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: should never be admitted into one’s presence.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: tsandan zhes bya ba slob ma ngan pa de lta bu ni gal te rang gi bu yin te de yang gzhan gyis byin pa dang / bcos ma ma yin gyi 'on kyang rang las skyes shing bdag nyid las skyes pa yin na yang /
analyzed: tsandan zhes bya ba slob ma ngan pa de lta bu ni gal te rang gi bu yin te de yang gzhan gyis byin pa dang / bcos ma ma yin gyi 'on kyang rang las skyes shing bdag nyid las skyes pa yin na yang /
translated: If such a bad disciple, called “sandalwood,” is one’s own son, and moreover, not adopted but born of oneself,

original: 'on kyang sngar bshad pa'i skyon gyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin ngan pa de ni drung du gzhag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang sngar bshad pa'i skyon gyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin ngan pa de ni drung du gzhag par mi bya ste /
translated: nevertheless, one should not admit into one’s presence that one of bad character who has the collection of faults explained above.

original: nye bar @111b gzhag par mi bya zhing chos bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar @111b gzhag par mi bya zhing chos bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not admit him into one’s presence and should not teach him the Dharma.

original: de bzhin du rje'u rigs la sogs pa gsum pa ni mchog nyid yin pa'i snod du rung ba yin zhing de rnams kyang 'phags pas gzung ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rje'u rigs la sogs pa gsum pa ni mchog nyid yin pa'i snod du rung ba yin zhing de rnams kyang 'phags pas gzung ba ste /
translated: They are also held by the āryas,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis phyogs mdzad pa yin yang gal te sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pa yin pa de'i drung du gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis phyogs mdzad pa yin yang gal te sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pa yin pa de'i drung du gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: but if they have the faults explained previously, they should not be placed in their presence. This is the literal meaning.

original: rin po che lta bu'i gang zag ni /
analyzed: rin po che lta bu'i gang zag ni /
translated: The person who is like a jewel

original: yon tan bzang ldan bcas shing brtson 'grus dang ldan pa //
analyzed: yon tan bzang ldan bcas shing brtson 'grus dang ldan pa //
translated: has good qualities, is endowed with virtue, and is diligent.

original: de nas bla ma 'khor la gus shing sangs rgyas mtshungs par blta //
analyzed: de nas bla ma 'khor la gus shing sangs rgyas mtshungs par blta //
translated: Then, the guru is devoted to the retinue and views them as equal to the Buddha.

original: rgyal ba'i chos rnams khong du chud cing bstan la shin tu dad //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i chos rnams khong du chud cing bstan la shin tu dad //
translated: They comprehend the Dharma of the Victor and have great faith in the teachings.

original: de 'dir snod gyur yin te de la drin dag sbyin par bya //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'dir snod gyur yin te de la drin dag sbyin par bya // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Here, they are vessels and should be given kindness.

original: yon tan bzang po ni tshul khrims la sogs pa rnams te de dag dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan bzang po ni tshul khrims la sogs pa rnams te de dag dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Good qualities are ethics and so on.

original: ye shes ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rtogs pa te de dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ye shes dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rtogs pa te de dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ye shes dang bcas pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with virtue, since he is endowed with that.

original: dge ba'i chos la spro ba ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la spro ba ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with effort, since he is enthusiastic about virtuous dharmas.

original: de bzhin du gus pas bla ma'i 'khor te rdo rje slob dpon dang de'i 'khor la sangs rgyas dang mtshungs par lta bar byed pa dang / de bzhin du rgyal ba'i chos sde snod gsum shes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i lam la shin tu dang zhing dang pa de ni man ngag gi snod du rung ba yin te de la drin sbyin par bya ba kho na'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gus pas bla ma'i 'khor te rdo rje slob dpon dang de'i 'khor la sangs rgyas dang mtshungs par lta bar byed pa dang / de bzhin du rgyal ba'i chos sde snod gsum shes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i lam la shin tu dang zhing dang pa de ni man ngag gi snod du rung ba yin te de la drin sbyin par bya ba kho na'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: Similarly, he is a vessel for the oral instructions, since he views the guru and his retinue with devotion, as if they were the Buddha, and likewise the knower of the three scriptural collections of the Victor's dharma, and he is very pure and clear about the path taught by the Bhagavat.

original: da ni autpala lta bu'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: da ni autpala lta bu'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Now, the characteristics of the lotus-like one.

original: rgyud ni shin tu mang po thos shing lung la mkhas gyur kyang //
analyzed: rgyud ni shin tu mang po thos shing lung la mkhas gyur kyang //
translated: Even though he has heard many tantras and is learned in the scriptures,

original: bla ma'i zhal sngar bsnyen bkur dman zhing man ngag ma thob pa //
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal sngar bsnyen bkur dman zhing man ngag ma thob pa //
translated: he has not served the guru's face and has not received the oral instructions.

original: de ni bdag la'ang phan par byed par mi nus bstan bcos grags //
analyzed: de ni bdag la'ang phan par byed par mi nus bstan bcos grags //
translated: He is not able to benefit himself, and his treatise is merely a cause of weariness.

original: de yi bstan bcos skyo ba'i rgyu tsam 'ba' zhig gyur pa yin //
analyzed: de yi bstan bcos skyo ba'i rgyu tsam 'ba' zhig gyur pa yin //
translated: He is not able to benefit himself, and his treatise is merely a cause of weariness.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: dang po mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa thos pas theg pa chen po mdo sde'i lung rnams la mkhas shing byang ba dang / de nas bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi rim pas rgyud mang po la thos pa byas par gyur kyang 'on kyang man ngag dang ldan pa'i bla ma'i zhal snga nas la bsnyen bkur te bskur sti dman zhing mi phyed pa de'i phyir man ngag ma thos shing
analyzed: dang po mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa thos pas theg pa chen po mdo sde'i lung rnams la mkhas shing byang ba dang / de nas bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi rim pas rgyud mang po la thos pa byas par gyur kyang 'on kyang man ngag dang ldan pa'i bla ma'i zhal snga nas la bsnyen bkur te bskur sti dman zhing mi phyed pa de'i phyir man ngag ma thos shing
translated: First, through listening to the sutras, the Vinaya, and the Abhidharma, he becomes learned and skilled in the scriptures of the Mahayana sutras. Then, through the stages of tantras such as the Kriya Tantra, he studies many tantras. However, because he does not serve and respect a guru who possesses the oral instructions, he does not receive the oral instructions.

original: yang dag pa'i man ngag mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni bstan bcos 'ba' zhig gis grags pas na bstan bcos grags pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i man ngag mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni bstan bcos 'ba' zhig gis grags pas na bstan bcos grags pa'o //
translated: Since he does not know the correct oral instructions, he is merely known through his treatises, so he is one who is known through treatises.

original: des ni bdag la phan pa byed @112a * //🔽pa'am mi nus te /
analyzed: des ni bdag la phan pa byed @112a * //🔽pa'am mi nus te /
translated: He is not able to benefit himself,🔽and his treatise is merely a cause of weariness.

original: man ngag gi nor gyis phongs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: man ngag gi nor gyis phongs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nus pa ma yin no //
translated: because he is destitute of the wealth of the oral instructions.

original: de'i bstan bcos mang du thos pa de ni skyo ba'i rgyu tsam 'ba' zhig ste sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa yin te nyin re zhing gzhan dang lhan cig rtsod pa byed pa dang / bsgom pa'i ro shin tu zhi ba'ang ma rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bstan bcos mang du thos pa de ni skyo ba'i rgyu tsam 'ba' zhig ste sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa yin te nyin re zhing gzhan dang lhan cig rtsod pa byed pa dang / bsgom pa'i ro shin tu zhi ba'ang ma rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: His great learning in the treatises is merely a cause of weariness, a cause of suffering, because he is constantly engaged in debate with others and because he has not attained the taste of meditation.

original: de bas na de yang rim pa'i man ngag gi snod du rung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de yang rim pa'i man ngag gi snod du rung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is not a suitable vessel for the oral instructions of the stages.🔽Now, the person who is like a white lotus is as follows:

original: da ni padma dkar po lta bu'i gang zag ni de nas skal ldan gyur cing de nyid man ngag thob gyur kyang /
analyzed: da ni padma dkar po lta bu'i gang zag ni de nas skal ldan gyur cing de nyid man ngag thob gyur kyang /
translated: He who is fortunate, who has obtained the oral instructions,

original: gang zhig blo gros blun zhing don rnams sdud par mi nus pa //
analyzed: gang zhig blo gros blun zhing don rnams sdud par mi nus pa //
translated: but whose intellect is dull and who is unable to summarize the topics,

original: gzhan la phan par byed pa'i blo ldan bstan la rab 'jug cing //
analyzed: gzhan la phan par byed pa'i blo ldan bstan la rab 'jug cing //
translated: he who is intelligent and engaged in the teaching in order to benefit others,

original: tshig gi yon tan dman pa de yang brnyas par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: tshig gi yon tan dman pa de yang brnyas par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: but whose verbal qualities are inferior, is also despised.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus he speaks.🔽A disciple who is fortunate, because he is endowed with the accumulation of merit,

original: slob ma gang zhig bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skal pa dang ldan par gyur pas ye shes kyi tshogs ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi sngon du 'gro ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slob ma gang zhig bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skal pa dang ldan par gyur pas ye shes kyi tshogs ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi sngon du 'gro ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: even though he has obtained the instruction in the accumulation of wisdom, which is preceded by the accumulation of merit,

original: ye shes kyi tshogs kyi man ngag thob par gyur pa yin du zin kyang 'on kyang de la bdag nyid kyi nyes pa 'ga' zhig yod de /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs kyi man ngag thob par gyur pa yin du zin kyang 'on kyang de la bdag nyid kyi nyes pa 'ga' zhig yod de /
translated: nevertheless, he has some fault of his own.

original: 'di ltar skye bas thob pa'i shes rab dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir blo gros blun pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar skye bas thob pa'i shes rab dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir blo gros blun pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because he is devoid of the wisdom obtained through birth, he is foolish.

original: de'i phyir shes rab med pas gang cung zad cig thob pa de'i don ni rig pa bzhi'i rim gyis sdud par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab med pas gang cung zad cig thob pa de'i don ni rig pa bzhi'i rim gyis sdud par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, because of his lack of wisdom, he is unable to grasp the meaning of whatever he has obtained by the process of the four knowledges.

original: mi nus su zad mod ce na /
analyzed: mi nus su zad mod ce na /
translated: If he is unable to do so,

original: gal te de la gzhan la phan par bya ba'i blo 'byung ba de'i tshe chos bstan pa la rab tu 'jug cing brtson par gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de la gzhan la phan par bya ba'i blo 'byung ba de'i tshe chos bstan pa la rab tu 'jug cing brtson par gyur te /
translated: then when the thought of benefiting others arises in him, at that time he engages in and strives for the teaching of the Dharma.

original: de'i tshe phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe nye bar dgod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / drang ba dang nges pa'i don la sogs pa'i bye brag 'byed pa mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i tshig gi yon tan dman pa nyid yin pa'i phyir brnyas shing bzhad gad du 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe nye bar dgod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / drang ba dang nges pa'i don la sogs pa'i bye brag 'byed pa mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i tshig gi yon tan dman pa nyid yin pa'i phyir brnyas shing bzhad gad du 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, the characteristics of setting forth the position, reason, and example, and the distinctions of interpretable and definitive meaning, etc., are the faults of the words of the characteristics, and so one is despised and ridiculed.

original: des ni gzhan gyi don dang rang gi don yang bya bar mi nus te yang dag pa'i gdams ngag mi shes pa'i phyir la mi shes pa ni shes rab med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni gzhan gyi don dang rang gi don yang bya bar mi nus te yang dag pa'i gdams ngag mi shes pa'i phyir la mi shes pa ni shes rab med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, one is unable to perform the benefit of others and one's own benefit, because one does not know the right instruction, and because the ignorant are devoid of wisdom.

original: de ni skye ba gzhan du de kho na nyid shes par 'gyur pa 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: de ni skye ba gzhan du de kho na nyid shes par 'gyur pa 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: One will only know reality in another life,

original: sngon gyi dad pa dang rtog pas 'dus byas pa sa bon yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi dad pa dang rtog pas 'dus byas pa sa bon yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: because the seed exists, conditioned by former faith and thought.

original: da ni thams cad las mchog tu gyur @112b pa rin po che lta bu'i gang zag ni /
analyzed: da ni thams cad las mchog tu gyur @112b pa rin po che lta bu'i gang zag ni /
translated: Now, the person who is like a jewel, who is the best of all,

original: rgyud mangs thos shing shes ldan drug gis tshig don shes pa dang // dran dang blo gros 'dzin nus yid gzhungs brtson pa phun sum ldan //
analyzed: rgyud mangs thos shing shes ldan drug gis tshig don shes pa dang // dran dang blo gros 'dzin nus yid gzhungs brtson pa phun sum ldan //
translated: are able to retain memory, intelligence, and understanding, and are diligent and perfect,

original: bla ma'i zhal snga nas la mchod pas de nyid man ngag thob //
