analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi rang bzhin gyis lha'i skur rang dbang can de grub pa'i rgyu ni 'od gsal ba kho na nyid yin te gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cause of the establishment of the independent, mentally created deity body is clear light alone, and not anything else.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i sku yang stong pa nyid du mthong ba las 'byung ba kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i sku yang stong pa nyid du mthong ba las 'byung ba kho na ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t the body of the yoga of the creation stage also arisen from seeing emptiness?

original: de'i phyir mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na mtshungs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na mtshungs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the consequence is the same.

original: de ni stong pa nyid tsam yin gyi 'od gsal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid tsam yin gyi 'od gsal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not the same, because that is mere emptiness, not clear light.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni sngags kyi brtan par bya ba yin pa de ltar na de ni gsal ba ma yin te gzhan du na sngags brjod pa la 'brel pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni sngags kyi brtan par bya ba yin pa de ltar na de ni gsal ba ma yin te gzhan du na sngags brjod pa la 'brel pa ci zhig yod /
translated: Thus, it is a mantra repetition, and so it is not clear light, otherwise, what connection is there with the recitation of the mantra?

original: 'dir ni sngags la sogs pa dgos pa med do //
analyzed: 'dir ni sngags la sogs pa dgos pa med do //
translated: Here, mantra repetition and so on are not necessary.

original: thams cad stong pa 'od gsal ba ni rgyu'i dngos por blang par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad stong pa 'od gsal ba ni rgyu'i dngos por blang par bya'o //
translated: Everything is empty, clear light, which is to be accepted as the causal entity.

original: de'i phyir 'od gsal ba'i rgyu las yid kyi rang bzhin gyis lha'i sku rang dbang can 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni spas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'od gsal ba'i rgyu las yid kyi rang bzhin gyis lha'i sku rang dbang can 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni spas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the mental body of the deity, which is independent, arises from the cause of clear light. This is the extensive explanation.

original: 'od gsal ba ni gcig @118b nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni gcig @118b nyid yin te /
translated: Clear light is one.

original: rang dbang can dang rang dbang can ma yin pas byas pa'i tha dad pa yod na 'o na ni de kho na nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nyes pa de bsal ba'i phyir /🔽sems gang gis ni byis pa rnams /
analyzed: rang dbang can dang rang dbang can ma yin pas byas pa'i tha dad pa yod na 'o na ni de kho na nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nyes pa de bsal ba'i phyir / sems gang gis ni byis pa rnams /
translated: In order to dispel that fault, he says:🔽By whatever mind

original: 'khor bar 'ching bar 'gyur ba yi //
analyzed: 'khor bar 'ching bar 'gyur ba yi //
translated: the childish are bound in cyclic existence,

original: sems de nyid kyis rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: sems de nyid kyis rnal 'byor pa //
translated: by that very mind the yogi

original: bde gshegs gnas su 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bde gshegs gnas su 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: goes to the state of the Sugata.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te las dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyis nyams par byas pa'i gang gis byis pa rnams 'khor bar 'ching bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te las dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyis nyams par byas pa'i gang gis byis pa rnams 'khor bar 'ching bar 'gyur te /
translated: By whatever mind, defiled by the latent tendencies of karma and afflictions, the childish are bound in cyclic existence,

original: bcings pa'i sems de nyid kyis rang bzhin dang snang ba'i dbye ba yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas rnal 'byor pa rnams bde gshegs sangs rgyas rnams kyi gnas de'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcings pa'i sems de nyid kyis rang bzhin dang snang ba'i dbye ba yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas rnal 'byor pa rnams bde gshegs sangs rgyas rnams kyi gnas de'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: by that very mind of bondage, through thorough knowledge of the distinctions of nature and appearance, the yogis attain the state of the Sugata, the state of the Buddha.

original: de'i phyir 'od gsal ba gcig kho na yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'od gsal ba gcig kho na yin la /
translated: Therefore, there is only one clear light.

original: bcings pa dang thar pa dag ni de yongs su ma shes pas byas pa yin te /
analyzed: bcings pa dang thar pa dag ni de yongs su ma shes pas byas pa yin te /
translated: Bondage and liberation are due to not fully understanding that.

original: de kho na rang dbang can dang rang dbang can ma yin pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyis khyab par byed pa nyid ni nyams par byed pa med do //
analyzed: de kho na rang dbang can dang rang dbang can ma yin pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyis khyab par byed pa nyid ni nyams par byed pa med do //
translated: Since reality is independent and not independent, it is not the case that reality, which pervades everything, is destroyed.

original: don dam par bcing ba dang thar ba dag pa dang skye ba dang 'jig pa med do zhes thugs la bdog nas /
analyzed: don dam par bcing ba dang thar ba dag pa dang skye ba dang 'jig pa med do zhes thugs la bdog nas /
translated: Thinking that ultimately there is no bondage or liberation, no arising or destruction,

original: 'dir ni 'ga' yang skye ba med //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'ga' yang skye ba med //
translated: Here, no one is born,

original: 'ga' yang 'chi ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'ga' yang 'chi ba yod ma yin //
translated: And no one dies.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin rnam gnas pa //🔽'khor ba nyid de shes par bya //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin rnam gnas pa // 'khor ba nyid de shes par bya //
translated: The nature of mind is to abide

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In cyclic existence, which should be understood.

original: don dam par dpyad na 'gro ba la skye ba'am 'chi cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te khams gsum pa ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par dpyad na 'gro ba la skye ba'am 'chi cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te khams gsum pa ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When analyzed in terms of ultimate reality, there is not the slightest birth or death in the world, because the three realms are essentially primordially unborn.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa 'di dag ni btags pa yin gyis yangs su grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa 'di dag ni btags pa yin gyis yangs su grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Arising and destruction are imputed, not established.

original: de'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir 'khrul par ni yod de de skad du yang /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir 'khrul par ni yod de de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: ma rig rkyen las byung ba la //
analyzed: ma rig rkyen las byung ba la //
translated: From the condition of ignorance

original: yang dag ye shes kyis bltas na //
analyzed: yang dag ye shes kyis bltas na //
translated: When it is seen by correct pristine wisdom,🔽Neither arising nor ceasing

original: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dag /'ga' yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dag /'ga' yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Is perceived in any way.

original: gal te ltar yin na ce ltar 'khor ba yod par 'gyur zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te ltar yin na ce ltar 'khor ba yod par 'gyur zhes zer na /
translated: If that is so, how can there be cyclic existence?

original: sems dag gi rang bzhin ni sems kyi rang bzhin te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba de'i rnam pa kho na 'khor ba yin te /
analyzed: sems dag gi rang bzhin ni sems kyi rang bzhin te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba de'i rnam pa kho na 'khor ba yin te /
translated: The nature of mind is the nature of mind, appearing in the aspect of subject and object. That aspect itself is cyclic existence.

original: 'dir don dam par ni 'khor ba zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir don dam par ni 'khor ba zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Here, ultimately, there is no such thing as cyclic existence. This is not the intended meaning.

original: da ni las kyi lus skye ba /
analyzed: da ni las kyi lus skye ba /
translated: Now, the arising of the body of karma

original: rlung gi sbyor ba med par ni //
analyzed: rlung gi sbyor ba med par ni //
translated: Without the yoga of the wind

original: sems kyi rang bzhin gzung du med//
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin gzung du med//
translated: The nature of mind is not apprehended.

original: @119a * // rang bzhin rgyur gyur sems las ni //
analyzed: @119a * // rang bzhin rgyur gyur sems las ni //
translated: From the mind, which is the nature of the cause,

original: las dang skye ba kun du 'byung //
analyzed: las dang skye ba kun du 'byung //
translated: Karma and birth arise.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: re zhig dang por khu ba dang khrag 'dres pa'i nang du dri za'i sems zhugs pa na de'i nang du srog ces bya ba'i rlung dang 'dres pas sems kyi rang bzhin gyi rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi ngo bor gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig dang por khu ba dang khrag 'dres pa'i nang du dri za'i sems zhugs pa na de'i nang du srog ces bya ba'i rlung dang 'dres pas sems kyi rang bzhin gyi rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi ngo bor gyur te /
translated: First, when the mind of the gandharva enters the mixture of semen and blood, the consciousness that is the nature of mind becomes the nature of the eight consciousnesses through mixing with the wind called life.

original: de'i rjes la mngal nas byung nas sems kyi rang bzhin sems las rang 'byung ba rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la mngal nas byung nas sems kyi rang bzhin sems las rang 'byung ba rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, when it emerges from the womb, the naturally arisen mind that is the nature of mind arises.

original: de'i 'og tu yul 'dra ba bzung nas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yul 'dra ba bzung nas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las bya ste /
translated: After that, having grasped objects that are similar, one performs virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: de'i rjes la shi 'phos nas skye ba gzhan du nying mtshams sbyor ba 'brel bar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la shi 'phos nas skye ba gzhan du nying mtshams sbyor ba 'brel bar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: After that, having died and transmigrated, one is connected to another birth.

original: de lta bu'i 'khor ba ba'i las kyi lus kun du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'khor ba ba'i las kyi lus kun du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: Thus, the body of karmic existence arises.

original: ye shes kyi lus ni /
analyzed: ye shes kyi lus ni /
translated: The body of pristine consciousness is as follows:

original: rlung dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes //
analyzed: rlung dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes //
translated: Consciousness endowed with wind

original: gsum po de nyid slar yang ni //
analyzed: gsum po de nyid slar yang ni //
translated: Again, those three

original: rnal 'byor pa yi lus su 'gyur //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yi lus su 'gyur //
translated: becomes the body of the yogi.

original: sgyu ma'i lus zhes de la bya //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i lus zhes de la bya //
translated: That is called the illusory body.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te rlung dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum pa de nyid 'od gsal bar zhugs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te rlung dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum pa de nyid 'od gsal bar zhugs te /
translated: That very third consciousness endowed with wind enters into clear light,

original: slar yang snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas yid kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo lha'i skur gyur nas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi lus te ye shes kyi lus su 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar yang snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas yid kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo lha'i skur gyur nas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi lus te ye shes kyi lus su 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and again, by the process of attaining light, etc., becomes the body of the deity, the nature of mind, and arises as the body of the yogis, the body of pristine awareness.🔽That very thing is the illusory body, and the aggregates of illusory nature, and is also another enumeration, the body of pristine awareness, the nature of mind.

original: de nyid kho na sgyu ma'i lus dang sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi phung po dang rnam grangs gzhan yang yid kyi rang bzhin gyi ye shes kyi sku yin no zhes bya ba'i don te sbas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kho na sgyu ma'i lus dang sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi phung po dang rnam grangs gzhan yang yid kyi rang bzhin gyi ye shes kyi sku yin no zhes bya ba'i don te sbas pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the hidden.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'dis thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ba kho nar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'dis thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ba kho nar blta bar bya ste /
translated: All of this should be seen as just like that,🔽and so it is said:

original: de'i phyir / sgyu ma lta bu'i ting 'dzin gnas //🔽thams cad de dang 'dra bar blta //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sgyu ma lta bu'i ting 'dzin gnas // thams cad de dang 'dra bar blta //
translated: Abiding in the illusory-like meditative stabilization,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: all should be seen as just like that.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor bas phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa thams cad de dang 'dra bar sgyu ma'i rang bzhin kho nar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor bas phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa thams cad de dang 'dra bar sgyu ma'i rang bzhin kho nar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The yogi who abides in the illusion-like meditative concentration should view all the aggregates, sense-fields, etc. in the same way, as only having the nature of illusion.🔽That is stated:

original: de nyid / gzugs dang tshor ba nyid dang ni //
analyzed: de nyid / gzugs dang tshor ba nyid dang ni //
translated: Form, feeling,

original: 'du shes dang ni 'du byed nyid //
analyzed: 'du shes dang ni 'du byed nyid //
translated: perception, mental formations,🔽and the fifth, consciousness,🔽and likewise the four elements,🔽the faculties and the objects,

original: lnga pa rnam par shes pa dang // de bzhin khams ni bzhi po dang // dbang po rnams dang yul rnams dang // ye shes lnga po nyid dang ni //
analyzed: lnga pa rnam par shes pa dang // de bzhin khams ni bzhi po dang // dbang po rnams dang yul rnams dang // ye shes lnga po nyid dang ni //
translated: and the five kinds of pristine awareness,

original: phyi dang nang gi bye brag ste //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi bye brag ste //
translated: the distinctions of outer and inner,

original: thams cad sgyu ma gzhan du min //
analyzed: thams cad sgyu ma gzhan du min //
translated: all are illusion, nothing else.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / de bzhin du @119b khams bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo bzhi dang yul dang dbang po'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / de bzhin du @119b khams bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo bzhi dang yul dang dbang po'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: Thus, the five aggregates of form and so forth are the Tathagatas Vairochana and so forth, and likewise the four goddesses who are the nature of the four constituents, and the form vajra and so forth who are the nature of the objects and faculties, and the bodhisattvas.🔽All of them, and likewise all that is internal and external, such as blood and semen, and the elements such as earth, are the nature of Vajradhara and so forth.

original: de dag thams cad dang de bzhin du phyi nang gi bye brag khrag dang khu ba la sogs pa dang chos la sogs pa'i khams rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag thams cad sgyu ma ste snang tsam gyi rang bzhin gang yin
analyzed: de dag thams cad dang de bzhin du phyi nang gi bye brag khrag dang khu ba la sogs pa dang chos la sogs pa'i khams rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag thams cad sgyu ma ste snang tsam gyi rang bzhin gang yin
translated: All of them are illusion, that is, they are merely apparent, and one should meditate on them as such.

original: pa kho na'o zhes bsgom par bya ste sbas pa'o //
analyzed: pa kho na'o zhes bsgom par bya ste sbas pa'o //
translated: This is the hidden meaning.

original: de bzhin du tha mal ba'i phung po lnga rnam par dag par gnas pa ye shes lnga po de yang sgyu ma lta bur shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni drang pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du tha mal ba'i phung po lnga rnam par dag par gnas pa ye shes lnga po de yang sgyu ma lta bur shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni drang pa'i don to //
translated: Likewise, the five pristine awarenesses that abide as the purification of the five ordinary aggregates should be understood to be like an illusion. This is the interpretable meaning.

original: ye shes lnga po zhes bya ba ye shes lnga rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku yang de kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes lnga po zhes bya ba ye shes lnga rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku yang de kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: The five pristine awarenesses, the body of Great Vajradhara, the nature of the five pristine awarenesses, should be seen in just that way. This is the definitive meaning.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i lus sgyu ma'i dpe rnams dang mtshungs par shes par bya ba nyid /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i lus sgyu ma'i dpe rnams dang mtshungs par shes par bya ba nyid /
translated: The illusory body is to be understood as being similar to the examples of illusion.

original: me long gi ni gzugs brnyan bzhin //
analyzed: me long gi ni gzugs brnyan bzhin //
translated: Like a reflection in a mirror,

original: sgyu ma'i lus ni shes par bya //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i lus ni shes par bya //
translated: the illusory body is to be understood.

original: kha dog rnams ni 'ja' lta bu //
analyzed: kha dog rnams ni 'ja' lta bu //
translated: Colors are like a rainbow,

original: khyab nyid chu yi zla ba bzhin /🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: khyab nyid chu yi zla ba bzhin / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: pervasiveness is like the moon in water.

original: rnal 'byor pa sgyu ma'i lus gang yin pa de'i kha dog ni 'ja' lta bu ste sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa sgyu ma'i lus gang yin pa de'i kha dog ni 'ja' lta bu ste sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The colors of the illusory body of the yogi are like a rainbow, to be understood as having the nature of an illusion.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni me long gi gzugs brnyan bzhin du yod pa dang med pa spangs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni me long gi gzugs brnyan bzhin du yod pa dang med pa spangs par shes par bya'o //
translated: Its own nature should be understood as existing like a reflection in a mirror, free from existence and nonexistence.

original: khyab pa nyid ni chu'i zla ba ste de yang chu'i bum pa gcig tu mthong ba de bzhin du chu'i bum pa stong du yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyab pa nyid ni chu'i zla ba ste de yang chu'i bum pa gcig tu mthong ba de bzhin du chu'i bum pa stong du yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The pervasion is like the moon in water. Just as it is seen in one water pot, it is also seen in a thousand water pots.

original: de bzhin du ji ltar bdag nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam par mthong ba ltar khams gsum pa thams cad kyang de kho na bzhin du sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du gcig par blta bar bya ste sbas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar bdag nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam par mthong ba ltar khams gsum pa thams cad kyang de kho na bzhin du sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du gcig par blta bar bya ste sbas pa'o //
translated: Likewise, just as one sees one's own illusory form, one should also view the entire three realms in the same way, as having the nature of illusion. This is the hidden meaning.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i lus kyi mjug bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i lus kyi mjug bsdu ba ni /
translated: The summary of the illusory body is:

original: mod dri ma med pa la //
analyzed: mod dri ma med pa la //
translated: In the stainless,

original: dngos dang dngos med spang pa yi //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med spang pa yi //
translated: free from entity and non-entity,

original: gzugs brnyan gsal par snang ba bzhin /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gsal par snang ba bzhin /
translated: like a clear reflection appears.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' rab spros pa //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' rab spros pa //
translated: Having fully emanated Vajrasattva,

original: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan zhing //
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan zhing //
translated: endowed with the supreme of all aspects,

original: sku ni lta bas mi ngoms pa //
analyzed: sku ni lta bas mi ngoms pa //
translated: the form that is never satisfied by gazing,

original: slob ma bzang la de bstan pa //
analyzed: slob ma bzang la de bstan pa //
translated: that should be shown to the good disciple.

original: de ni bdag byin brlab ces bya //
analyzed: de ni bdag byin brlab ces bya //
translated: That is called the self-consecration.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ji ltar me long dri ma med par 'byung ba'i dngos dang dngos med de yod pa dang med pa rnam par spangs pa'i gzugs brnyan snang ba de bzhin du /🔽rdo rje sems dpa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyis rab tu spras pa ste de bzhin du stobs bcu dang mi @120a * //
analyzed: ji ltar me long dri ma med par 'byung ba'i dngos dang dngos med de yod pa dang med pa rnam par spangs pa'i gzugs brnyan snang ba de bzhin du / rdo rje sems dpa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyis rab tu spras pa ste de bzhin du stobs bcu dang mi @120a * //
translated: Just as in a stainless mirror, the reflection of an entity or non-entity, that is, the abandonment of existence and non-existence, appears,

original: 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog rnams dang ldan zhing sku lta bas mi ngoms pa ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog rnams dang ldan zhing sku lta bas mi ngoms pa ste /
translated: in the same way, the body of Vajrasattva, adorned with the major and minor marks, and likewise endowed with all the supreme aspects, such as the ten powers and the four forms of fearlessness, is a body that is never satisfied by looking at it,🔽that is, it is such that one never becomes satisfied by looking at it.🔽That which is shown to the disciple by the vajra master, that is, the knowledge being, is called the self-consecration.

original: gang zhig mthong nas chog shes par mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ye shes kyi ku ste rdo rje slob dpon gyis slob ma la bstan pa gang yin pa de ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'o zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig mthong nas chog shes par mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ye shes kyi ku ste rdo rje slob dpon gyis slob ma la bstan pa gang yin pa de ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'o zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
translated: This is the hidden meaning.

original: sku thob pa las sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sku thob pa las sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the illusory meditative stabilization is not different from the attainment of the body,

original: bstan pa'i mtshan ldan sgyu ma ni //
analyzed: bstan pa'i mtshan ldan sgyu ma ni //
translated: the illusory nature of the teaching

original: 'di nyid yin par shes bya ste //
analyzed: 'di nyid yin par shes bya ste //
translated: should be known as this.

original: kun rdzob bden pa sgyu ma nyid //
analyzed: kun rdzob bden pa sgyu ma nyid //
translated: The illusory truth of the superficial

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yang de //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yang de // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is also the body of complete enjoyment.

original: sgyu ma snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis spros pa'i ye shes kyi sku zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di nyid yin gyi sgyu ma zhes bya ba de las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis spros pa'i ye shes kyi sku zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di nyid yin gyi sgyu ma zhes bya ba de las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: This is the illusory body of the exalted wisdom of elaboration, which is attained through the stages of the near attainment of the appearance of the illusion and so forth. It is not different from the so-called illusion.

original: shing nyid dang shing sha pa bzhin du ye shes kyi sku dang sgyu ma dag la tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: shing nyid dang shing sha pa bzhin du ye shes kyi sku dang sgyu ma dag la tha dad pa med do //
translated: Just as a tree is not different from a śiṃśapā tree, the body of exalted wisdom and the illusion are not different.

original: gzhan du na sku dang sgyu ma dag tha dad pa yin na sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ma yin par 'gyur te tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na sku dang sgyu ma dag tha dad pa yin na sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ma yin par 'gyur te tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the body and the illusion were different, it would not be the illusory meditative stabilization, because it would have a different conceptualization.

original: sgyu ma ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sgyu ma ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the illusion like?

original: bstan pa'i mtshan nyid de bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i mtshan nyid de bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It has the characteristics that have been explained, and is endowed with those characteristics.

original: kun rdzob ste phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi bdag nyid dam lha'i sku'i bden pa ste don dam pa ni sgyu ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob ste phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi bdag nyid dam lha'i sku'i bden pa ste don dam pa ni sgyu ma nyid yin no //
translated: The conventional truth, which is the nature of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, or the truth of the deity's body, is the illusion itself.

original: de kho na bcom ldan 'das kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin par shes par bya zhing yang zhes bya ba'i sgras sprul pa'i sku yang sgyu ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na bcom ldan 'das kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin par shes par bya zhing yang zhes bya ba'i sgras sprul pa'i sku yang sgyu ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
translated: That very reality should be known as the Bhagavān's enjoyment body, and the word also implies that the emanation body is also the illusion itself, which is hidden.

original: da ni sgyu ma'i lus rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir mchod par bya ba nyid yin par /
analyzed: da ni sgyu ma'i lus rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir mchod par bya ba nyid yin par /
translated: Now, in order to show that the illusory body is to be worshipped because it is the nature of Vajradhara,🔽it is said:

original: de nyid dri za'i sems can yin //🔽rdo rje sku yang de nyid de //
analyzed: de nyid dri za'i sems can yin // rdo rje sku yang de nyid de //
translated: That very one is the gandharva being,🔽the vajra body is that very one,

original: bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa' yin //
analyzed: bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa' yin //
translated: I am the very one, Vajrasattva.

original: de bas bdag nyid mchod la 'jug / ces bya gsungs te dri za'i sems can zhes bya ba ni lus kyi za ma tog por te dbang po kun dang ldan pas lus gzhan len par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas bdag nyid mchod la 'jug / ces bya gsungs te dri za'i sems can zhes bya ba ni lus kyi za ma tog por te dbang po kun dang ldan pas lus gzhan len par byed pa'o //
translated: The gandharva being is the body-box, since it is the container of the body, and it takes up another body, since it is endowed with all the sense-faculties.

original: 'dir ni sgyu ma lta bu'i lus la phung po'i rnam par rtog pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir dri za'i sems can kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni sgyu ma lta bu'i lus la phung po'i rnam par rtog pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir dri za'i sems can kho na yin te /
translated: Here, the gandharva being is only the illusory body, because the conceptualization of the aggregates is not perceived in the illusory body.

original: dri za'i sems can dang sgyu ma'i lus la khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: dri za'i sems can dang sgyu ma'i lus la khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest difference between the gandharva being and the illusory body.

original: rdo rje'i sku ste mi phyed pa'i sku de nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos kyi sku nyid du bstan pa yin te ji skad du //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sku ste mi phyed pa'i sku de nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos kyi sku nyid du bstan pa yin te ji skad du //
translated: This is the vajra body, the indivisible body. This shows that it is the Dharma Body. As is said:

original: sra zhing brtan @120b la khong stong med //🔽gcad cing gzhig par mi nus te //
analyzed: sra zhing brtan @120b la khong stong med // gcad cing gzhig par mi nus te //
translated: Hard, firm, and without hollowness,🔽it cannot be cut or destroyed,

original: sreg cing gzhom par mi nus pa'i //🔽stong nyid rdo rje zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sreg cing gzhom par mi nus pa'i // stong nyid rdo rje zhes bshad do //
translated: it cannot be burned or overcome.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is explained as the vajra of emptiness.

original: rdo rje'i rang bzhin sku ni rdo rje zhes bya ste chos kyi sku yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rang bzhin sku ni rdo rje zhes bya ste chos kyi sku yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The body that has the nature of a vajra is called a vajra, which means the dharmakāya.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i bdag nyid ting nge 'dzin 'di yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i bdag nyid ting nge 'dzin 'di yin te /
translated: This is the nature of the samādhi of Vajrasattva.

original: ye shes kyi sku de ni thams cad stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid las byung ba yin no //🔽'dir yan lag gi don ni 'di yin te rdo rje ni stong pa nyid yin zhing sems dpa' ni snying rje yin la de'i bdag nyid ni rdo rje sems dpa' nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don ni de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de lta bus gang cung zad
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku de ni thams cad stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid las byung ba yin no // 'dir yan lag gi don ni 'di yin te rdo rje ni stong pa nyid yin zhing sems dpa' ni snying rje yin la de'i bdag nyid ni rdo rje sems dpa' nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don ni de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de lta bus gang cung zad
translated: That gnosis body arises from the reality of the emptiness of everything.

original: za ba'am / reg pa'am gzhan rnams la mchod pa byed pa de thams cad rang bdag nyid la mchod par bya ste ting nge 'dzin 'dis rang dang gzhan la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir gzhan la mchod pa gang yin pa de kho na bdag la mchod pa'am /
analyzed: za ba'am / reg pa'am gzhan rnams la mchod pa byed pa de thams cad rang bdag nyid la mchod par bya ste ting nge 'dzin 'dis rang dang gzhan la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir gzhan la mchod pa gang yin pa de kho na bdag la mchod pa'am /
translated: Here is the meaning of the branches: Vajra is emptiness, and sattva is compassion. The nature of that is Vajrasattva. The meaning is that for that reason, whatever one eats, touches, or offers to others with such a samādhi, all of that is an offering to oneself. Because there is no difference between oneself and others in this samādhi, whatever is an offering to others is an offering to oneself.

original: bdag la mchod pa gang yin pa de gzhan la mchod pa byas pa yin no snyam du dgongs te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la mchod pa gang yin pa de gzhan la mchod pa byas pa yin no snyam du dgongs te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The thought is that whatever worship is of me is worship of the other, and this is the indirect sense.

original: da ni lung gi tshad mas bdag nyid sangs rgyas yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni lung gi tshad mas bdag nyid sangs rgyas yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that by the authority of scripture one is a Buddha,🔽he says:🔽One is all the Buddhas,

original: bdag nyid sangs rgyas thams cad dang // byang chub sems dpa' thams cad nyid //
analyzed: bdag nyid sangs rgyas thams cad dang // byang chub sems dpa' thams cad nyid //
translated: and all the Bodhisattvas.

original: de bas 'bad pa thams cad kyis //
analyzed: de bas 'bad pa thams cad kyis //
translated: Therefore, with all one's effort,

original: bdag nyid rtag tu mchod par bya //
analyzed: bdag nyid rtag tu mchod par bya //
translated: one should always worship oneself.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te sangs rgyas thams cad ni phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te sangs rgyas thams cad ni phung po lnga'o //
translated: All the Buddhas are the five aggregates.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ni dbang po'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ni dbang po'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: All the Bodhisattvas are the Bodhisattvas who are of the nature of the faculties.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid kho na la 'bad pa thams cad kyis mchod par bya ste drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid kho na la 'bad pa thams cad kyis mchod par bya ste drang ba'i don to //
translated: Since one is of their very nature, one should worship oneself with all one's effort. This is the interpretable meaning.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba las byung ba yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid la mchod par bya ba ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba las byung ba yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid la mchod par bya ba ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: Since all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas arise from the natural luminosity, it is the definitive meaning to worship oneself.

original: de ni rang gi don to //
analyzed: de ni rang gi don to //
translated: That is one's own aim.🔽In order to teach that all the activities that exist for the sake of others should be done just as they are,

original: gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir bya ba ji snyed yod pa de dag de kho na bzhin du bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir bya ba ji snyed yod pa de dag de kho na bzhin du bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said:🔽The application of mantra and seal,🔽the imagination of the maṇḍala, and so forth,

original: sngags dang phyag rgya'i sbyor ba dang // dkyil 'khor la sogs rnam rtog dang // sbyin sreg gtor ma'i bya ba kun //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya'i sbyor ba dang // dkyil 'khor la sogs rnam rtog dang // sbyin sreg gtor ma'i bya ba kun //
translated: all the activities of burnt offerings and sacrificial cakes,

original: rtag tu sgyu ma bzhin du bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rtag tu sgyu ma bzhin du bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: should always be done like an illusion.

original: bzlas pa'i dus su snying po dang nye ba'i snying po la sogs pa'i sngags rnams dang bcing ba'i dus su zhi ba dang drag po dang bar ma'i phyag rgya rnams kyi sbyor ba ste las kyis @121a * //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i dus su snying po dang nye ba'i snying po la sogs pa'i sngags rnams dang bcing ba'i dus su zhi ba dang drag po dang bar ma'i phyag rgya rnams kyi sbyor ba ste las kyis @121a * //
translated: At the time of recitation, the application of the mantras such as the essence and close essence mantras, and at the time of binding, the application of the seals such as the peaceful, fierce, and neutral seals,

original: bye brag gis nges par sbyor ba gang yin pa dang de bzhin du dkyil 'khor te sku la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / sogs pa'i sgras dbang bskur ba dang / slob ma lhag par gnas pa dang / sa yongs su gzung ba dang / khrus bya ba dang /
analyzed: bye brag gis nges par sbyor ba gang yin pa dang de bzhin du dkyil 'khor te sku la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / sogs pa'i sgras dbang bskur ba dang / slob ma lhag par gnas pa dang / sa yongs su gzung ba dang / khrus bya ba dang /
translated: In particular, the conceptualization of the maṇḍala, that is, the maṇḍala of body, and so on, and the empowerment, the disciples’ preparatory rite, the appropriation of the ground, the bathing,🔽the rite of the preparatory rite, the invocation, the request to remain, the request to depart, and so on, are the conceptualization of the performance of those rites just as they are.

original: lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga dang / spyan drang pa dang bzhugs su gsol ba dang / gshegs su gsol ba la sogs pa de rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa ste ji lta ba bzhin du sgrub pa dang / de bzhin du dam tshig gi me lha'i sgo nas ye shes kyi me lha tshim par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sbyin sreg gi bya ba dang /
analyzed: lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga dang / spyan drang pa dang bzhugs su gsol ba dang / gshegs su gsol ba la sogs pa de rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa ste ji lta ba bzhin du sgrub pa dang / de bzhin du dam tshig gi me lha'i sgo nas ye shes kyi me lha tshim par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sbyin sreg gi bya ba dang /
translated: Similarly, the performance of the rite of fire sacrifice that satisfies the fire of gnosis through the fire of gnosis is the conceptualization of the performance of the rite of fire sacrifice.

original: 'byung po thams cad tshim par byed pa'i gtor ma'i bya ba dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan pa dang sgrub par byed pa'i bya ba gzhan gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad sgyu ma ste bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bzhin du bya zhing bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung po thams cad tshim par byed pa'i gtor ma'i bya ba dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan pa dang sgrub par byed pa'i bya ba gzhan gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad sgyu ma ste bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bzhin du bya zhing bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: All those activities, such as the activity of the sacrificial cake that satisfies all the spirits, and any other activities that benefit oneself and others and are to be accomplished, are to be performed and accomplished in accordance with the stage of self-consecration, like an illusion. This is the literal reading.

original: de dag nyid las kyi bye brag gi sgo nas /
analyzed: de dag nyid las kyi bye brag gi sgo nas /
translated: Those very [activities] are [described] from the perspective of the distinctions of action:🔽Pacification, enrichment, and likewise🔽power, assault,

original: zhib dang ni rgyas pa dang // de bzhin dbang dang mngon spyod dang // dgug sogs gang yin thams cad ni //
analyzed: zhib dang ni rgyas pa dang // de bzhin dbang dang mngon spyod dang // dgug sogs gang yin thams cad ni //
translated: and all that is to be done, such as summoning,

original: dbang po'i gzhu dang mtshungs par bya //
analyzed: dbang po'i gzhu dang mtshungs par bya //
translated: are to be done like the bow of Indra.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te nad pa rnams zhi bar bya ba dang dbul po rnams rgyas par bya ba dang / rgyal po la sogs pa rnams dbang du bya ba dang / dkon mchog gsum la gnod pa byed pa rnams la mngon spyod dang / lha dang lha ma yin gyi bu mo la sogs pa rnams dgug pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te nad pa rnams zhi bar bya ba dang dbul po rnams rgyas par bya ba dang / rgyal po la sogs pa rnams dbang du bya ba dang / dkon mchog gsum la gnod pa byed pa rnams la mngon spyod dang / lha dang lha ma yin gyi bu mo la sogs pa rnams dgug pa dang /
translated: The phrase “and so forth” refers to the following: for the sake of the sick, one should perform pacifying; for the sake of the poor, one should perform enriching; for the sake of kings and so forth, one should perform overpowering; for those who harm the Three Jewels, one should perform wrathful action; for the sake of the daughters of gods and demigods and so forth, one should perform summoning.

original: sogs pa smos pas sman bzang po dang / dngul chu dang bcud kyis len dang / gser 'gyur rtsi dang / dbang du bya ba dang / nam mkha' lding dang / sa gter dang / ro langs dang / ral gri dang / dril bu dang /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas sman bzang po dang / dngul chu dang bcud kyis len dang / gser 'gyur rtsi dang / dbang du bya ba dang / nam mkha' lding dang / sa gter dang / ro langs dang / ral gri dang / dril bu dang /
translated: The phrase “and so forth” refers to the following: excellent medicine, mercury, elixir, the philosopher’s stone, subjugation, garuḍa, earth treasure, zombie, sword, bell,

original: mig sman dang / rkang mgyogs dang / khung gi sgo dbye ba dang / khung du 'jug pa dang / sngags dbab pa dang / 'byung po dbab pa dang / snod du rung ba dbab pa dang / phra brtag pa dang / chu rengs par bya ba dang /
analyzed: mig sman dang / rkang mgyogs dang / khung gi sgo dbye ba dang / khung du 'jug pa dang / sngags dbab pa dang / 'byung po dbab pa dang / snod du rung ba dbab pa dang / phra brtag pa dang / chu rengs par bya ba dang /
translated: eye medicine, fleet foot, opening the door of a treasure, entering a treasure, the descent of mantra, the descent of spirits, the descent of suitability, the examination of a maiden, the freezing of water,

original: dmag rengs par bya ba dang / phra man ma dbang du bya ba dang / mi snang ba la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub dam pa rnam pa tha dad pa la sogs pa gang snyed de rnams dbang po'i gzhu dang mtshungs shing snang tsam gyi sgyu ma'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bya ste drang ba'i don to //🔽de bzhin du @121b dkyil 'khor bzhi'i rim pas 'od zer gyi 'khor lo kha dog dmar po la sogs pa spro ba'i sbyor bas nang gi dus la brten nas gang gi tshe zhi ba la sogs pa rnams byed pa de'i tshe dbang po'i gzhu bzhin du yod pa
analyzed: dmag rengs par bya ba dang / phra man ma dbang du bya ba dang / mi snang ba la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub dam pa rnam pa tha dad pa la sogs pa gang snyed de rnams dbang po'i gzhu dang mtshungs shing snang tsam gyi sgyu ma'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bya ste drang ba'i don to // de bzhin du @121b dkyil 'khor bzhi'i rim pas 'od zer gyi 'khor lo kha dog dmar po la sogs pa spro ba'i sbyor bas nang gi dus la brten nas gang gi tshe zhi ba la sogs pa rnams byed pa de'i tshe dbang po'i gzhu bzhin du yod pa
translated: One should perform the pacification of enemies, the subjugation of the yakṣas and rākṣasas, invisibility, and so on, and the various kinds of mundane and supramundane, highest feats, by means of the illusion-like concentration, which is like the bow of Cupid, and is merely an appearance. This is the interpretable meaning.

original: dang med pa dang bral ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor lo brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don te bya ba gzhan /
analyzed: dang med pa dang bral ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor lo brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don te bya ba gzhan /
translated: Similarly, when one performs pacification and so on in dependence on the internal time by the yoga of radiating the wheel of light rays of red color and so on, in the sequence of the four maṇḍalas, at that time one should imagine the wheel of light rays, which is free from existence and nonexistence, like the bow of Cupid. This is the definitive meaning.

original: sgeg sogs nye bar longs spyod dang // glu dang rol mo sogs brten dang // sgyu rtsal rnams la 'jug pa ni //
analyzed: sgeg sogs nye bar longs spyod dang // glu dang rol mo sogs brten dang // sgyu rtsal rnams la 'jug pa ni //
translated: and engage in the arts,

original: chu yi zla ba bzhin du bya //
analyzed: chu yi zla ba bzhin du bya //
translated: like the moon in water.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te sgeg pa la sogs pa ni gar gyi ro dgu ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te sgeg pa la sogs pa ni gar gyi ro dgu ste /
translated: The charming and so forth are the nine flavors of dance.🔽Charming, heroic, frightening,🔽laughing, wrathful, terrifying,

original: sgeg dang dpa' dang 'jigs rung dang / dgod dang drag po 'jigs byed dang// snying rje ngo mtshar zhi ba ni //🔽gar gyi ro dgu yin par bshad //
analyzed: sgeg dang dpa' dang 'jigs rung dang / dgod dang drag po 'jigs byed dang// snying rje ngo mtshar zhi ba ni // gar gyi ro dgu yin par bshad //
translated: compassionate, amazing, and peaceful

original: ces bstan to //
analyzed: ces bstan to //
translated: are explained as the nine flavors of dance.

original: de la sgeg pa'i ro'i spyod pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya dgu bo rnams dang lhan cig tu dbus kyi gtso bor gyur pas 'khyud pa dang po byed pa dang / 'jib pa dang sen mo 'debs pa dang / so 'debs pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: de la sgeg pa'i ro'i spyod pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya dgu bo rnams dang lhan cig tu dbus kyi gtso bor gyur pas 'khyud pa dang po byed pa dang / 'jib pa dang sen mo 'debs pa dang / so 'debs pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: The practice of the flavor of charm is to embrace the principal figure in the center together with the nine pledge seals, first performing kissing, sucking, and biting with the characteristics of nail and teeth.

original: de rnams dang lhan cig 'dod pa lnga nye bar longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan gyi rim gyis lus dang ngag gi brda bstan pa'i sgo nas bde ba chen po nye bar longs spyod pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams dang lhan cig 'dod pa lnga nye bar longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan gyi rim gyis lus dang ngag gi brda bstan pa'i sgo nas bde ba chen po nye bar longs spyod pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Together with them, the nature of the hero's conduct is the enjoyment of the five sense objects, and the nature of the great hero's conduct is the enjoyment of great bliss by means of the body and speech signs taught by the sequence of the seal and the response to the seal.

original: dpa' bo'i spyod pa ni mtshan mo'i ro langs sgrub pa dang / 'byung po dbang du bya ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i spyod pa ni mtshan mo'i ro langs sgrub pa dang / 'byung po dbang du bya ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The hero's conduct is characterized by the attainment of the zombie at night and the subjugation of the bhutas.

original: 'jigs su rung pa'i spyod pa ni go ku da ha na za ba'i mtshan nyid de btsog pa'i sems dang 'jigs pa skyed pa ni 'jigs su rung ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'jigs su rung pa'i spyod pa ni go ku da ha na za ba'i mtshan nyid de btsog pa'i sems dang 'jigs pa skyed pa ni 'jigs su rung ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The terrifying conduct is characterized by the eating of cow, dog, and pig meat, and the terrifying is said to be the generation of a filthy mind and fear.

original: dgod pa'i spyod pa ni ro langs sgrub pa'i dus su gad rgyangs sam sgeg pa'i ro'i bye brag go //
analyzed: dgod pa'i spyod pa ni ro langs sgrub pa'i dus su gad rgyangs sam sgeg pa'i ro'i bye brag go //
translated: The laughing conduct is the laughter or the special dance of the zombie at the time of its attainment.

original: drag po'i spyod pa ni rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa'i khro bo'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: drag po'i spyod pa ni rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa'i khro bo'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa'o //
translated: The fierce conduct is the meditation on the mandala of the wrathful deities such as Vajra Humkara.

original: 'jigs par byed pa'i spyod pa ni de'i gzugs nyid kyis bgegs skrod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs par byed pa'i spyod pa ni de'i gzugs nyid kyis bgegs skrod pa'o //
translated: The terrifying activity is the expulsion of obstructors by means of that very form.

original: snying rje'i spyod pa ni sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid de sangs rgyas rnams ni de'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje'i spyod pa ni sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid de sangs rgyas rnams ni de'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The compassionate activity is the characteristic of benefiting sentient beings, because the Buddhas are just the nature of that.

original: ngo mtshar gyi spyod pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa byed pa'i sgo nas 'gro ba rnams 'dul bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: ngo mtshar gyi spyod pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa byed pa'i sgo nas 'gro ba rnams 'dul bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The marvelous activity is the characteristic of taming the world by means of performing pacification and so forth, or

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gzhan dang gzhan spro bas na nam mkha'i khams yongs su 'gengs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gzhan dang gzhan spro bas na nam mkha'i khams yongs su 'gengs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of filling the realm of space by means of emanating other and other maṇḍala wheels.

original: zhi ba'i spyod pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i mtshan nyid de @122a * //
analyzed: zhi ba'i spyod pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i mtshan nyid de @122a * //
translated: The peaceful activity is the characteristic of innate joy,

original: de ni sgeg pa la sogs pa la nye bar longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sgeg pa la sogs pa la nye bar longs spyod pa'o //
translated: which is the enjoyment of grace and so forth.

original: de bzhin du glu zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi mchod pa'i skabs su glu dbyangs bdun gyis glu len pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du glu zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi mchod pa'i skabs su glu dbyangs bdun gyis glu len pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the so-called song is singing with the seven melodies at the time of the maṇḍala offering.

original: de rnams kyang drug las skyes pa dang / drang srong ba dang / sa 'dzin pa dang / bar ma pa dang / blo gsal ba dang / lnga pa dang / 'khor nyan rnams te rgyur gyur pa bdun po de rnams la chags pa'i glu drug cu rtsa bzhi'am /
analyzed: de rnams kyang drug las skyes pa dang / drang srong ba dang / sa 'dzin pa dang / bar ma pa dang / blo gsal ba dang / lnga pa dang / 'khor nyan rnams te rgyur gyur pa bdun po de rnams la chags pa'i glu drug cu rtsa bzhi'am /
translated: These are also born from the six, the seven causes: the Rṣis, the Earth-Holders, the Intermediaries, the Clear-Minded, the Fifth, and the retinue-hearers.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis 'byung ngo //
translated: There are sixty-four or thirty-two songs of attachment to those seven causes.

original: glu dbyangs bdun dang chags glu gsum //
analyzed: glu dbyangs bdun dang chags glu gsum //
translated: Seven melodies and three songs of attachment,

original: rim gyis bskyed pa nyi shu gcig / rgyas pa nyi shu rtsa dgu ste //
analyzed: rim gyis bskyed pa nyi shu gcig / rgyas pa nyi shu rtsa dgu ste //
translated: Twenty-one gradually generated, twenty-nine expanded,

original: de rnams glu dbyangs dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de rnams glu dbyangs dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: These are the maṇḍala of melodies and songs.

original: zhes gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa'o //
translated: As explained.

original: de lta bu ni glu'i bya ba ste glu nyung zad kyang bzlas pa stong dang mnyam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni glu'i bya ba ste glu nyung zad kyang bzlas pa stong dang mnyam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bshad pa'o //
translated: Such is the activity of song. It is explained that even a little song is equal to a thousand recitations.

original: rol mo ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs kyi gtso bor byas pa'i sgo nas rim gyis brdung ba la sogs pa ste de rnams kyang dpal sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba'i rgyud las gsungs pas de nyid la nges par gzung bar bya'o //🔽sgyu rtsal zhes bya ba ni gar dang ri mo dang 'dod pa'i bstan bcos dang / gso ba la sogs pa rnams dang / gar zhes bya ba ni rkang pa mnyam pa dang / rkang pa mi mnyam pa dang / g-yas brkyang ba dang / g-yon brkyang pa dang /
analyzed: rol mo ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs kyi gtso bor byas pa'i sgo nas rim gyis brdung ba la sogs pa ste de rnams kyang dpal sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba'i rgyud las gsungs pas de nyid la nges par gzung bar bya'o // sgyu rtsal zhes bya ba ni gar dang ri mo dang 'dod pa'i bstan bcos dang / gso ba la sogs pa rnams dang / gar zhes bya ba ni rkang pa mnyam pa dang / rkang pa mi mnyam pa dang / g-yas brkyang ba dang / g-yon brkyang pa dang /
translated: The music is the gradual playing of the five Tathagatas' instruments, and so forth, which are to be ascertained as the glorious Sarva-Buddha-Samayoga Tantra.🔽The arts are dancing, painting, the treatises on love, medicine, and so forth, and the dancing is the recollection of the supreme Lord through the even feet, uneven feet, right leg extended, left leg extended,

original: lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rked pa dang / mgrin pa bskyed pa la sogs pas dbang phyug dam pa rjes su dran pa'i sgo nas gar byed do //
analyzed: lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rked pa dang / mgrin pa bskyed pa la sogs pas dbang phyug dam pa rjes su dran pa'i sgo nas gar byed do //
translated: the arms, legs, waist, and neck extended, and so forth.

original: ri mo zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das la dmigs nas de'i phyag rgya 'di bya'o //
analyzed: ri mo zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das la dmigs nas de'i phyag rgya 'di bya'o //
translated: The painting is the painting of the Lord's mudra, which is to be done by visualizing the Lord.

original: 'dod pa'i sgyu rtsal ni padma dang / kha sbyar dang rab sngags la sogs pa'i bya ba'i khyad par rnams kyi bud med kyi yan lag mchog la reg pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgyu rtsal ni padma dang / kha sbyar dang rab sngags la sogs pa'i bya ba'i khyad par rnams kyi bud med kyi yan lag mchog la reg pa'o //
translated: The art of love is the touching of the most sensitive parts of a woman's body, such as the lotus, the union, the secret mantra, and so on.

original: gso ba'i sgyu rtsal zhes bya ba ni rlung la sogs pa'i nad rnams mthun pa'i sman gyis bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: gso ba'i sgyu rtsal zhes bya ba ni rlung la sogs pa'i nad rnams mthun pa'i sman gyis bzlog pa ste /
translated: The art of healing is the curing of diseases of wind, bile, and phlegm by appropriate medicines.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i bya ba'i tshogs ni chu zla lta bu bzhin du ste yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba med par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i bya ba'i tshogs ni chu zla lta bu bzhin du ste yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba med par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: One should perform these and other arts, like the reflection of the moon in water, without the appearance of the concepts of existence and nonexistence. This is the literal meaning.🔽Moreover:

original: gzhan yang / gzugs dang sgra dang de bzhin dri //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gzugs dang sgra dang de bzhin dri //
translated: In form, sound, and likewise smell,

original: ro dang reg bya nyid dag la //
analyzed: ro dang reg bya nyid dag la //
translated: Taste, and touch itself,

original: mig la sogs pa 'jug pa yang //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'jug pa yang //
translated: The engagement of the eye and so on

original: sgyu ma lta bur shes par bya //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur shes par bya //
translated: Should be understood to be like an illusion.

original: 'dir rnam par shes pa ni rgyu gnyis las 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par shes pa ni rgyu gnyis las 'byung ste /
translated: Here, consciousness arises from two causes.

original: gcig ni rtog pa med pa'i gnas @122b skabs las so //
analyzed: gcig ni rtog pa med pa'i gnas @122b skabs las so //
translated: One is from the nonconceptual state.

original: gnyis pa ni nges pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid las te shes pa gnyis po dag ni don byed pa la rab tu 'jug pa'i snang ba'i shes pa dang / don byed pa'i snang ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nges pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid las te shes pa gnyis po dag ni don byed pa la rab tu 'jug pa'i snang ba'i shes pa dang / don byed pa'i snang ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: The second is from the nature of ascertaining consciousness. The two consciousnesses are the consciousness of appearance that engages in the performance of function and the consciousness of the appearance of the performance of function.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga po rnams la 'jug pa ste byis pa dang lkugs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin du dang po dbang po 'jug pa dang / de rnams kyi rnam pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa skye shing nges pa'i shes pa skyes pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de yang sgyu ma bzhin du blta bar bya ste mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga po rnams la 'jug pa ste byis pa dang lkugs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin du dang po dbang po 'jug pa dang / de rnams kyi rnam pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa skye shing nges pa'i shes pa skyes pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de yang sgyu ma bzhin du blta bar bya ste mthar thug pa'o //
translated: They engage the five objects such as form and so on, like the consciousnesses of infants and the mute and so on. The first is the engagement of the sense faculties and the consciousness that apprehends their aspects arises and the ascertaining consciousness that arises is also to be viewed as illusionlike.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Thus:

original: 'dir mang brjod pas ci zhig bya //🔽rdo rje theg pas yang dag tu //
analyzed: 'dir mang brjod pas ci zhig bya // rdo rje theg pas yang dag tu //
translated: What is the use of speaking much here?🔽The yogi/nī should correctly view

original: rnal 'byor pas ni gang dag dmigs //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ni gang dag dmigs //
translated: whatever is observed in the Vajrayāna

original: de de sgyu ma bzhin du brtag / mang du brjod pas dges pa ci zhig yod //
analyzed: de de sgyu ma bzhin du brtag / mang du brjod pas dges pa ci zhig yod //
translated: as illusionlike. What is the use of speaking much?

original: rdo rje theg pa ste gsang sngags kyi gzhung gi lam chen por rang dang gzhan gyi don gang dang gang cung zad bya ba de thams cad sgyu ma bzhin du shes par bya zhing bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje theg pa ste gsang sngags kyi gzhung gi lam chen por rang dang gzhan gyi don gang dang gang cung zad bya ba de thams cad sgyu ma bzhin du shes par bya zhing bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: In the great path of the Vajra Vehicle, that is, the scriptures of the Mantra, whatever is done, whether for one's own or another's purpose, all that should be understood and contemplated as illusion-like. This is the conclusion.

original: 'phags pa byams pas /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pas /
translated: Ārya Maitreya says:

original: spyod nas brtse ba'i bdag nyid sna tshogs spyod yul la //
analyzed: spyod nas brtse ba'i bdag nyid sna tshogs spyod yul la //
translated: Having practiced, the compassionate one engages in various objects.

original: ji lta ji ltar mngon du 'jug par 'gyur ba ste //🔽de lta de ltar rigs shing mtshungs pa'i tshig dag gis //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar mngon du 'jug par 'gyur ba ste // de lta de ltar rigs shing mtshungs pa'i tshig dag gis //
translated: To the extent that he engages in the manifest,

original: sems can rnams la phan phyir mngon par sbyor bar byed //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan phyir mngon par sbyor bar byed //
translated: to that extent he applies himself to the benefit of sentient beings with appropriate and fitting words.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa lnga'i snang ba ni /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa lnga'i snang ba ni /
translated: The appearance of the five consciousnesses such as the eye is:

original: me long gi ni gzugs brnyan dang // rmi lam sgyu ma chu bur dang // mig 'phrul mtshungs par gang gis mthong //
analyzed: me long gi ni gzugs brnyan dang // rmi lam sgyu ma chu bur dang // mig 'phrul mtshungs par gang gis mthong //
translated: One who sees it as similar to a reflection in a mirror, a dream, an illusion, a water bubble, or a magical display,

original: de ni gtso bo yin par bshad //
analyzed: de ni gtso bo yin par bshad //
translated: is said to be the principal one.

original: ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It is said.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa me long gi gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa rmi lam dang mtshungs pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa chu bur dang mtshungs pa dang /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa me long gi gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa rmi lam dang mtshungs pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa chu bur dang mtshungs pa dang /
translated: The eye consciousness is like a reflection in a mirror, the ear consciousness is like a dream, the nose consciousness is like an illusion, the tongue consciousness is like a water bubble,

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa mig 'phrul dang mtshungs par gang gis mthong ba de ni gtso bo rdo rje 'chang chen po yin no zhes bya bar bshad de sbas pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa mig 'phrul dang mtshungs par gang gis mthong ba de ni gtso bo rdo rje 'chang chen po yin no zhes bya bar bshad de sbas pa'o //
translated: and the body consciousness is like a magical display. Whoever sees this is the principal Great Vajradhara.

original: don byed pa snang pa'i shes pa'i rnam par dag pa ni /
analyzed: don byed pa snang pa'i shes pa'i rnam par dag pa ni /
translated: The purity of the consciousness that appears to perform a function is as follows:

original: mthong ba dang ni reg pa nyid //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ni reg pa nyid //
translated: Seeing and touching

original: 'gro ba sgyu ma ji bzhin te //
analyzed: 'gro ba sgyu ma ji bzhin te //
translated: are like an illusory being.

original: kun rdzob tu yang dmigs par byed //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang dmigs par byed //
translated: Even conventionally, they are observed.

original: sgyu ma lta bur rab tu bshad //🔽ces @123a * //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur rab tu bshad // ces @123a * //
translated: They are fully explained to be like an illusion.

original: bya ba rab tu gsungs te /
analyzed: bya ba rab tu gsungs te /
translated: This is fully explained.

original: mthong ba de mig gi rnam par shes pas 'di ni sngon po'o zhes bya ba la sogs par nges par byas pa nas /
analyzed: mthong ba de mig gi rnam par shes pas 'di ni sngon po'o zhes bya ba la sogs par nges par byas pa nas /
translated: That seeing is ascertained by the eye consciousness as “this is blue” and so on.🔽From that, the contact, that is, the body consciousness, ascertains “this is smooth or rough” and so on.

original: reg pa ste lus kyi rnam par shes pas 'di ni 'jam pa'am rtsub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar de dag ni sgyu ma lta bur blta bar bya zhing /
analyzed: reg pa ste lus kyi rnam par shes pas 'di ni 'jam pa'am rtsub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar de dag ni sgyu ma lta bur blta bar bya zhing /
translated: Those are to be viewed as illusionlike.🔽Later than that, the object, that is, the contact with blue and so on, is the object of observation, which is the object that has the characteristic of contact with an entity that is able to perform a function, such as burning or cooking.

original: de las dus phyis sngon po la sogs pa dang phrad pa ni dmigs pa ste sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed nus pa'i dngos po dang phrad pa'i mtshan nyid kun rdzob tu rnam par rtog pa can gyi blos nyams su myang bar bya
analyzed: de las dus phyis sngon po la sogs pa dang phrad pa ni dmigs pa ste sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed nus pa'i dngos po dang phrad pa'i mtshan nyid kun rdzob tu rnam par rtog pa can gyi blos nyams su myang bar bya
translated: That is to be experienced by a conceptual mind that is conventional.🔽That is fully explained as illusionlike.🔽That is the meaning of “to be experienced by a mind that is without an object.”

original: ba gang yin pa de sgyu ma lta bur rab tu bshad pa ni dmigs pa med pa'i bros nyams su myang bar bya'o zhes pa'i don te sbas pa'o //
analyzed: ba gang yin pa de sgyu ma lta bur rab tu bshad pa ni dmigs pa med pa'i bros nyams su myang bar bya'o zhes pa'i don te sbas pa'o //
translated: That is the hidden meaning.🔽In order to teach that very purity in a special way,

original: rnam par dag pa de nyid khyad par du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa de nyid khyad par du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: gang gang dbang po'i lam can nyid //
analyzed: gang gang dbang po'i lam can nyid //
translated: Whatever is the path of the sense faculties,

original: 'byung ba de de'i rang bzhin du //
analyzed: 'byung ba de de'i rang bzhin du //
translated: That is its nature.

original: mnyam gzhag min pa'i rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: mnyam gzhag min pa'i rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: By the yoga of non-equipoise,

original: thams cad sangs rgyas rang bzhin blta //
analyzed: thams cad sangs rgyas rang bzhin blta //
translated: all is seen as the nature of the Buddha.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gang la dbang po'i lam yod pa de ni dbang po'i lam can te mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa drug go //
analyzed: gang la dbang po'i lam yod pa de ni dbang po'i lam can te mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa drug go //
translated: That which has the path of the sense-faculty is the one with the path of the sense-faculty, the six such as the eye-consciousness.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni yul la nye bar longs spyod pa'i phyir rgyug pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni yul la nye bar longs spyod pa'i phyir rgyug pa'o //
translated: The so-called elements are the runnings for the sake of enjoyment of the object.

original: de dang de'i rang bzhin du ste sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin du rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang de'i rang bzhin du ste sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin du rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: That is its nature. It should be cultivated in the illusion-like samadhi.

original: mnyam gzhag min pa'i rnal 'byor te yul dang dbang po 'dus pa las so sor bsdus pa ni rnal 'byor gyi khams gsum pa thams cad sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin te bsam gtan gyi rnal 'byor gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya ste mthar
analyzed: mnyam gzhag min pa'i rnal 'byor te yul dang dbang po 'dus pa las so sor bsdus pa ni rnal 'byor gyi khams gsum pa thams cad sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin te bsam gtan gyi rnal 'byor gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya ste mthar
translated: By the yoga of non-equipoise, from the gathering of the object and sense-faculty, all the three realms are the nature of the Buddha. By the yoga of concentration, one should see the nature of the Tathagata.

original: thug pa'o // phyogs dang yul dang dus la sogs pa la ltos nas /
analyzed: thug pa'o // phyogs dang yul dang dus la sogs pa la ltos nas /
translated: is in all places, in all directions, and at all times.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin //
translated: The nature of all buddhas

original: kun du kun nas thams cad dang // bdag gis thams cad rtag tu ni //🔽dngos su grub pa'i bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: kun du kun nas thams cad dang // bdag gis thams cad rtag tu ni // dngos su grub pa'i bdag nyid ni //
translated: is seen by me in all ways, in every respect, and at all times.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin mthong //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽kun te yul thams cad du'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin mthong // zhes bya ba gsungs te / kun te yul thams cad du'o //
translated: The nature of all buddhas🔽is seen by me in all ways, in every respect, and at all times.🔽All means in all places.

original: kun nas te phyogs thams cad nas so //
analyzed: kun nas te phyogs thams cad nas so //
translated: Every respect means in all directions.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni dngos po gya nom pa dang dman pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni dngos po gya nom pa dang dman pa'o //
translated: All means excellent and inferior things.

original: bdag gi thams cad byed ces bya ba ni bdag gi phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi thams cad byed ces bya ba ni bdag gi phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'o //
translated: All of me means my aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on.

original: rtag tu ste dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ste dus thams cad du'o //
translated: At all times means all the time.

original: dngos su zhes bya ba mngon sum mam rjes @123b su dpag pa'i tshad mas gnas skabs de rnams su rang gi bdag nyid sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin du mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don te mthar thug pa'am
analyzed: dngos su zhes bya ba mngon sum mam rjes @123b su dpag pa'i tshad mas gnas skabs de rnams su rang gi bdag nyid sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin du mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don te mthar thug pa'am
translated: In reality means that in those situations, by means of direct perception or inference, one sees one's own nature as the nature of all the Buddhas, the nature of all the Tathagatas.

original: // da ni spyod lam rnam par dag pa //
analyzed: // da ni spyod lam rnam par dag pa //
translated: Now, the purity of conduct:

original: tso bo bde ba kun rang bzhin //
analyzed: tso bo bde ba kun rang bzhin //
translated: The chief, the nature of all bliss,

original: sems dpa' chen po gshegs dang bzhugs //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po gshegs dang bzhugs //
translated: the great being, going and staying,

original: gnas dang zas dang bzhon la sogs //
analyzed: gnas dang zas dang bzhon la sogs //
translated: dwelling, food, vehicle, and so on,

original: skad cig dag gis mkha' ru dmigs //
analyzed: skad cig dag gis mkha' ru dmigs //
translated: are seen in space in an instant.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te ting nge 'dzin la phan 'dogs par mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir gtso bo'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te ting nge 'dzin la phan 'dogs par mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir gtso bo'o //
translated: The chief is so called because he benefits samadhi.

original: bde ba kun ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags par ma'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: bde ba kun ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags par ma'i bdag nyid de /
translated: All bliss is of the nature of passionlessness and passion.

original: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni de dag bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni de dag bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of those is the innate nature, because they are included in that.

original: sems dpa' chen po ni gang la sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin chen po la sems dpa' yod pa ni sems dpa' chen po ste des gshegs pa la sogs pa'i spyod lam bzhi po de rnams mkha' ru dmigs zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin du
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po ni gang la sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin chen po la sems dpa' yod pa ni sems dpa' chen po ste des gshegs pa la sogs pa'i spyod lam bzhi po de rnams mkha' ru dmigs zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin du
translated: Those four activities of going and so forth are perceived in the sky, that is to say, they are known to be of the nature of space.

original: shes pa'o // da ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: shes pa'o // da ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: Now, the result of the stage of self-consecration is stated:🔽He becomes the cutter-off of existence,

original: srid pa gcod par 'gyur pa dang // ston pa 'gro na mchog 'gyur zhing //🔽lha dang bcas pa thams cad kyis //
analyzed: srid pa gcod par 'gyur pa dang // ston pa 'gro na mchog 'gyur zhing // lha dang bcas pa thams cad kyis //
translated: the teacher, the best of those who go,🔽and is again and again

original: yang dang yang du phyag byas mchod //
analyzed: yang dang yang du phyag byas mchod //
translated: worshipped with prostrations by all, including the gods.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te rnal 'byor pa de ni srid pa gcod pa ste 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa gcod par byed pa dang / 'jig rten rnams kyi ston par byed pa'i phyir ston pa dang / 'gro ba na nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams las mchog ste dam pa dang /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te rnal 'byor pa de ni srid pa gcod pa ste 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa gcod par byed pa dang / 'jig rten rnams kyi ston par byed pa'i phyir ston pa dang / 'gro ba na nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams las mchog ste dam pa dang /
translated: That yogi becomes the cutter-off of existence, the one who cuts off the fear of cyclic existence, and the teacher because he teaches the world, and he is the best, the supreme, of those yogis who go, such as the sravakas, and is worshipped with prostrations by all, including the gods.

original: de bzhin du lha dang bcas pa kun gyis te dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyis lus mi snang bar byas nas yang dang yang du phyag byas shing btud nas mchod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid de sgra ji
analyzed: de bzhin du lha dang bcas pa kun gyis te dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyis lus mi snang bar byas nas yang dang yang du phyag byas shing btud nas mchod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid de sgra ji
translated: This is the definition of the accomplishment of the great seal, which is literal.

original: bzhin pa'o // de bzhin du /
analyzed: bzhin pa'o // de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: ji ltar ston pa rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: ji ltar ston pa rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: just as the teacher, the perfect Buddha,

original: 'jig rten phan par bzhed pas gshegs //
analyzed: 'jig rten phan par bzhed pas gshegs //
translated: goes for the sake of benefiting the world,

original: de bzhin rnal 'byor chen po ni //
analyzed: de bzhin rnal 'byor chen po ni //
translated: so too the great yoga

original: rang gi shes rab skye ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rang gi shes rab skye ba'i phyir //
translated: goes for the sake of generating one's wisdom.

original: ji ltar ston pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can gyi 'jig rten la phan par bzhed pa ste 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol dag tu phan par mdzad par gshegs @124a * //
analyzed: ji ltar ston pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can gyi 'jig rten la phan par bzhed pa ste 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol dag tu phan par mdzad par gshegs @124a * //
translated: Just as the teacher, the perfect Buddha, the Blessed One, goes for the sake of benefiting the world of sentient beings abiding in the three realms, for the sake of benefit in this world and the next world,

original: shing rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: shing rgyu ba'o //
translated: he goes and moves about.

original: de bzhin de de kho na bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin de de kho na bzhin du'o //
translated: So too, in the same way,

original: rnal 'byor chen po ste 'di ni phyag rgya chen po ste grub pa yang yin la rnal 'byor pa yang yin pas rnal 'byor chen po 'jig rten gyi khams la phan par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po ste 'di ni phyag rgya chen po ste grub pa yang yin la rnal 'byor pa yang yin pas rnal 'byor chen po 'jig rten gyi khams la phan par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The great yogi, who is both a practitioner and a master of the Great Seal, will benefit the world.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang de bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i rang bzhin gyis zhes pa ste 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin rab ste rnam par mi rtog pa skye zhing 'byung ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi don byed par
analyzed: rang de bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i rang bzhin gyis zhes pa ste 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin rab ste rnam par mi rtog pa skye zhing 'byung ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi don byed par
translated: Because the nonconceptual gnosis, which is the nature of the self-consecration stage, arises and occurs, just like the Tathāgata, he will benefit all sentient beings.

original: 'gyur te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: This is the literal reading.🔽There is nothing whatsoever that should not be accomplished

original: thams cad kyi dbang phyug yin par /🔽bsgrub par mi bya cung zad med //
analyzed: thams cad kyi dbang phyug yin par / bsgrub par mi bya cung zad med //
translated: by the lord of all,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dmigs pas na //

translated: Therefore, the stage of self-consecration is not the extreme of eternalism, because it is the very body of gnosis. It is not the extreme of nihilism, because it is the very form of the deity arisen from the ultimate.

original: de'i phyir dus gsum gyi 'khor ba'i sdug @125b bsngal yang dag par dran par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus gsum gyi 'khor ba'i sdug @125b bsngal yang dag par dran par bya ste /

translated: One who desires liberation should please the vajra master with effort, obtain the esoteric instructions of the stage of self-consecration, and strive for the means of purifying it. This is not the intended meaning.

analyzed: bla ma mchod pa yang dag brtsam // de mnyes pas ni kun mkhyen pa'i //
translated: one should properly undertake the worship of the guru.🔽By pleasing him, one will obtain

analyzed: ye shes mchog ste thob par 'gyur //
