translated: What is there that is not accumulated virtue? What is there that is not the practice of the brahma abodes and so on? What is there that is not the austerity of the characteristics?

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud la kyang bdag cag sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ba yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud la kyang bdag cag sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ba yin no //
translated: In the Root Tantra it says, “We are the mothers of all buddhas.”

original: bdag cag sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ma yin no zhes de skad dus gsum du brjod cing mchod pa mdzad nas gshegs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag cag sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ma yin no zhes de skad dus gsum du brjod cing mchod pa mdzad nas gshegs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: “We are the mothers of all buddhas.” Having said this, they made offerings and departed.

original: de'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa' dang rdo rje slob dpon la khyad par 'ga' yang med de sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa' dang rdo rje slob dpon la khyad par 'ga' yang med de sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: Therefore there is not the slightest difference between Vajrasattva and the vajra master. This is the literal reading.

original: mchod pa de nyid kyi bye brag ni /
analyzed: mchod pa de nyid kyi bye brag ni /
translated: The specific features of that offering are as follows.

original: de nyid mi zad 'dod pa yis //
analyzed: de nyid mi zad 'dod pa yis //
translated: 10. In order to have that very thing which is inexhaustible,

original: shin tu gces pa gang dang gang //
analyzed: shin tu gces pa gang dang gang //
translated: whatever is most precious,🔽whatever is most special,

original: shin tu khyad par can nyid dag / de dang de ni bla mar dbul //🔽zhes bya @126a * //🔽pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shin tu khyad par can nyid dag / de dang de ni bla mar dbul // zhes bya @126a * // pa gsungs te /
translated: that he should offer to the Guru.

original: shin tu gces pa gang dang gang //
analyzed: shin tu gces pa gang dang gang //
translated: Whatever is most precious

original: zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi nor bu dang mu tig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi nor bu dang mu tig la sogs pa'o //
translated: refers to external things, such as jewels and pearls.

original: shin tu khyad par can ni shin tu srog pas kyang lhag pa'i rang gi chung ma la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu khyad par can ni shin tu srog pas kyang lhag pa'i rang gi chung ma la sogs pa ste /
translated: Whatever is most special, more than just precious, is his own wife, etc.

original: de dag de bla ma rdo rje slob dpon la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag de bla ma rdo rje slob dpon la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: He should offer these to the Guru, the Vajra-Teacher.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why?

original: gal te re zhig thar pa don du gnyer pa de'i tshe ni phyi rol rnams kyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gal te re zhig thar pa don du gnyer pa de'i tshe ni phyi rol rnams kyis ci zhig bya /
translated: If he is seeking liberation, what is the use of external things?

original: ci zhig mi 'dod pa de'i tshe yang zhing dag pa la phul bas nor de mi zad par 'gyur pa yin pa'i phyir bdog pa thams cad sbyin pa dang khyad par can gyi sbyin pa dang sbyin pa chen po rnams de la dbul bar bya ste /
analyzed: ci zhig mi 'dod pa de'i tshe yang zhing dag pa la phul bas nor de mi zad par 'gyur pa yin pa'i phyir bdog pa thams cad sbyin pa dang khyad par can gyi sbyin pa dang sbyin pa chen po rnams de la dbul bar bya ste /
translated: Since wealth given to the pure field of merit is inexhaustible, one should offer all one's wealth, special wealth, and great wealth to the Buddha.

original: dud 'gro rnams la sbyin na brgya 'gyur thob //
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams la sbyin na brgya 'gyur thob //
translated: If one gives to animals, one obtains a hundredfold.

original: sdig pa can la byin na stong 'gyur thob //🔽tshul khrims ldan pas 'bum 'gyur thob pa yin //
analyzed: sdig pa can la byin na stong 'gyur thob // tshul khrims ldan pas 'bum 'gyur thob pa yin //
translated: If one gives to the sinful, one obtains a thousandfold.🔽If one gives to the moral, one obtains a hundred thousandfold.

original: 'dod chags bral las bye ba brgya 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral las bye ba brgya 'gyur te //
translated: If one gives to the passionless, one obtains a billionfold.

original: gang zhig mi slob pa la byin byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig mi slob pa la byin byed pa //
translated: If one gives to the nonlearner,

original: des na longs spyod shin tu khyad 'phags 'thob //
analyzed: des na longs spyod shin tu khyad 'phags 'thob //
translated: one obtains extremely special wealth.

original: skyes bu gang gis sangs rgyas la phul na //
analyzed: skyes bu gang gis sangs rgyas la phul na //
translated: If one gives to the Buddha,

original: de yis longs spyod phun tshogs zad mi 'gyur //🔽zhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: de yis longs spyod phun tshogs zad mi 'gyur // zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: one obtains inexhaustible wealth.

original: slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristics of a master are as follows:

original: slob dpon gyis ni sdig pa 'phrog / slob dpon gyis ni 'jigs pa sel //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ni sdig pa 'phrog / slob dpon gyis ni 'jigs pa sel //
translated: The master removes sin, the master removes fear,

original: slob dpon gyis ni sdug bsngal gyi //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ni sdug bsngal gyi //
translated: The master,

original: rgya mtsho 'jigs pa pha rol sgrol //
analyzed: rgya mtsho 'jigs pa pha rol sgrol //
translated: liberates from the ocean of suffering, the fearful shore.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te slob dpon gyis ni rig pa'i dbang bskur ba'i sgo nas sdig pa 'phrog ste rnam par shes par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te slob dpon gyis ni rig pa'i dbang bskur ba'i sgo nas sdig pa 'phrog ste rnam par shes par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The master, by means of the initiation of knowledge, takes away sin, because he has become the consciousness.

original: gsang ba'i dbang bskur bas ni 'jigs pa sel te rnam par rtog pa'i 'jigs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang bskur bas ni 'jigs pa sel te rnam par rtog pa'i 'jigs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By means of the secret initiation, he removes fear, because he abandons the fear of conceptualization.

original: shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba'i sgo nas sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho 'jigs chen te nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'khor ba las sgrol zhing pha rol tu phyin par byed pa ste mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba'i sgo nas sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho 'jigs chen te nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'khor ba las sgrol zhing pha rol tu phyin par byed pa ste mthar thug pa'o //
translated: By means of the initiation of wisdom knowledge, he liberates from the ocean of suffering, the fearful shore, i.e., he liberates from the cyclic life which is the nature of the afflictive emotions and the obstructions to omniscience, and he causes them to reach the other shore, i.e., the ultimate.

original: slob ma snod dang snod ma yin pa brtag pa /
analyzed: slob ma snod dang snod ma yin pa brtag pa /
translated: The examination of the disciple as to whether he is a worthy or unworthy vessel.

original: gang zhig nga rgyal gyis sbags shing ;
analyzed: gang zhig nga rgyal gyis sbags shing ;
translated: To him who is defiled by pride,🔽who teaches the stages of untruth,

original: / bden min rim pa ston byed dang // de nyid chos la brnyas bcas pa //
analyzed: / bden min rim pa ston byed dang // de nyid chos la brnyas bcas pa //
translated: and who is contemptuous of reality and the Dharma,

original: de la de nyid bstan mi bya //
analyzed: de la de nyid bstan mi bya //
translated: reality should not be taught.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te slob ma gang zhig nga rgyal dang ldan pa la de bzhin du gal te de kho na nyid yang dag par ston par byed pa na nyes pa ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te slob ma gang zhig nga rgyal dang ldan pa la de bzhin du gal te de kho na nyid yang dag par ston par byed pa na nyes pa ci zhig yod de /
translated: What is the fault if one teaches reality to a disciple who is proud in this way?

original: 'on kyang bden @126b min te yang dag pa ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid kyi rim pa ston pa dang / de bzhin du de nyid chos te bla ma'i man ngag gi tshig rnams la brnyas pa dang bcas shing sla chos dang bcas pa'i slob ma de la don dam pa'i de kho na nyid bstan zhing bshad par mi bya ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang bden @126b min te yang dag pa ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid kyi rim pa ston pa dang / de bzhin du de nyid chos te bla ma'i man ngag gi tshig rnams la brnyas pa dang bcas shing sla chos dang bcas pa'i slob ma de la don dam pa'i de kho na nyid bstan zhing bshad par mi bya ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: However, it is not true that one should not teach the sequence of reality to one who is not authentic, and likewise, one should not explain the ultimate reality to a disciple who is contemptuous of the words of the guru’s instructions and is a practitioner of mere words.

original: slob ma dam pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: slob ma dam pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristics of a good disciple are:

original: bla ma la gus bden par smra //
analyzed: bla ma la gus bden par smra //
translated: devotion to the guru, speaking the truth,

original: rnam par bden zhing rgyud gcig la //
analyzed: rnam par bden zhing rgyud gcig la //
translated: being honest, having a single continuum,

original: dam tshig spyod pa srung byed pa //
analyzed: dam tshig spyod pa srung byed pa //
translated: and guarding the conduct of the commitments.

original: da la rim pa bstan par bya //
analyzed: da la rim pa bstan par bya //
translated: The stages are taught for him.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te 'chad pa po'i bla ma la gus shing zhes dang bcas pa dang / de bzhin du sgyu la sogs pa ngang bral ba'i phyir bden par smra ba dang ; yul la nye bar longs spyod pa la sogs pa phyi rol rnams la chags pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par dben zhing dbang po thul ba dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te 'chad pa po'i bla ma la gus shing zhes dang bcas pa dang / de bzhin du sgyu la sogs pa ngang bral ba'i phyir bden par smra ba dang ; yul la nye bar longs spyod pa la sogs pa phyi rol rnams la chags pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par dben zhing dbang po thul ba dang /
translated: Likewise, he is truthful because he is free of deceit and so forth, and he is solitary and has subdued his senses because he is not attached to external objects such as enjoyment.

original: de bzhin du chos la nges par rtog pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir lhan cig bshad pa'i gzhal bya thams cad kyi don dang tshig 'dzin pas rgyud gcig pa dang / bstan bcos kyi 'bras bu dam tshig nyams su blangs pa gang yin pa de byed pa'i phyir dam tshig gi spyod pa srung ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos la nges par rtog pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir lhan cig bshad pa'i gzhal bya thams cad kyi don dang tshig 'dzin pas rgyud gcig pa dang / bstan bcos kyi 'bras bu dam tshig nyams su blangs pa gang yin pa de byed pa'i phyir dam tshig gi spyod pa srung ba dang /
translated: He is of one mind because he possesses the wisdom that arises from ascertaining the Dharma and thus he retains the meaning and words of all the topics that are explained together, and he guards the conduct of samaya because he engages in the practice of the result of the treatise, which is the samaya.

original: gang gi sgras sems can gyi bya ba la brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i slob ma de lta bu gang yin pa de la rim pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi sgras sems can gyi bya ba la brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i slob ma de lta bu gang yin pa de la rim pa ste /
translated: The word “whoever” refers to a disciple who is diligent in the activities of sentient beings.🔽To such a disciple, the teacher should explain the stage,

original: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan zhing bla mas man ngag sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan zhing bla mas man ngag sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: the stage of self-consecration, and should give the oral instructions.🔽This is the literal reading.

original: rim pa lnga'i bshad pa'i nor bu'i phreng ba las bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: rim pa lnga'i bshad pa'i nor bu'i phreng ba las bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ste gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the third chapter, the stage of self-consecration, in the Ornament of the Essence, a commentary on the difficult points of the treatise Differentiating the Middle and the Extremes.🔽The chapter on manifest enlightenment.

original: // / mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i skabs su dang por phyag 'tshal ba ni /
analyzed: // / mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i skabs su dang por phyag 'tshal ba ni /
translated: Homage to Vajrasattva,

original: thams cad stong nyid ston pa po //🔽rdo rje sems dpa' phyag 'tshal te //🔽bzhi pa mngon par byang chub pa'i //
analyzed: thams cad stong nyid ston pa po // rdo rje sems dpa' phyag 'tshal te // bzhi pa mngon par byang chub pa'i //
translated: who reveals the emptiness of everything.🔽I will explain the fourth,

original: rim 'di bdag gis bshad par bya //
analyzed: rim 'di bdag gis bshad par bya //
translated: the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽stong pa bco brgyad kyi de kho na nyid thams cad stong pa ston par mdzad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / stong pa bco brgyad kyi de kho na nyid thams cad stong pa ston par mdzad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is stated.🔽Because he is the one who reveals the reality of the eighteen emptinesses, the emptiness of everything,

original: thams cad stong nyid ston pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad stong nyid ston pa'o //
translated: he is the one who reveals the emptiness of everything.

original: gang la rdo rje ste rdo rje rtse lnga pa de la sems shing phyag na bsnams pa yod pa de ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: gang la rdo rje ste rdo rje rtse lnga pa de la sems shing phyag na bsnams pa yod pa de ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: He who has a vajra, that is, a five-pronged vajra, and who holds it in his hand, is Vajrasattva, the Lord Vajrasattva.

original: de la phyag 'tshal te bzhi pa mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bdag gis bshad cing bstan par bya'o zhes pa ni drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal te bzhi pa mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bdag gis bshad cing bstan par bya'o zhes pa ni drang ba'i don to //
translated: Having bowed to him, I will explain, I will teach, the fourth, the stage of manifest enlightenment. This is the interpretable meaning explanation.

original: de bzhin du thams @127a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams @127a * //
translated: Similarly,

original: cad stong pa ni stong pa nyid gsum sdud par byed pa'i de kho na nyid de de ston par mdzad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad stong pa nyid ston pa po'o //
analyzed: cad stong pa ni stong pa nyid gsum sdud par byed pa'i de kho na nyid de de ston par mdzad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad stong pa nyid ston pa po'o //
translated: he who is the teacher of the emptiness of everything is the teacher of the emptiness of everything, because he is the one who teaches that reality which subsumes the three kinds of emptiness.

original: rdo rje ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Vajra is unobstructed intuition.🔽He who has his mind set on that, who abides in that, is Vajrasattva.

original: gang zhig de la sems shing gnas pa de ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste de la phyag 'tshal nas so ;
analyzed: gang zhig de la sems shing gnas pa de ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste de la phyag 'tshal nas so ;
translated: Having bowed to him,

original: / bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa gsum po sdud par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: / bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa gsum po sdud par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bzhi pa ste /
translated: the fourth, which is the fourth because it subsumes the three, passion and so on.

original: de nyid mngon du byang chub nyid thob par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mngon du byang chub nyid thob par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: It is the manifest enlightenment, because it causes the attainment of enlightenment itself.

original: de'i rim pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa ste de bdag gis bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rim pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa ste de bdag gis bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: The stages of that are the stages of the seal and the meditative concentration, and I will explain that.

original: yang na rdo rje 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dag yin zhing sems dpa' ni 'dod chags par ma ste de rnams kyi thams cad stong pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dag yin zhing sems dpa' ni 'dod chags par ma ste de rnams kyi thams cad stong pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: Or else, the vajra is desire and freedom from desire, and the hero is the one who is not desirous. The emptiness of all of them is the innate.

original: de ston pa de la phyag 'tshal te bdag gis bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ston pa de la phyag 'tshal te bdag gis bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: I will explain that, having paid homage to him who teaches that.

original: rdo rje ni gsang ba'i rdo rje yin zhing sems dpa' ni padma ste de dag 'dus pa las thob pa'i bde ba chen po ni thams cad stong pa yin zhing de ston pa po la phyag 'tshal te bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin
analyzed: rdo rje ni gsang ba'i rdo rje yin zhing sems dpa' ni padma ste de dag 'dus pa las thob pa'i bde ba chen po ni thams cad stong pa yin zhing de ston pa po la phyag 'tshal te bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin
translated: The vajra is the secret vajra, and the sattva is the lotus. The great bliss obtained from their union is the emptiness of everything. I pay homage to the teacher of that, and I will explain it. This is not the implied meaning.

original: pa'o // rdo rje sems dpa' ni drug pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: pa'o // rdo rje sems dpa' ni drug pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Vajrasattva is the sixth buddha Vajradhara.

original: rtag du thams cad nas thams cad du stong zhing gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa de kho na nyid nye bar ston pas na thams cad stong pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: rtag du thams cad nas thams cad du stong zhing gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa de kho na nyid nye bar ston pas na thams cad stong pa ston pa'o //
translated: He is the teacher of the emptiness of everything, because he always and in every way teaches the reality that is empty and devoid of the self of persons and phenomena.

original: de la phyag 'tshal te bdag gis bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal te bdag gis bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: I pay homage to him and I will explain it. This is the literal meaning.

original: rdo ni sa'o //
analyzed: rdo ni sa'o //
translated: Vajra is earth.

original: rje ni chu'i khams so //
analyzed: rje ni chu'i khams so //
translated: Rje is the water element.

original: sems ni me'i khams so //
analyzed: sems ni me'i khams so //
translated: Sattva is the fire element.

original: dpa' ni rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: dpa' ni rlung gi khams so //
translated: Dpa' is the wind element.

original: thams ni gzugs so //🔽cad ni sgra'o //
analyzed: thams ni gzugs so // cad ni sgra'o //
translated: Thams is form.🔽Cad is sound.

original: stong ni dri'o //
analyzed: stong ni dri'o //
translated: Stong is smell.

original: pa ni ro ste khams dang yul de rnams kyi 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid ston cing 'chad pa po la phyag 'tshal te bdag gis bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni ro ste khams dang yul de rnams kyi 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid ston cing 'chad pa po la phyag 'tshal te bdag gis bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The na is the taste, the reality of the light of those elements and objects. Having bowed to the teacher who shows and explains that, I will explain. This is not the literal meaning.

original: gang la ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi de kho na nyid kyi rdo rje la sems shing gtod pa yod pa de ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: gang la ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi de kho na nyid kyi rdo rje la sems shing gtod pa yod pa de ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The one who has the vajra of reality, which is the nature of the five wisdoms, in mind and is intent on it is Vajrasattva.

original: brtan dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad stong pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te de nye bar ston par mdzad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad stong pa ston pa po'o //
analyzed: brtan dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad stong pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te de nye bar ston par mdzad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad stong pa ston pa po'o //
translated: The emptiness of all things, moving and unmoving, is nondual wisdom. He is the teacher of the emptiness of all things because he is the one who teaches that.

original: de la phyag 'tshal te bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yi @127b ge'i don to //
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal te bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yi @127b ge'i don to //
translated: Having bowed to him, I will explain. This is the verbal meaning.

original: rdo rje ni 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa rnams so //
translated: The vajra is the consciousnesses that apprehend.

original: sems dpa' ni gzung bar bya ba'i yul dang dbang po rnams te de dag thams cad gcig dang du ma nyid dang bral ba'i sgo nas stong pa nyid du ston cing rang bzhin med pa'i gnas su ston pa po la phyag 'tshal te bshad par bya'o zhes bya
analyzed: sems dpa' ni gzung bar bya ba'i yul dang dbang po rnams te de dag thams cad gcig dang du ma nyid dang bral ba'i sgo nas stong pa nyid du ston cing rang bzhin med pa'i gnas su ston pa po la phyag 'tshal te bshad par bya'o zhes bya
translated: Homage to him, and I will explain.

original: ba ni spyi'i don to //
analyzed: ba ni spyi'i don to //
translated: This is the general meaning.

original: rdo rje ni rtsa bdun khri nyis stong yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje ni rtsa bdun khri nyis stong yin no //
translated: The vajra is the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: sems dpa' ni de las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyis 'gro ba sprul pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni de las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyis 'gro ba sprul pa'o //
translated: The heroes are the emanations of migrating beings by the bodhicitta that arises from them.

original: de yang ngo bo nyid kyi bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad stong pa yin zhing de ston par mdzad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad stong pa ston pa po'o //
analyzed: de yang ngo bo nyid kyi bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad stong pa yin zhing de ston par mdzad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad stong pa ston pa po'o //
translated: Moreover, because it is the nature of the essence of great bliss, it is empty of everything, and because it is the teacher of that, it is the teacher of emptiness.🔽Homage to him, and I will explain.

original: de la phyag 'tshal te bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal te bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
translated: This is the general meaning.

original: rdo rje ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni dga' ba'o //
translated: The vajra is joy.

original: sems dpa' ni mchog go //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni mchog go //
translated: The hero is supreme.

original: thams cad ni bral ba ste de rnams kyi stong pa ni lhan cig skyes pa yin zhing de ston pa de la phyag 'tshal te zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni bral ba ste de rnams kyi stong pa ni lhan cig skyes pa yin zhing de ston pa de la phyag 'tshal te zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
translated: This is the hidden meaning.

original: rdo rje ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The vajra is the clearlight transparency.

original: sems dpa' ni de las langs pa'i lha'i sku'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni de las langs pa'i lha'i sku'o //
translated: The sattva is the deity’s body arisen from that.🔽The emptiness of all of them is the twelve examples of illusion, and I pay homage to him who teaches that.

original: thams cad stong pa ni sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis te de rnams ston pa po la phyag 'tshal te bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad stong pa ni sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis te de rnams ston pa po la phyag 'tshal te bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
translated: This is the hidden meaning.

original: rdo rje ni rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rdo rje ni rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
translated: The vajra is the three consciousnesses, which are indivisible like a vajra.

original: sems dpa' ni de dang 'brel pa de'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni de dang 'brel pa de'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: The sattva is the nature of those three consciousnesses.

original: de rnams thams cad kyi stong pa nyid ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad kyi stong pa nyid ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The emptiness of all of them is the clearlight transparency.🔽I pay homage to him who teaches that and causes it to be attained.

original: de ston cing thob par mdzad pa la phyag 'tshal te bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: de ston cing thob par mdzad pa la phyag 'tshal te bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
translated: This is the hidden meaning.

original: rdo rje ni ril par 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: rdo rje ni ril par 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The vajra is the meditative stabilization of grasping the totality.

original: sems dpa' ni rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin te de dag las byung ba'i thams cad stong pa 'od gsal pa de ston par mdzad cing de la dmigs par mdzad pa la phyag 'tshal te bdag gis bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin te de dag las byung ba'i thams cad stong pa 'od gsal pa de ston par mdzad cing de la dmigs par mdzad pa la phyag 'tshal te bdag gis bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The hero is the meditative concentration of subsequent destruction. I pay homage to him who reveals and focuses on that clear light of universal emptiness which arises from those. I will explain. This is the ultimate.

original: rdo rje ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The vajra is the ultimate truth.

original: sems dpa' ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste de dag la mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa med pa'i thams cad stong pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste de dag la mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa med pa'i thams cad stong pa'o //
translated: The hero is the conventional truth. Since he is nirvana which does not abide in those, he is the universal emptiness which is not differentiated.

original: de ston pa po la phyag 'tshal te bdag gis bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: de ston pa po la phyag 'tshal te bdag gis bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: I pay homage to him who reveals that. I will explain. This is the ultimate.

original: da ni phyag bya bar 'os pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' dang / rdo rje slob dpon tha mi dad par bshad par bya'o snyam du thugs la bzhag nas /
analyzed: da ni phyag bya bar 'os pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' dang / rdo rje slob dpon tha mi dad par bshad par bya'o snyam du thugs la bzhag nas /
translated: Now, thinking that the vajra being who is worthy of homage and the vajra master are not different, he sets his mind on explaining.

original: de ni rang 'byung bcom ldan @128a * //
analyzed: de ni rang 'byung bcom ldan @128a * //
translated: The Blessed One is self-arisen.

original: 'das ; / gcig nyid bdag nyid che ba'i lha //
analyzed: 'das ; / gcig nyid bdag nyid che ba'i lha //
translated: The one who is the great god of the great self,

original: man ngag rnams ni rab ster bas //
analyzed: man ngag rnams ni rab ster bas //
translated: the bestower of the instructions,

original: rdo rje slob dpon de bas lhag / ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon de bas lhag / ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is the vajra master, who is greater than the great.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bag chags rnams bcos pas na bcom ldan 'das sam bha ga la bzhugs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bag chags rnams bcos pas na bcom ldan 'das sam bha ga la bzhugs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He is the transcendent lord because he is the one who has conquered the habitual tendencies of the afflictive obscurations and the habitual tendencies of the cognitive obscurations.

original: ji lta bu zhe na rang 'byung ste chos thams cad la khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos nyid kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na rang 'byung ste chos thams cad la khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos nyid kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: He is the one who is self-arisen, the essence of the reality that is the nature of all phenomena, which pervades all phenomena.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi chos nyid ni rgyu 'ga' zhig gis so sor nges pa'i tshogs pa la brten nas thob par bya ba'am bskyed par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi chos nyid ni rgyu 'ga' zhig gis so sor nges pa'i tshogs pa la brten nas thob par bya ba'am bskyed par bya ba yin te /
translated: The reality of suchness is not something that is attained or generated in dependence on a collection of causes that are individually ascertained.

original: 'on kyang de ni nam mkha' bzhin du rang nyid 'byung ba kho na yin pa'i phyir rang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni nam mkha' bzhin du rang nyid 'byung ba kho na yin pa'i phyir rang 'byung ngo //
translated: Rather, it is self-arisen because it is like space, which arises by itself.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam la sogs pa'am sngags dang phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pas ni glo bur ba'i dri ma bcos ma rnams spang bar bya ba yin gyi de kho na nyid bskyed par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam la sogs pa'am sngags dang phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pas ni glo bur ba'i dri ma bcos ma rnams spang bar bya ba yin gyi de kho na nyid bskyed par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The paths of seeing and cultivation, etc., and the mantras, seals, meditative stabilizations, etc., are for the abandonment of adventitious, artificial defilements, but not for the generation of reality.

original: rang bzhin gzhan du bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to change the intrinsic reality of anything,

original: nam mkha' bstan du yod pa nyid la sogs par mi nus pa bzhin no //🔽bur ma gyi ni mngar dang me'i //
analyzed: nam mkha' bstan du yod pa nyid la sogs par mi nus pa bzhin no // bur ma gyi ni mngar dang me'i //
translated: just as it is not possible to make space visible, etc.🔽Just as sweetness is the intrinsic reality of molasses,

original: tsha ba rang bzhin yin pa ltar //🔽de bzhin kho nar chos rnams kyi //
analyzed: tsha ba rang bzhin yin pa ltar // de bzhin kho nar chos rnams kyi //
translated: and heat is the intrinsic reality of fire,🔽so too is emptiness

original: stong pa rang bzhin yin par 'dod //
analyzed: stong pa rang bzhin yin par 'dod //
translated: the intrinsic reality of all things.

original: nges kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: nges kyang gsungs so //
translated: And also:

original: de yang gcig nyid yin zhing nyid kyis gra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang gcig nyid yin zhing nyid kyis gra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word “just” has the sense of exclusion,

original: chos nyid la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in reality.

original: de dang ldan pa nyid yin na ni kun rdzob bzhin du khyab par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa nyid yin na ni kun rdzob bzhin du khyab par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were just that, it would not be a pervader, like the conventional.

original: de ni bdag nyid che ba'i lha ste ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sdud par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid che ba'i lha ste ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sdud par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the great lord, because he is the one who gathers together the Tathagatas, who are the nature of the five intuitions.

original: drug pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bdag po yang yin no //
analyzed: drug pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bdag po yang yin no //
translated: He is also the lord of the Tathagatas.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang bas kyang rdo rje slob dpon lhag cing khyad par du 'phags par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang bas kyang rdo rje slob dpon lhag cing khyad par du 'phags par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the Vajra Master is superior to even the Blessed One, Vajradhara, who has such an aspect.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par byed pa'i man ngag rab ster ba ste khyad par du ster bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par byed pa'i man ngag rab ster ba ste khyad par du ster bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he bestows the instruction that causes the attainment of the state of Great Vajradhara, and bestows it in particular.

original: dgongs pa ni re zhig bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po ni mngon sum du mthong ba 'am lung 'bogs par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni re zhig bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po ni mngon sum du mthong ba 'am lung 'bogs par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The idea is that the Blessed One, Great Vajradhara, is not one who causes the direct perception or the bestowal of instruction,

original: 'on kyang @128b bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis de kho na nyid 'di khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang @128b bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis de kho na nyid 'di khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: but rather, by the power of meditation, one will come to understand this reality.

original: bsgom pa de yang bla ma'i sku drin kho nas rnyed par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo gang zhig sngon ma shes pa shes par byed pa gang yin pa de ni de bas ches lhag pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba yin te
analyzed: bsgom pa de yang bla ma'i sku drin kho nas rnyed par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo gang zhig sngon ma shes pa shes par byed pa gang yin pa de ni de bas ches lhag pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba yin te
translated: Since that meditation is found only through the kindness of the guru, one should understand that whatever essence was not previously known is made known, and that is more excellent.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not the intended meaning.

original: de mnyes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de mnyes par bya ba ni /
translated: Please him

original: zla ba phyed dam zla ba ru //
analyzed: zla ba phyed dam zla ba ru //
translated: for half a month or a month.

original: de ni yang dag mnyes bya ste //
analyzed: de ni yang dag mnyes bya ste //
translated: He should be truly pleased

original: mnyes par gyur pa'i bla ma la //
analyzed: mnyes par gyur pa'i bla ma la //
translated: and the pleased guru

original: ci nus pas ni mchod par bya //
analyzed: ci nus pas ni mchod par bya //
translated: should be worshipped with whatever one has.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te dang por re zhig mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i man ngag don du gnyer ba'i slob mas zla ba phyed da ma zla ba'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te dang por re zhig mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i man ngag don du gnyer ba'i slob mas zla ba phyed da ma zla ba'am /
translated: Thus it is stated. First, the disciple who seeks the oral instructions of the stage of manifest awakening should please the guru for half a month or a month.

original: dam gyi sgras lo la sogs par yang dag par gus pa'i bsnyen bkur gyis mnyes shing thugs dgyes par bya ste ci nus pa 'dod pa lnga la nye bar longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mchod par yang bya'o //
analyzed: dam gyi sgras lo la sogs par yang dag par gus pa'i bsnyen bkur gyis mnyes shing thugs dgyes par bya ste ci nus pa 'dod pa lnga la nye bar longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mchod par yang bya'o //
translated: One should please and delight him with the service of proper respect, such as with a year and so forth, and also worship him with the characteristic of enjoyment of the five desires to the best of one's ability.

original: de'i rjes la bsnyen bkur dang mchod pa'i rim gyis mnyes par gyur pa de la ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rjes la bsnyen bkur dang mchod pa'i rim gyis mnyes par gyur pa de la ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What should one do after that, having pleased him with the process of service and worship?🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / de la phyag rgya legs par bslabs //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de la phyag rgya legs par bslabs //
translated: One should train well in the seal of that,

original: ci 'byor pa ni 'bul byas nas //
analyzed: ci 'byor pa ni 'bul byas nas //
translated: and having offered what one has,

original: tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor dbus su ni //
analyzed: tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor dbus su ni //
translated: in the center of the maṇḍala of the assembly,

original: cho ga ji bzhin mchod par bya //
analyzed: cho ga ji bzhin mchod par bya //
translated: one should worship according to the rite.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te de'i rjes la de la phyag rgya ste dam tshig gi phyag rgya legs par bslabs shing thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis dam tshig dang sdom pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ci 'byor pa zhes bya ba gang zhig gdol pa dang bco
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te de'i rjes la de la phyag rgya ste dam tshig gi phyag rgya legs par bslabs shing thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis dam tshig dang sdom pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ci 'byor pa zhes bya ba gang zhig gdol pa dang bco
translated: After that, one should train well in the seal of that, the samaya seal, through the process of hearing and so forth, and having perfected the vows and samayas, one should worship according to the rite in the center of the maṇḍala of the assembly, with whatever one has, that is, whatever one possesses, and with whatever one can, that is, whatever one is able to do.

original: blag mkhan gyi rigs su skyes pa dang de med na kha dog gam 'dod pa'i lha mnyes par byed pa'i sgo nas rang gi rigs dang mthun par dbul bar byas te phul nas so //
analyzed: blag mkhan gyi rigs su skyes pa dang de med na kha dog gam 'dod pa'i lha mnyes par byed pa'i sgo nas rang gi rigs dang mthun par dbul bar byas te phul nas so //
translated: One should offer it to the guru, having been born in the family of the sacrificer, or, if that is not available, having pleased the deity of desire by means of color.

original: de'i rjes la bla ma de la tshogs 'khor dbul te tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i dbus su mchod pa bya zhing rjed par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la bla ma de la tshogs 'khor dbul te tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i dbus su mchod pa bya zhing rjed par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should offer the gaṇacakra to that guru, making offerings and honoring in the middle of the gaṇacakra.

original: cho ga bzhin zhes bya ba ni cho ga las ma 'das par ro //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin zhes bya ba ni cho ga las ma 'das par ro //
translated: “According to the rite” means not transgressing the rite.

original: de la cho ga ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la cho ga ni 'di yin te /
translated: The rite is as follows:

original: re zhig dang por nyan thos kyi rigs can ma gtogs pa dge bsnyen dang dge slong dang / rdo rje slob dpon dang rnal 'byor pa rnams pa sogs te de rnams la rim pa bzhin du gdan gding bar bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig dang por nyan thos kyi rigs can ma gtogs pa dge bsnyen dang dge slong dang / rdo rje slob dpon dang rnal 'byor pa rnams pa sogs te de rnams la rim pa bzhin du gdan gding bar bya'o //
translated: First of all, one should lay out seats for the upāsakas, bhikṣus, vajra masters, and yogins, and so on, in order, except for those of the śrāvaka type.

original: de la gral gcig tu bslab pa ji lta bu bzhin du dge slong gi dge 'dun bzhugs su gsol cing de'i 'og tu dge bsnyen gyi @129a * //
analyzed: de la gral gcig tu bslab pa ji lta bu bzhin du dge slong gi dge 'dun bzhugs su gsol cing de'i 'og tu dge bsnyen gyi @129a * //
translated: In that regard, one should request the bhikṣu saṅgha to sit in a row according to the precepts, and after that, the upāsaka

original: tshogs rim pa bzhin du 'dug tu gzhug go //
analyzed: tshogs rim pa bzhin du 'dug tu gzhug go //
translated: The assembly should be seated in order.

original: de'i rjes la rdo rje slob dpon gyi tshogs dge slong gi tshogs kyi mdun gyi gral la bzhugs su gsol /
analyzed: de'i rjes la rdo rje slob dpon gyi tshogs dge slong gi tshogs kyi mdun gyi gral la bzhugs su gsol /
translated: After that, the vajra master should be seated in the row in front of the assembly of monks.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i tshogs ni thams cad kyi gong du bzhugs su gsol ba kho na te rnal 'byor pa dge bsnyen nam dge slong ngam dge tshul ji lta bu yin yang rung ste gong du bzhag pa'i rigs so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i tshogs ni thams cad kyi gong du bzhugs su gsol ba kho na te rnal 'byor pa dge bsnyen nam dge slong ngam dge tshul ji lta bu yin yang rung ste gong du bzhag pa'i rigs so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The assembly of yogins should be seated above all, for the Blessed One has said that yogins, whether lay vow holders, monks, or novices, should be seated above.

original: de'i rjes thogs la sgrub pa po mdun du 'ongs nas phyag byas te go rims bzhin du thams cad kyi rkang pa bkur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes thogs la sgrub pa po mdun du 'ongs nas phyag byas te go rims bzhin du thams cad kyi rkang pa bkur bar bya'o //
translated: After that, the adepts should come forward, bow, and be seated in order.

original: de la rdo rje las kyi ngo bo bsnyen bkur ba gcig bsko bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la rdo rje las kyi ngo bo bsnyen bkur ba gcig bsko bar bya ste /
translated: One should appoint a servant who is the essence of vajra action.

original: der de rnams kyi mdun du bdud brtsi lnga'i chos 'byung gi phyag rgya gru gsum du bya zhing /
analyzed: der de rnams kyi mdun du bdud brtsi lnga'i chos 'byung gi phyag rgya gru gsum du bya zhing /
translated: In front of them, he should make a triangle, the symbol of the source of phenomena, with the five meats.

original: de'i nang du thig le'i gzugs zlum po bya ste de'i nang du me long gi gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang po blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i nang du thig le'i gzugs zlum po bya ste de'i nang du me long gi gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang po blta bar bya'o //
translated: In it one should make a round form of a drop, and in it one should first see the mandala circle like a reflection in a mirror.

original: de'i 'og tu thod pa dum bu gcig pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sa bon gyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i bdud rtsi lngas gang ba gzhag par bya zhing me tog dgram par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu thod pa dum bu gcig pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sa bon gyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i bdud rtsi lngas gang ba gzhag par bya zhing me tog dgram par bya'o //
translated: Then one should place the skull cup with one part, filled with the five nectars consecrated with the seed syllables of the five Tathagatas, and scatter flowers.

original: thod pa'i phyogs gnyis su thod pa gzhan gnyis bzhag ste gcig ni rgun chang gis gang ba /
analyzed: thod pa'i phyogs gnyis su thod pa gzhan gnyis bzhag ste gcig ni rgun chang gis gang ba /
translated: In the two directions of the skull cup one should place two other skull cups, one filled with grape wine,
